campaign.story:
Glory is a dry erase fantasy adventure for 1-4 players that plays in 60-90 minutes. Both sides of your hero board, and every card in the game is dry erasable. On them you will find check boxes to track all sorts of things throughout your game.
Your playing area will expand as you collect coinage, information, goods, abilities, and fate. As your adventure takes you back and forth across the kingdom, you will collect points of glory by defeating monsters and helping towns. Earn 20 glory to win. Along the way, your improving glory score will lead to greater personal power.
Each turn you will roll & move,  add modifiers from cards, choose direction, and potentially expend health to march. Turns are snappy, until someone takes a battle.
There are several decks and types of locations. But when you land on a battle or lair space, the rules shift to dice fighting. 
As you gain glory it progressively becomes harder to gain more. Ergo, you must push yourself to face ever greater challenges. Near the end of the game, players may choose to fight monsters to the death in order to catch up or secure a victory. Is it better to sit back and stay safe, or put everything on the line?
Glory: First Edition runs a 7.8 on boardgamegeek.com with 104 ratings:
The best light weight game on the market in my view. Fast paced, wonderful presentation, balanced and always a fun game.
-Slimeman, 44 games rated

Simple rules, very easy to learn, and a ton of fun to play. There are many paths to victory, so no two sessions are the same…
-raitoning, 82 games rated

Fantastic game with great replay value and love the option of 1 player scenarios as well. Every piece in the box is high quality and hasn't let me down : )
-00Bogey, 26 games rated

Fun light game. Material quality is amazing.
-HerbinLegend, 68 games rated
Solo play uses the same mechanics as multiplayer, but the win condition changes to a race against the fate deck. Each hero has a different scenario to solve with 12 fate cards, drawn once every second turn. Fate spaces become hazards therefore, and 20 glory does not win you the game (but still improves your resources). 

For the adventurer, trouble is coming from the north. Goods normally bought at the castle are in the south-west lair. A dancing danger is available to the south east. Two quests are known. If you visit the both the west and east towns, you gain a coin. But will these benefits help, or are they bait, wasting your precious time? No guts, no glory- but just as true: to the rash, death. You must find the right balance of preparation and boldness, logistics and direct conflict.
 Two Add-Ons are available: 
Dragon Shine cards ($12 USD) and
PVC map ($30 USD).
You can buy these items together by choosing the Deluxe Pledge, saving 14%.
All shipping charged after the campaign in USD

Stretch Goal Progress
a) 19K/20K Kickstarter funds- 95%
b) 117/100 Comments- Complete
c) 1425/1500 Instagram follows- 95%

1.
We now have >100 comments, fulfilling one of the components for our stretch goal, the Steward! We now need ~$4500 CAD and 220 instagram follows to finish unlocking him... 

...if only there were some way to help...

We now have a stretch goal target! Our last update promised that we would create a stretch goal to pursue once we reached $15,000. We are now at that point. 

Our stretch goal is a 9th hero. Read on to find out more about him and how to unlock him.

This new hero is the Steward. He is a short red-headed (and moustached) custodian of the castle. He is himself a hero, but as castle custodian, really he is empowered by other heroes doing well. This theme is expressed through his special ability and two starting goods. His power increases (only) when has at least 10 glory. Despite his low power in the early stages of the game, he has great quality of life because his movement going to and from the castle is hugely facilitated by his Ambassador's Documents. His Empathy Stone represents his ability to grow from witnessing the good fortune of others.

Deeper dive into they 'why' behind Glory, and what makes it fun.
If and when we get to $15,000 CAD, I will make an announcement about a single stretch goal. 
Enjoy the video!

Thank you!

With the funding secured through this Kickstarter, Hogg Publishing is able to expand the print run for Glory 2E originally founded by Glory 1E customers in Dec 2020. 

Maximum gratitude to every backer! Looking forward to the next update...

Hello Adventurers! 
Finally, we made it, the Pledge Manager is open! 
Within the next 24 hours, all of our backers will receive an email with an invite to the Pledge Manager. Please, check your emails, the ones you used to back this Kickstarter, including all folders and spam. If you did not get anything by the end of that 24 hours, please contact us under this email:

Hello Adventurers!
We know that you're waiting for that Pledge Manager to open. We had to run some additional tests, and the Pledge Manager will be up tomorrow, on Tuesday, June the 8th. But it's not so bad, it gives us time to inform you of everything you need to know and to answer any of your questions. 

Gamefound is the platform we use, so you can expect an email with an invite from them. Please note that Gamefound will send you the message to the email address you used to back this Kickstarter. Remember to check all your folders and spam if you don't see it on the main page. What's more, it can take up to 24 hours to send out all the emails, so if you don't have anything by the end of that period, feel free to message us. You can contact us either via a or email at .

Hello Adventurers,
this time is not Monika typing, but me - Lord Bulbo - using my tentacles. 
Free Lich Miniature
We are slowly gearing towards launching Pledge Manager in about 2 weeks from now. Before that happens, you can get one more extra free miniature. The mysterious Lich.

Hello Woodhaven Citizens!

First of all, a big THANK YOU to each and every one of our 9014 Backers! 

It's been a wild ride, and what a pleasure it was to share it with you! We appreciate the time and support you've given us throughout the campaign. We've hit so many fantastic Stretch Goals, many of which were also your ideas and suggestions. This campaign would literally not be the same without you! So, once again, huge thanks to the whole Dungeons & Lasers community! We truly couldn't be more grateful!

campaign.story:
THIS IS AN UNPARALLELED AGE. A galactic age.
An age of bounty hunters, vagrants and bleeding-heart outlaws.
This is the NEW REBEL ERA, and the only thing worth a damn is the sweat off your back, the bullet in your chamber and the fuel in your tank. The galaxy is a lawless expanse, known as the FRONTIER GALAXY, and you are an INTERSTELLAR OUTLAW. Together with YOUR SHIP and YOUR CREW you have to eke out a living in the Frontier Galaxy, and chase down the intergalactic dream of freedom and success.
ORBITAL BLUES is a new lo-fi space western roleplaying game from SoulMuppet Publishing, written by Sam Sleney & Zachary Cox.  A roleplaying love-letter to off-beat sci-fi, vintage music, and cooperative old-school styled roleplay, Orbital Blues allows you to play out rules-light tabletop adventures in the style of space westerns such as Cowboy Bebop, Firefly and Guardians of the Galaxy.
Stepping into the shoes of Interstellar Outlaws, players band together to form Crews, and navigate a hard-going, gig-economy living on the fringes of a space-faring society.
Developed on the critically acclaimed rules-lite system of Best Left Buried, Orbital Blues uses a simple D6 based system with 3 basic stats - MUSCLE, GRIT, and SAVVY - to handle rolls and uncertainty - putting the narrative and relationships of the player characters at the heart of play without the baggage of hefty mechanics, classes or roles. 
In addition to the three core stats, characters also have GAMBITS, and TROUBLES. Gambits are a measure of a character's special talents or unique abilities, whilst Troubles track the heartbreaks, set-backs and blues that Interstellar Outlaws gather around them on their adventures in a difficult universe.  With these simple values and a wealth of gambits and troubles in the core book, players can build a wide variety of unique, storied characters to explore the Frontier Galaxy. 
Working together, Crews generate a scrappy ship to call home, and must balance their Credits & Debts  in order to stay afloat. Whether it's knowing how they'll pay for a bowl of bell peppers and beef, or where they'll find another clip for their 9mm, the session-by-session play of Orbital Blues is driven by  the rollercoaster lives of Interstellar Outlaws and the work they have to constantly seek out.
Whether it's hauling salvage across back-water systems or getting boots on the ground sniffing out the Frontier Galaxy's most dangerous bounties, the core book of Orbital Blues is brimming with generators, adventure hooks, play prompts and even a sand-box setting for storytellers to get memorable campaigns going, whilst player characters contend with their own interpersonal relationships and troubles. 

Orbital Blues is a 120-Page Trade 6"x9"Hardback Book,  with writing and creative direction from Sam Sleney and Zachary Cox, furnished with stunning art from Josh Clark and layout work from Lone Archivist. Edited by Jared Sinclair, Orbital Blues is tight, stylish roleplaying package for all your lo-fi, sci-fi needs. 
We're printing Orbital Blues with two alternative covers; the standard Day cover, saturated with the big blue sky and the desert dust,  and a Kickstarter-exclusive night-mode cover for those who like to keep their book collections subtle and sophisticated. 
Day Cover
*WIP - As a Kickstarter Exclusive we really want this one to shine...
We use a size slightly larger than A5, Trade (6" x 9") across all of our books, to help us stuff more goodness into each page. The hardcover books are planned to be offset, allowing us to feature higher-quality paper, smyth-sewn bindings and all kinds of bells, whistles and ribbons with additional funding.
The internals of the book are being beautifully laid out by Lone Archivist, incorporating art, text and tables seamlessly into visually stunning and easy to navigate pages and spreads.
Spread pages from Crew Ship Generation.
A spread from The Sutler System, a sandbox adventure included in the core book.
As for shipping physical books,  US Distribution will be handled via Exalted Funeral, and the UK & RoW distribution will be handled in house by the SoulMuppet Publishing team. If the campaign is successful and exceeds expectations, we've got specialist fulfilment contractors in place to help fulfil and navigate shipping.
 For backers who pledge for the PDF version, we’ve successfully distributed files via DriveThruRPG and Kickstarter previously and are confident we can do it again.

This campaign aims to fulfil orders for a print-run of Orbital Blues. At the time of writing, the manuscript is finished, gone through extensive playtesting with a public playtest beta, and is currently being laid out - we're just looking to get it finalised and printed in the quality it deserves, and into your hands. We have pledges for the core book at .PDF and Physical Hardback tiers to deliver on this plan.  
Followers of SoulMuppet Publishing know the work and care that's been put into our flagship game, Best Left Buried. With Orbital Blues, we're looking to do the same for sci-fi roleplaying as we did for dark fantasy roleplaying with BLB. We want to make a modern, robust,  and affordable game with a lifetime of support and releases.  Once this Kickstarter funds, we'll immediately start enacting plans to give this game the same longevity, support and accessibility that Best Left Buried enjoys.
To stay true to the vintage music roots that inspired the game, we've also collaborated with musician and tabletop writer Chris Bissette to create a  cassette tape LP of music from the universe of Orbital Blues, with Chris performing as the fictional band The Deltas. The tape comes beautifully packaged in a crimson red rave case with an small adventure on the case insert. You can pick the tape up with your book in our Bounty Hunter pledge.
If you're eager to dive into our visions and the sounds of Orbital Blues, Creative Director Sam has compiled a living playlist of music, containing tracks and artists that inspired the writing, creation and atmosphere of Orbital Blues.
 Music has been a huge influence in the writing of Orbital Blues, and Sam has curated this playlist to reflect the sounds and styles that have imbued the project with so much life. We have no affiliation with any of the artists in this playlist (though if anyone knows anyone, hook us up... - S) and it's purely a curation of tracks that inspired the making of the book. You can listen and follow on spotify here, and you can expect updates to the playlist whenever we have pen to paper in the future.

With Orbital Blues already sitting pretty as a completed product, and now funded, the only way is up. We're looking to support Orbital Blues as a flagship game here at SoulMuppet Publishing, and we know the best way to do that is with more adventures and expansions to the core book. Along with additional art and higher production values, each incremental amount raised for this campaign after we hit goal will fund further material from guest writers. Depending on how far we go after funding, we'll also look at adding additional tiers with extra merch. Keep an eye on the tracker below!
Onwards and upwards, and as we approach the final 24 hours of this campaign, we're setting our sights on one last stretch goal - an upgrade to the cassettes that so many of you have pledged for. How much can you upgrade a 60 year-old storage medium, we hear you wonder. Well, at 700% funding we'll be;
Adding Limited Edition Orbital Blues Guitar Picks to each Cassette
Putting more content on the inlays
Adding an A6 Tri-fold Scenario to every Cassette
We're looking into ensuring the Cassettes are of the highest quality, so even if you don't have a tape player, they will still make for stylish display pieces in their own right. Currently we're looking at BandCDs to fulfil the cassette prints, and you can see a portfolio of their work below - we're confident the Orbital Blues Cassette will be a gorgeous compliment to an already stunning game.

Upon reaching £60,000, we're proud to announce we'll be putting this additional funding towards adding the talented Basheer Ghouse to our roster of contributing writers on Orbital Blues, with one last job...
 The job was simple. Run the briefcase to the Rock of Tariq, make sure no-one opens it, and get the sort of pay-out that crews retire on. The journey wasn't exactly safe, but for that sort of money, who cares?
Yet when you arrived at the Rock, you found your employer dead and no-one able to pay you.
Now half a dozen factions want the cargo, and most of them are willing to kill to get it. Now you're in a race against time. Figure out what's going on, offload your cargo, and get out of there. Or else you'll join the growing list of bodies on the infamous Rock of Tariq.
Basheer  (@BasheerGhouse) is a writer and cultural consultant based out of San Jose, California. In addition to work for companies like Kobold Press and Rowan, Rook, and Deckard, he's independently published RPGs that range from absurdist comedy to collaborative horror. His contributions can be found in products like Alien Archive 4, Warlock Grimoire 2, and Spire: Shadow Operations, and his personal work can be found at his itch.io page.
For us, Basheer is delivering a pulp pressure cooker of an adventure, where Interstellar Outlaw Crews will find themselves pitted against dangerous opponents in a high-risk, high-stakes, and high-reward play of intrigue and action.
In reaching 50k, we're confident in announcing that a set 4 Orbital Blues dice will now be included with all Interstellar Kingpin pledges. This will not increase the price on that pledge.
We'll have some proofs of the dice with us within the week, but rest assured, they're just as glossy and polished as the rest of the project.
If you want to pick up these dice outside of the Interstellar Kingpin pledge, they'll be available in the post-campaign pledge manager for add-ons.
Upon hitting £45,000 in funding, we've added Giuliano Roverato (@KnightRamen) to our ever-growing team of contributing writers! Giuliano is a Brazilian narrative designer that lives for good food, tough choices and exploring weird dungeons forgotten on the corners of our reality. Best known for the culinary adventure, Bakto’s Terrifying Cuisine, he is wondering if the post-fantasy RPG Brave Zenith will ever see the light of day. Oh, and he really wants to write a bossanova inspired adventure for Orbital Blues too, so let's hear about what he has in store for us!
"I want to see the golden shores of my old home, feel its warm sands on my feet, hear the bittersweet melodies, the ones sang to me in bedtime stories by sobbing workers. Day and night the people of Tradis station toil away, forced to clean the planet-side wasteland that the corp calls the “future of living.”
We are tired, angry and dying. We have nostalgia for a home that is unknown to us. This is not a strike. This a call for help. Bring us home, outlaws. Chega de Saudade."

In Giuliano's stirring exploration of themes of home, nostalgia, place and being, Interstellar Outlaw Crews will visit Tradis station and discover the meaning of Saudade, know the plight of its workers, and be tempted by corporate money beyond their wildest dreams. Here, you can’t save everyone.

Thought-provoking and emotive, Giuliano's pitch is one we're incredibly excited for, and we're thrilled to have him onboard.
 Music is a key part of Orbital Blues, and we want to make sure that comes across in a full and proper way. At 400% funding, we've commissioned Chris to further extend the EP Cassette by a third, adding 3 all-new, original tracks to the runtime on both the cassette itself, and in the MP3 collection. These tracks will be perfect for use as background in your games, as atmospheric cornerstones or rip-roaring soundtracks to the adventures of Interstellar Outlaws.
At £35,000, we added the work of Tom Mecredy to Orbital Blues' roster of adventures, providing an open, sandbox-styled storyteller's toolkit adventure for your games of Orbital Blues.
Placeholder!
 You'll have seen Hagstrom's glossy ads, with their smiling, weather-beaten workers mopping their brows, or relaxing in sleek habitation units, surrounded by their enthusiastic families. You'll have also heard the rumours that Hagstrom's workers are actually indentured to the company, forced to pay off their passage with hard graft. Wollaston's Hold is only a jump away - spool up the drive, and find out the truth.
All That Glitters pitches your outlaws into a system full of trouble - a corporate cold war is about to turn hot, revolutionary workers are amassing arms to throw off their oppressive masters, and an ambitious pirate queen is looking to pull off an audacious bullion heist. Keep a hand on your gun, don't trust anyone, and you might just make it out in one piece.

Tom Mecredy (@TomMecredy) is a writer and game designer based in the north of England, drawing upon his passion for history and Cold War espionage thrillers to weave tangled conspiracies and revolutions across the stars.  Tom's recent work includes High Speed Low Drag, an introspective, solo-play experience about going to war and the effects it has on soldiers, and Condotto, a Forged in the Dark game about running a company of mercenaries in 14th century Italy.
All That Glitters adds a true sandbox experience to Orbital Blues' adventure roster, with a variety of Factions, NPCs and jobs for crews to engage with - it's a style of play that fans of games such as Blades in the Dark will be familiar with, and we're super excited to see it added it to the ever-growing library of supplemental content storytellers can utilise for Orbital Blues.
Upon reaching £30,000, we added Momatoes to our writing team! Momatoes (@momatoes) is a Filipina game and graphic designer who has written RPGs about memory, legacy, and the dear price wizards pay for their ambition. Her biggest project, ARC, is a rules-light, tension-heavy RPG that’s coming to Kickstarter in 2021 and is one of Dicebreaker’s “must-play” upcoming RPGs. For her stretch goal, Momatoes plans on writing a confounding yet compelling mystery wrapped around a deeply human heart. Not a literal heart, though… unless…? 
Placeholder!
 Alexin Arius was a pioneer, an eccentric inventor who built wondrous automatons and augments. Now, decades after their disappearance, a desperate sheriff hires a crew of Interstellar Outlaws for what looks to be a straightforward bounty: track Alexin in a promising new location, the long-forgotten Everjoy space station and amusement park.
But not all is what it seems, and the supposedly abandoned Everjoy is steeped in endless mystery. Rust and decay run rampant - but why does the jingle still play over the stale air? No customer had set foot in its towering rides or souvenir shops for years - but why do the animatronic mascots still greet you with a smile? And the wide-eyed children who watch you from edges and corners - who are they, and what secrets lurk in the utopia they’ve built?
Visit Everjoy now, where the good times must never end.

Momatoes' EVERJOY adventure will now be available in .PDF, and will be distributed, fully illustrated, along with Sinta Posadas' A STARBORN RESISTANCE, once the core book has shipped, ensuring that everyone will have a nice shiny core book to run their adventures with! We can't wait to see what Momatoes has in store for us, and what else the future may bring for Orbital Blues!
We've received nothing but kind words and praise for our art direction, so as such we're taking the leap to collect all the creative energies that have made this project a reality, with Wayward Stars: The Art of Orbital Blues. A coffee table art book in miniature (we're looking at 6" x 9" A5 horizontal) Wayward Stars will delve into the artistic process, world-building and step-by-step explorations of how a tabletop game's art is made, with words from Josh Clark.
Placeholder!
A deep-dive into the worldbuilding of Orbital Blues.
Wayward Stars will be available as an add-on, or available in the WAYWARD STAR, SPACE COWBOY 2 or INTERSTELLAR KINGPIN pledge levels, and physical copies of Wayward Stars will ship alongside core books in August 2021.
Postcards from the Frontier Galaxy were our first stretch goal,  available from £15,000. These will be included free at all pledges levels of Space Cowboy and above. We're polling 12 pieces of art to decide 3 final pieces, and Bounty Hunter pledges will receive a collection of all 3. Interstellar Outlaw pledges will get 2 of the postcards, and Space Cowboy pledges will receive one.  These Print Postcards will add no additional costs to pledges or shipping. 
At £20,000 we added the talented Sinta Posadas to our writing team! Sin Posadas (@diwataMANILA) is a game designer and illustrator obsessed with the galaxy and all of its possible tragedies that lie in wait, just out of reach. 
Sin has pitched us an adventure called A STARBORN RESISTANCE, which we'll be releasing in .PDF form.
Placeholder Cover.
Varis X-0 was once a gleaming jewel in the crown of the Wings of Valor Confederacy. The Confederacy constructed "Harvester Homes" of the Scintilla Commune, a string of asteroid belts fitted onto an intra-atmospheric nuclear power harvester, home to any colonist willing to risk their necks for the promise of cheap lodging and a regular wage.  
After a cheaper extraction method was found a few million light years away, the Confederacy abandoned the system, leaving the Harvester Homes to rust. These days, it's just a few Interstellar Outlaws trying to keep the place afloat: salvaging equipment, finding food and power, fighting off bandits and worse. In this delapidated backwater, communities need help to keep things afloat. But what happens when a representative of the Confederacy returns, promising to restore glory to the Scintilla? At what cost? To what end for the Confederacy? And what's in it for you?

Upon reaching £20,000 in funding, A Starborn Resistance began development, and will release as a .PDF adventure shortly after the release of the physical Orbital Blues core rulebook in August 2021. Should we reach levels of funding to commission a several contributing writers, we'll compile their works into a compilation for physical release later in the year.

Orbital Blues is a SoulMuppet Publishing Production, but it has been brought about by a crack-team of independent talent to make something fresh & exciting. Here's the run-down on who's who.

Sam Sleney (@samsleney) is a freelance writer, and Creative Director for First Falling Leaf Publishing. Orbital Blues is Sam's manuscript and creative vision, born out of a lifetime love of space westerns, and being raised on the records of Bruce Springsteen in lieu of a father figure.  Together with artistic realisations from Josh Clark and the mechanical mind of Zachary Cox, Sam has fused the team's talent into the Interstellar Blues Explosion that is Orbital Blues. 

Josh Clark (@tinywoodsman) is an artist and creator who has worked on everything from album covers to business cards and video games to podcast art. His work can be seen in First Falling Leaf's "Sins: Dead City ", From Sorrow To Serenity's "Trifecta EP Project" and in the worldbuilding booklet "The Quiet Future". He can be found at TinyWoodsman. As our lead artist, Josh brought the world & creative vision of Orbital Blues to life from the Day 1, and made the project what it is today. 

Zachary Cox (@JellyMuppet) is the Managing Partner of SoulMuppet Publishing, dabbling in everything from printing, distribution, management and social media. The original creator of Best Left Buried, Zach has contributed to the mechanical writing and masterminded improvements on Best Left Buried's engine for Orbital Blues, adapting the original SRD and mechanics to perfectly accompany lo-fi, space western roleplay.
Jared Sinclair (@infinite_mao) is an editor and sometime writer of games and games-related material. His work as a writer includes Anti-Sisyphus, What's So Cool About Outer Space?, Prismot!, and The Vanilla Game. He also runs Spear Witch, an independent online bookstore specializing in small-creator game books and zines. As our editor, Jared cut the manuscript of Orbital Blues into shape, making it into a lean, cohesive and accessible book that cuts right to the heart of thematic play. 

Lone Archivist (@LoneArchivist) is a game and graphic designer based out of Southern California. His work includes writing and design for a handful of third-party modules for games such as Mothership and Best Left Buried as well as several self-published system-agnostic game supplements. When not working on games he can be found crate-digging for a new Jazz record or adding yet another book to the TBR list. Lone is currently hard at working coalescing the manuscript, art and style of Orbital Blues into a tight, stylish and striking print. 

Chris Bissette (@Pangalactic) is a Manchester-based game designer and musician. His game The Wretched - along with its original soundtrack - was selected as one of Tabletop Gaming Magazine's Best Games of 2020 and has spawned hundreds of games using its Wretched & Alone engine. Chris is performing as the fictional band The Deltas on their debut Cassette LP, Orbital Blues, which you can pick up alongside the core rulebook as a keynote piece. You can find Chris' music, games, and more at LootTheRoom. 

Sin is the designer of the Planted RPG series, a small collection of tabletop rpgs where you play as sentient plants defending your homes from evil bugs. Their other works include explorations into your deepest fears in the Deep, Deep River, fanciful food trips in Lutong Banwa, and playing out the dramatics of being agents of a Tower racing against the Apocalypse in Navathem's End. They're currently working to complete Navathem's End after it was successfully funded as part of the recently concluded #OurShores Kickstarter campaign. You can find their other melancholic games here, on their itch.io page. Sin will be writing A Starborn Resistance, an adventure for Orbital Blues achieved as a stretch goal. 

Momatoes (@momatoes) is a Filipina game and graphic designer who has written RPGs about memory, legacy, and the dear price wizards pay for their ambition. Her biggest project, ARC, is a rules-light, tension-heavy RPG that’s coming to Kickstarter in 2021 and is one of Dicebreaker’s “must-play” upcoming RPGs.  Momatoes will be writing EVERYJOY, an Orbital Blues adventure that we unlocked as a stretch goal.

Orbital Blues began life as an internal passion project, that snowballed into release through enthusiasm and available connections in lockdown. We're looking to diversify the team for Orbital Blues with immediate stretch goals for writers and contributors from a greater wealth of backgrounds than the core team, and will be adding such individuals here once we've hired them at competitive rates. If you're interested in writing for Orbital Blues, get in touch here, with writing samples, pitches or portfolios.

We've had a few people now from various parts of the world asking for more detailed shipping information so they can make an informed decision about pledging. When you take Brexit, the global pandemic and shipping delays, and add them to the fact SoulMuppet Publishing only has experience in smaller scale print-runs from calmer times, it's been hard to make estimated guesses on the prices of shipping for a project that's shaping up to be this successful. However, we've gone away, done our homework, made some enquiries and ran some numbers, and below are our current shipping estimates.
We'll update this image where it appears on the main campaign body actively whenever anything changes.

Risks and challenges
With our book already being in final stages of completion and this Kickstarter serving as a means of production, we don't have any concerns for the completion of this project. As we already navigated the fulfilments in previous campaigns such as Best Left Buried: Deeper and Stygian Library, we also don't have any concerns regarding deliveries and distributions. If anything changes with the global situation it will only serve to speed up our estimated times of delivery.

campaign.story:
You are Casey Cricket, unchallenged King of Banter here at Olympic Academy. Your best friend is Lindsey Lacrosse and you get into all sorts of scraps together. But what will happen when you learn Lindsey has a crush on Ryan Rugby, just like you do? And can it be true that Taylor Tug O’War has it in for you ever since you stole his act at the Talent Show? Anyway, you can’t worry about that now, Camilla Croquet has challenged you to a showdown after school! You’ve got to play this off just right if you want to keep up your ultra-cool but likeable reputation and make it to the Paris Olympics after you graduate.
The Game
Preparing for Paris is a game of personified sports as teenagers at Olympic Academy all vying trying to graduate top of the class to become part of the Paris Olympic Games. It is a game of drama, hijinks and wild fun.
What story will you tell at Olympic Academy?
Play as one of 5 available discontinued sports, each with their own strengths, quirks and flaws. Choose from Cricket, Croquet, Lacrosse, Rugby and Tug O’War!
  Play a series of minigames that you choose - from the first day of school, through the lunch room and detention, all the way to prom and graduation.
  Ask provocative questions and build scenes with your fellow players during each minigame. Then roll to discover your outcome; anything from total success to hilarious failure!
  Accrue Chums, Cred and Connections to see who’s going to Paris after Graduation Day!
  No Game Master or Facilitator required, and no preparation in advance either, making it quick and easy to get this game to the table.
  Play the whole story in just one or two sittings, perfect for oneshots and highly replayable for fun time and again!
  And even more content if we hit our stretch goals!
The Goods
After we score a goal with this Kickstarter, you will receive a 40 page PDF with 5 character playbooks, beautifully laid out by Maria Mison. Both the game text and playbooks have been edited from version 1.0 to create an easier and more intuitive play experience. An example of play has also been included to help you jump into the game right away!
First draft of a front cover, NOT FINAL
Sample layout by Maria, NOT FINAL, but still looks so cool right!?
You can see more of Maria’s work here!
Nerd in Chief
 Hi! I’m Logan Timmins, a transgender, Australian tabletop gaming nerd. I have been playing and running tabletop games of all sorts for years, and also publishing my own on my itch store. I have 12 games of all genres and types under my belt, and I'm excited to bring another fun and unique game to you! I like to make games that empower the players to tell meaningful and memorable stories, and I have grown a lot as a designer since publishing my first game.
You can find more of my tabletop games here: https://breathingstories.itch.io/
You can also hear me talk about my game design process on Yes Indie'd Pod and on my Twitter.
I want to thank Christopher W Reynolds of ninjaHELL! Productions and Okashicon for running the game design contest this game was originally written for.
I am proud to say Preparing for Paris was a finalist in this contest, with a final placing of third! 
A bronze medal, in Olympic terms!
Why a Kickstarter?
Preparing for Paris is currently available on my itch as a PDF but I want to make it more beautiful for the people who are loving it and will love it in the future. I need your help to make this game the best it can be! I want you to have this fun, drama-filled game as enjoyable to look at as it is to play.
The majority of funds raised will go to paying Maria for her work, with the remaining covering Kickstarter fees and some 'just in case' funds.
The System
Preparing for Paris is heavily inspired by Powered by the Apocalypse games, as well as the Firebrands Framework by Meguey and Vincent Baker. No facilitator or Game Master (GM) is required, just you and 2-4 friends! P4P also requires no preparation beforehand, you can just read the rules and dive right in.
What it borrows from PbtA is the degrees of success. This makes rolls and consequences more interesting and gives players more of a choice in how their character is affected by circumstances beyond a mere 'you succeed' or 'you lose'. During each minigame, after setting the scene, you will roll 2 six-sided dice and add your relevant stat (either Fame, Fortune or Fans). Add it all together to see how well you do, and narrate on your own terms how it all turns out.
Learn more about PbtA here and find the original PbtA game Apocalypse World here!
What is borrowed from Firebrands is the use of minigames and poignant questions to drive the story telling. During the game, players will choose minigames to play (anything from 'Go Viral' and 'Throw a Party' to 'Class' and 'Detention') and ask questions of fellow players that create drama, tension, and close relationships.
Play continues through the various minigames until the climax at Senior Prom, it will surely be a night to remember…
Find the original Firebrands game Mobile Frame Zero: Firebrands here.
Stretch Goals
$1,000 - New Character Option! - UNLOCKED! Introducing Fire Hockey, the most overlooked of the 4 Hockey siblings. (**Fire Hockey is originally called Pelota Purepecha and is from Native Mexican culture. As such I will be hiring a sensitivity reader from Salt and Sage Books to ensure the character options are not harmful in any way.)
$1,500 - Pay bump! - UNLOCKED! Both Maria and I will get a pay rise to help us continue creating things we love and enjoy. Support your indies!
$2,000 - New Character Option! - UNLOCKED Check out the new kid on the block called ESports. Seems different to the rest, and some wonder if Olympic Academy is even the place for them...
$2,500 - Form-Fillable Character Playbooks and a New Monitor! - UNLOCKED This epic stretch goal will unlock 2 awesome things! Firstly, I will be able to hire excellent graphic designer and tabletop game creator Vee Hendro to make the character playbooks form-fillable! This will allow users to edit the playbooks on their laptop or other compatible devices, so no need to print them out or take notes on a separate document! Everyone who backed at a level at which to receive the Preparing for Paris PDF (or higher) will receive these form-fillable playbooks.
Secondly this stretch goal will allow me (Logan) to buy a monitor to expand my workspace. As I've continued to create games, work on projects, and be on streams it has become more and more necessary to have a second screen. If we hit this goal I will be able to buy a new monitor and even pay for shipping!
$3,000 - More Minigames! At this extremely excellent stretch goal, I will be able to hire 3 indie tabletop game designers to write one brand new minigame each! I'm so excited to work with these awesome folks and pay forward the support you've shown me. Each designer will be paid $0.20AUD/word or $100AUD, whichever is higher. Our wonderful guest designers will be an awesome team of Aussies; Mitchell Salmon, Pidj Sorensen and Steve Dee!

updates.update_content:
Hey, it's me again!
I've been so grateful for the response to Preparing for Paris so far, and thoroughly enjoying the Superstar playthroughs. On one such playthrough, with the brand new finished rules document, I noticed a handful of small errors my eyes had missed the first time.
Not to worry! I've gone and gotten those fixed and now present the new-new finished rules doc! You should have arriving in your email inbox soon, an invitation to the drive on which both the palybooks and rules text are stored.

Yup, that's right, Preparing for Paris is complete!
New edits? Done.
Bonus content? Done.
Guest designer minigames? Done.
Beautiful layout? Done.

That's right folks, the final layout work is done!!
And may I just say, it's beautiful. I'm so extremely blown away by the amazing work Maria has done, taking my plain google doc and turning into a game that is just as fun to read through as it is to play!

Hello everyone!
Been a while since my last update as I didn't have anything particularly exciting to announce.
But! That changes today!

The final manuscript is done!!
That's right! All the new content, the new minigames, new character playbooks, example of play, it's all come together. All the fresh edits have been made, spelling has been checked.
Wow. I can't believe it's all done.

Hello everyone! Would you look at that, it's already October.

That means the final manuscript of Preparing for Paris, complete with 7 new character options and 3 new minigames, plus edits of the existing content is to be finished in mere days!

Hi Everyone!
Golly, look at that, September is nearly over! 
Things are still chugging away here post-Kickstarter. Most recently I received my first sensitivity reading report.

Hey everyone!
It's now been 2 weeks since the Preparing for Paris Kickstarter ended, which means everyone's pledges have been collected and the money is on its way to my account so I can pay everyone who is working with me!
Preparing for Paris itself is nearly done, all the new character playbooks are complete, as well as 2 of the 3 guest designer minigames. The playbooks were such fun to write! I did research for each one to draw on for the playbooks and that lead to some really interesting discoveries, like did you know Competitive Heavy Metal Knitting is a real life thing?!

campaign.story:
Eons ago, the sky shattered and something ate the moon and stars. We were left with only our sun, our small cluster of planets, and a new, twisted moon. Something, birthed from the sky-eater, fell to our planet and began to twist and warp it.
It was the end of our world before anyone living now can remember.
Many generations later, the remnants of our people wander the twisted land and fight the bioluminescent night-crawling creatures as they search the ruins of our castles and cities for ancient magic and technology to help us survive. The brave and hopeful of us work to keep our pocket-sized towns together and alive.
Now, so many years after our stars were devoured, you head into the world with a gun at your side.
I hope you find what you’re looking for.
With your friend, a gun, at your side...
GUN&SLINGER is an RPG about a weapon and a wanderer. A Maestro and two players (Gun and Slinger) set out into a dead planet mutated by a god's forgotten child and hunt strange bounties, investigate the world, and unlock hidden powers. During play, they seek to learn the nature of what’s hunting the Slinger, figure out why the Gun is sentient, and discover how the world died.
Key Features:
Tell the story of a post-magic world and the people working together to survive.
Explore the nature of a twisted reality and a force that hunts the players.
Use Two different playstyles for the Gun and the Slinger with unique capabilities and mechanics.
Answer Questions & Prompts at the table to establish a bespoke setting to adventure in.
You can be a magical, sentient gun.
 Rewards: 
 $12 gets you the final full-color PDF.
 $20 gets you the completed full-color paperback & a digital copy of the PDF.
 $100 gets you all of the above AND an exciting, secret note in your book.
 All backers get their names put in a Special Thanks section in the book.
 All physical tiers get a sticker included in their order!
book mockup, final cover may vary. cover art by Sadia Bies
 GUN&SLINGER in podcasts! 
I’ve had the absolute pleasure of guesting on a few awesome podcasts to talk about and play GUN&SLINGER! If you’re lookin’ for a fix of G&S, or some extra info on the design, then check these out!
 Party of One with Jeff Stormer
 Game Closet with Taylor LaBresh
 Rollin’ Bones with Ryan Howard
Give ‘em a listen and share with your friends!
In GUN&SLINGER, the player-characters are bound together by fate, promises, and magic. One of them fills the role of the Slinger, the other embodies the Gun.
A Slinger that’s hunted by evil
The Slinger is a wanderer, looking for something in this twisted world. They’ve been touched by the Twist and can pull on it for power. They must be careful, though- if they pull on the Twist too much, they’ll lose themselves in it.
Being marked, they are hunted by something- a strange, horrifying creature of the Twist’s design. During setup and through play, you decide as a table what this creature is and bring it into scenes using the Maestro’s moves.
A Gun that’s more than a Gun
The Gun may live in a shell of cold steel, but they were not always this way. During setup and through play, you learn about the Gun’s past and how they became trapped in this new body of violence.
The Gun may not have arms or legs, but that doesn’t make them unable to affect the world around them. The Gun can use their connection with the remaining elements of Magic in the world to, well, do magic! The runes engraved on their body shape the form of their connection and, in turn, their spells. They can also reach into an ethereal plane of magic that resides alongside the physical realm to move and manipulate things.
A sample of the Gun’s character sheet
Each player in GUN&SLINGER interacts with the mechanics differently, all the way down to their stats. Take a look at the section of the Gun’s sheet above. The three starting stats are intentionally a little bit vague for a couple of reasons.
 G&S encourages players to be flexible with stat definitions. The way you approach a situation should dictate what stat it uses, and vise-versa. The Gun could attempt to intimidate people with any of these stats, it’s just up to you to decide how that looks!
 G&S also allows players to, as they progress, create their own stats. In one playtest, a player gave their Slinger the Stat “The Bigger I Am” and used it as an opposite to “Light On My Toes”. Any time they did something bull-headed or with a physical presence, they’d use this new Stat and force their way through.
The way the stats are named in G&S gives you quite a bit of insight into the character they portray all while setting a tone and giving flexibility. You’ve got a 2 in “I've Been Around”. What’s that mean to you? Do you know about the local flora? Can you navigate easily to places you've never been to? That’s up to you, Slinger.
In GUN&SLINGER, all conflict is resolved using a deck of playing cards. When a player wants to do something under pressure or with an uncertain outcome, The Maestro presents them with how difficult it'll be to do, and the players need to figure out how best to overcome the challenge.
In order to solve the problems they face on their quest to help fix their broken world, they’ll need to tap into the cards they have (through imaginative game-mechanical twists on Go Fish and Blackjack), their stats, and any other tools they happen to have at their disposal.
As you venture through the world, tackle problems, and fight monsters, you’ll get to change your stats and rework the game into something that’s truly your own. 
GUN&SLINGER comes with a unique post-post apocalypse setting replete with room to be shaped into something special as your group plays through it. Elements are defined to a certain extent, then ways for you to create specifics or changes are outlined and some examples are given.
It’s a world of hope and struggle, mutated by the forgotten child of an unknowable god that ate the stars, leaving behind only your sun, some neighboring planets, and a new moon of strange energy that never leaves the sky. There are aesthetic elements and keystones provided in the book, and some facts about the nature of things like The Twist and Magic are established, then everyone playing is given some prompts and free reign over making this setting something all their own.
One playtest took place in a desert land with demons, industry, and gold being key aesthetics. Another was in rolling planes with a never-ending storm, strange new flora, and magic soaking into the planet through the rain.
A sample of these setting elements: The Twist is a force that mutates the planet for unknown reasons.
The Maestro controls the world and works with the players to bring it life. They create challenges, intrigue, and consequences for the players based on their actions. They have the use of a very unique and powerful threat in the form of two Joker cards that can bring an intense sense of pressure and immediacy to any situation. Finally, they also interact with the Go Fish and Pairs mechanics differently and have a unique list of Moves they can make whenever they’re able to afford the cost.
There are systems currently in the works to allow GUN&SLINGER to be played without a Maestro.
Calling The Thing That Hunts using Joker cards
The Maestro’s Face Moves
Why Kickstarter?
I want GUN&SLINGER to be the best thing it can be. I’ve spent a lot of time working on the game, and I want to turn it into a physical thing with a level of quality and production that I feel it deserves. I’m here on Kickstarter with this project to raise the money to pay a fantastic team the money they deserve so we can make something kick-ass.
Our goals & challenges
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise $4,350 to give the product a final physical form, complete with graphic design and art. The final product will be a 40+-page full-color paperback, with professionally-done layout and visceral artwork.
Here is our estimated budget for creating GUN&SLINGER.
 $1,450 for writing, game design, sensitivity consulting, and editing.
 $1,800 for layout and art (lots of art!)
 $300 for printing from Mixam Press.
 $350 as a just-in-case cash reserve.
 $450 for Kickstarter’s fees and credit card processing.
This brings us to $4,350 needed to make this book a reality.
The Team
Nevyn Holmes is a game designer based out of central Texas. He's best known for his work on Skel-IT-ons and User Is Typing//Message Sent. When he's not designing games, Nevyn loves to read & play ‘em! He also owns & operates the indie game analysis & review website, Indie Bytes! He can often be found shitposting on twitter dot com.
Emma Harvey is a traditional artist and comic book writer. She is excited to help bring the world of GUN&SLINGER to life and inspire players to forge their own paths through its scarred and twisted landscape.
Jamila R. Nedjadi is a game creator and Reiki-Shaman. If they were a magical and sentient weapon, they would scream charming obscenities to keep your spirits up and attack people with tapioca pearls. Jammi will be working on the layout for GUN&SLINGER!
Max Moctizuma is Los Angeles born and raised. Brought up in a traditional Chiricahua Ndé home with a background in Outdoor Nature Education and Fire Ecology for Los Angeles County and State. They are deeply involved in the public Indigenous community both locally and online through education, consulting, and staffing and organizational roles for events such as Eaton Canyon's Spring Awakening.
Fiona Maeve Geist resides in WXXT country with her cat where she writes fiction and nonfiction appearing in varied venues. She is primarily known for being a relentless editor and occasional writer of pen and paper roleplaying games—including being a developer and writer for the ENnie Award-winning Mothership: Sci-Fi Horror RPG. She is terrible at listing everything she works on and feels like she will hurt someone’s feelings by leaving them out. In a previous life, she was an academic.
Sadia Bies is an illustrator and game designer, who has been working professionally in both fields for 7 years. They design for Ratworm Games, The Wayfinder Experience, and individually on their itch.io page. Their hobbies include raising insects, yelling about fiction, and dressing up as weird creatures.
Ezra Rose is an illustrator, zinester & multi-disciplinary creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. [Twitter]
Korben Dennis is an Animator and Game Designer fresh out of college, and rarin' to go! They chase themes of transhumanism, empathy toward monsters, and ethical entertainment. [Instagram]
Stretch Goals
At $6,350, Viditya Voleti will be writing a new playset, SWORD&BEARER, that will include a new setting, setup section, two new characters, and art by Nadhir Nor!
Here's the pitch:
SWORD&BEARER is set within a massive city that shares aesthetics with idealistic European and South-Asian architecture. In this world, magic is relatively commonplace and used in daily life. There’s been an industrial revolution, and many things are powered by a mix of coal and magical energy harnessed from the world. Patrols and the army make use of firearms, and artful melee weapons have become a thing of decoration.
The Twist in this setting has taken its place among the ruling classes of the city, driving them to control and capitalize on its people by making them just comfortable enough to be complacent. It is a caste-based capitalistic society where the upper echelons have been infiltrated and manipulated by Magic’s hungry and self-driven sibling, the Twist.
Viditya Voleti (Twitter, Itch). Viditya is a QPoC game designer and writer who loves exploring the medium in several avenues! A true goblin of the community, he wears different hats from making games, consulting, Twitter worldbuilding, streaming live design nights, reading and reviewing games, and really anything he decides will be fun! All of this gets collected on his Patreon.
Nadhir Nor is an illustrator from Malaysia. From folkloric visuals for musicians to cheesy queer romance tucked between his art books, he's very interested in seeing how the modern society can navigate between what's mundane and magical.
At $7,250, Adira Slattery will be writing an alternate character for the GUN, the DEMON, to be included in the final book, with fresh art by Josef Rahaman and a sigil by Ezra Rose!
Here's the pitch:
THE DEMON is an optional playbook replacing either the GUN or the SWORD as a companion. Instead of existing as an object, the Demon lives within the arm of the SLINGER or the BEARER. It only remembers how to cause pain, and it doesn't want to let go. 
Adira Slattery is a trans Jewish game designer, poet, and podcast human. Her work spans comedy, horror, and intimacy. Adira has designed a number of amazing projects, and her work in very thoughtful spaces of game design will be sure to make THE DEMON a powerhouse of a character option.
Josef Rahaman is a concept artist from Arizona with a major passion for games & the creativity that births them. Throughout attaining a degree in Digital Culture, he jumped at every opportunity to expand his expertise knowledge of creative processes.  He aims to imbue that spirit of ingenuity into everything he does with the hope that it will inspire joy and creativity in others. His work and flexibility of styles is a perfect fit to bring THE DEMON to life!
Ezra Rose is an illustrator, zinester & multi-disciplinary creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. | ezra-rose.com / @magpietongue |
I will be writing & publishing a full GUN&SLINGER SRD (system reference document) on my website & in PDF form on Itch! It'll include everything from the way the math works out in the system, why decisions were made, and guidance on important aspects of the system.
This will not only make it easier for those interested to make things for or with the GUN&SLINGER framework, but it'll make the reasoning behind some design decisions plain & clear, so future designs will be built from a better understanding!
At $22,000 raised, Pam Punzalan will be writing MECH&PILOT with art by Gio Manning!
 Here's the pitch:
Play as a PILOT who has found that their survival now depends on the miraculous technology of a Mech. Play as a MECH excavated from the remnants of a strange past civilization, who reached for the PILOT in its desperation and now finds itself uncovering its memories through experiencing the world with the Pilot. 
Explore a fantasy-like world with fragments of highly advanced magitech societies born from space ships scattering its surface. Some large factions powered by these fragments exist and struggle to keep the rest of the world ignorant of the legacies they are meant to inherit. Mobile Aberrant Geoanimus, corrupted mecha obsessed with non-corrupted mecha and their pilots, wander the lands, corrupting everything they touch.
Pam Punzalan is a queer woman from the Philippines. Her works explore queerness, emotion, memories, violence, reclamation, rebellion, and identity. She's published her own work (Sundo, Asian Acceptance, a lot of micro RPGs), collaborated with others (Maharlika, several Zinequest 2020 entries) and is on a number of major projects (Sina Una, Ancestry & Culture, Five Torches Deep, Spire, Rookwood).
Misael "Gio" Manning is a Filipino Canadian concept artist and illustrator. He's obsessed with all things mechanical, military history, and exploring the Filipino and Filipino diasporic culture through art. Gio will be creating rad illustrations for the Mech and Pilot. Gio's currently working with other Filipino writers and artists to create a sci-fi RPG based on Filipino fantasy called "Maharlika RPG"
And if we get beyond this, we’ll be raising pay for everyone involved!

campaign.story:
PLAY

The Vizor Role Playing System has been developed and tested over 25 years by hundreds of fantastic players. All you need is a set of percentile dice and a deck of playing cards to play any genre!
The Vizor RPS is great for those times that you just want to play, and also for those years-long campaigns that we all love. Dynamic Character Creation guidelines let you build your character as the story unfolds and as you explore the world. Use playing cards (Influence Cards) to make your equipment and character quirks influence the story. Vizor taps into your creativity and makes game play a shared experience that grows in every session toward great storytelling. Collective storytelling builds community!
PLAY

Crenshupiter Networks believes that it’s important to create games for all that are both financially and environmentally conscious. We offer Vizor RPS on Kickstarter as a digital download only, with minimal page count in order to reduce printing costs and save trees. We're also committed to hiring recent graduates from local universities as our fantastic artists.
Our writers, artists, players and fans thank you for your pledge!
Join us for a sample of the Vizor RPS at work in Crenshupiter Networks' live play podcast, Sagas of the Blank Page on #Podbean, #ApplePodcasts and #GooglePodcasts
UPDATE July 7, 2020
It's been a wonderful, crazy ride so far the the Vizor Role Playing System!  Funded in 10 days, such positive feedback, and lots of you heading to our podcast, Sagas of the Blank Page to hear Vizor in Action.
To celebrate EVERYTHING, we have added two new Pledge levels! 
In the Vizor Package, you'll not only receive the Vizor PDF, but we'll also send you a deck of Vizor Influence Cards, with special abilities printed on the cards (only 10 available).  Use the deck as regular playing cards, or as your Vizor Influence Cards.
And if you're ready for the best experience with Vizor you can have, join in to the new Vizor Experience Deluxe pledge level, where you receive the PDF, the Vizor Influence Card deck, AND Crenshaw will run a 4-hour Zoom session for you and four friends (nearly any genre - your choice).
 Update August 22, 2020
Here we go on the final 48 hours of the campaign!  Here's a sneak peek for you!
Vizor RPS Character Sheet!

campaign.story:
‘I do believe in fairies! l do! I do!’ 
Peter Pan - J.M. Barrie 
Experiencing visions of a mythical land throughout your childhood, you are suddenly transported to the Inspirisles, a kingdom ruled by the fey. Responsible for a pact made long ago by your ancestors, you must now earn Belief and the respect of their gods or find yourself trapped there forever.
INSPIRISLES is a completely original tabletop RPG aimed at teenagers. It will promote empathy, life skills and deaf awareness with an emphasis on teamwork and creativity.
Play as teens gifted extraordinary powers. 
Meet famous characters and fearsome monsters from Celtic folklore. 
Work together to heal a crumbling land and restore a fractured kingdom. 
Learn British/American Sign Language as you cast spells and solve puzzles. 
Become apprentices to the gods.
Offer Belief to earn your tickets home. 

This project came about after running my teen Dungeons & Dragons group Hatchlings for over a year. I wanted to create something for them. Something they could have a hand in building. And something I could take beyond the group to use in schools and communities as a workshop model. Inspirisles is the result of this, a game for young players that reflects my interest in folklore and my ongoing work with the deaf community.
Though Inspirisles is aimed at children, it can be enjoyed equally by adults and we are especially encouraging parents, educators and tabletop beginners to invest in our game. Many of us have fond memories of 80s fantasy classics such as The NeverEnding Story & Labyrinth. Inspirisles aims to capture some of that nostalgic magic and transport its older participants back to a more carefree and imaginative time. 
Standard & Limited Edition book mock-ups
A5 premium-colour hardback with over 150 pages of material, including...
History of the islands and their Friends. 
Creating your Foundling character.
Collection of spell, ability & item cards and the tools to invent your own. 
A host of worldbuilding ideas & mechanics to breathe life into your quests, including using the arts in roleplaying, creating challenging environmental puzzles, alternative ways to earn Belief, rules for Inspired apprenticeships, exploration, downtime & Doom.
Scriv’s Tour: Follow the famous bard as she journals the key locations & personalities you will encounter during your adventures.
Scriv’s Story: Fiction retelling the moment our bard met Athelyn for the first time (Limited Edition only).
Menagerie of monsters from Celtic folklore & the tools to invent your own. 
Starter adventure: ‘Duster Trials’. 
Stunning art from cover to cover, including maps for locations and encounters. 
Two page spread of Josh Somerville’s spectacular knot art (Limited Edition only).
Dyslexia friendly fonts throughout to prioritise accessibility. 
Handouts: Blank character sheet, Shaping alphabet (BSL & ASL), milestone certificates & Grail template.
* terms in bold explored below.
Page sample by Anna Urbanek of Double Proficiency
Belief is the keystone of the Inspirisles. The energy binding all things. In its absence, the land and its children would fade from life and from memory. 
If Belief were to run dry, it would have terrible repercussions. Imagine something calamitous like Earth’s polar caps suddenly melting or electricity disappearing from the globe overnight. 
Though Belief is generated through such things as exploration, the arts, work and even battle, these pale in comparison to the amount collected from human children. 
As children believe in magic less and less, the inhabitants of the Inspirisles must come up with new and increasingly creative ways to convince them otherwise.
Belief gathered from Earth is taken to the World Tree and released over its roots. This energy then spreads throughout the land, healing the foundations of the islands.
Shaping
A place where the gods walk freely, where dragons are hunted for hoarding Belief, where a war rages between Friends, where reforging an ancient sword can reforge a kingdom, where sign language is used to cast spells, where there is no death, only Disbelief, and where heroes rise and fall together. 
It is also a setting to reflect the struggles of our own world. You’ll find environmental calamity, political greed and social injustice to name but a few. Making Inspirisles relatable to our future generations was an ambition from the very start. However, we would never want to push an agenda, so building a platform for whichever stories need to be told has been our sole responsibility. 
Hibernation
Our system and its mechanics are entirely built around the theme of Belief. Players must work together to collect this wondrous commodity, reaching the heights before deciding whether to stay and enjoy the renown or return home and reunite with their true families.
Moving away from systems found in many popular tabletop RPGs, Inspirisles is largely aimed at young adults and does away with traditional mechanics such as racial bonuses, class systems, ponderous combat and even death.
Though our players should expect an open, sandbox experience, it’s nice to have an overall goal in mind. As such, the concept of healing the land as a team for rewards and progression is at the heart of Inspirisles.
As with any roleplaying game, Inspirisles will throw challenges at its players. As well as social and environmental encounters, Foundlings (players) will inevitably come across familiar monsters of Celtic legend, such as the Questing Beast who will stalk them across the land. Within the book, you’ll also discover many nasties of our own invention and the tools to invent your own.
Don’t go it alone!
Attributes
Foundlings will have six attributes: sword, shield, speed, smarts, social & survival. When facing obstacles, they can lay down up to three cards representing spells, abilities or items. These cards display unique properties that will have an impact on their attribute bonus. Players then roll 2d6, adding the attribute bonus plus any additions from the cards. If the obstacle they are facing is truly perilous, they may turn to their Grail Pool as a last resort, a resource only carried by Foundlings.
Sample obstacle resolution
Obstacles can include social interactions, puzzles, environmental challenges and battle. Whether the obstacle is resolved through roleplay or combat, if it requires a check, it is always contested between player and Grail Guide (Game Master). 
With every failed encounter and instead of suffering injury or death, Foundlings will instead experience Disbelief. If too much Disbelief is accumulated as a group, players must pull together to reduce it using the Belief they may be saving for a rank or new cards. This balancing act encourages empathy between participants, but also prevents Doom from affecting the islands.
Questing Beast
Guinevere & Arthur, our Grail Guide choices
Our version of a Game Master is called the Grail Guide (GG). A participating adult or teenager will take on the role of GG and become the spirit of King Arthur Pendragon or Queen Guinevere. It will be their task to guide the players on their journey, making decisions on the rules, lending voice to the citizens and fangs to the denizens, and encouraging everyone to work together, share the limelight and have fun.
As the GG, you also have the unique opportunity to gift your players their Grail Pool, a set of polyhedral dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12 & d20). Foundlings are the only beings able to carry this water poured from the Holy Grail. Even a sip will offer them an edge when facing the greatest of challenges and most dangerous of foes.
Talking of the Grail, with the book will be a template for the holy vessel that GG’s can cutout before sessions. This prop is then placed in the centre of the playing space and can be flipped whenever a player finds a theme or scenario too difficult. The GG can then move on swiftly without disrupting the overall session.
Safety tool
It is also the responsibility of the GG to add tension and peril to the experience. If their players accumulate too much Disbelief, they can consult a Doom chart. This will change the Inspirisles in dramatic ways, such as causing a volcano to erupt, introducing the Questing Beast to hunt Foundlings, having Excalibur seized by an enemy or building a troll bridge on the outskirts of a city. 
Spelunking
As a player, you take on the role of Foundling, a human teen drawn by fate to the islands. Instead of selecting a race or class, Foundlings are trained by one of eight fey clans, otherwise known as Friends. The Knockers, Glow, Wyrmbitten, Capra, Piskies, Giantheld and Bucca populate distinct locations from city to forest, tin mine to tundra. Seven of these races work tirelessly to restore Belief and prevent the collapse of the Inspirisles. Whilst the eighth, an exiled people known as Glimmers refuse to help, sheltered far beneath the surface where the cracks go unseen and the tremors unfelt. 
Knocker
As a Foundling, once Belief is gathered, it can be used in 3 distinct ways...
 Pilgrimage to Avalon where the World Tree sits. Belief is offered to its roots in exchange for training.
 Patronage to the Inspired. Belief is offered in exchange for spells.
 Provide for the community they were embraced by. Belief is offered in exchange for items.
Regardless of how Foundlings offer Belief, they will earn the favour of the ruling houses and feel their reputation and power grow. 
Foundling sheet B&W
The Inspired are the closest thing the islands have to deities. Their influence can be felt across the kingdom at all times and ultimately players will need to impress them if they are to return home.
As well as being great teachers of magic in the form of Shaping, they have trades in their homelands, allowing Foundling players to become apprentices and earn Belief through hard work and dedication.
 Kilna of the Fire has his forge.
 Egrain of the Earth has her vinyard.
 Athelyn of the Water has their bath house.
 Vorm of the Air has his skyship.
Kilna at his forge
Travelling via All’s Well, a mysterious portal leading to the British Isles, on their 15th birthdays, the brightest and bravest Foundlings are sent Earthwards to collect Belief. These elite are known as Dusters.
With the help of a Wellwisher, a common mammal transformed by Athelyn to be more like you and I, Dusters will be guided to a child without Belief, a teenager struggling to feel magic in their life.
Players will then roll a six-sided Dusting Dice (d6), revealing the target child’s particular sensitivity. 1: Fear 2: Joy 3: Wonder 4: Help 5: Story and (6: Other - determined by GG). Through roleplaying this sensitivity, Foundlings must convince the child that magic exists before collecting their Belief to take back.
Wellwisher
As well as speaking the common tongue for the sake of interactions with humankind, the fey use a form of sign language they believe communicates right to the heart. 
The technique is known as Shaping, a term derived from the hand and finger movements used and a deeper meaning of shaping the world around them. Spells are solely expressed through Shaping, with gestures building energy before being released from the fingertips.
Spells are taught only by the Inspired. Only they know the deeper intricacies of the language necessary to harness magic.
Though optional, we are introducing British Sign Language (BSL) and Sign Supported English (SSE) into our game. We are using it as part of the spellcasting process and to solve some of the setting’s most challenging puzzles, encouraging our young players to learn the alphabet and more as they play. 
When you back our core book, whether digitally or physically, you will gain access to a video workshop on the art of Shaping produced by our friends in the deaf community. Whilst not a comprehensive introduction to British Sign (see Stretch Goals), it will teach participants enough to encourage them to pursue the language beyond the game. 
The core book will also come with an American Sign Language (ASL) alphabet sheet. The video tutorial unlocks through a stretch goal.
Milestone certificate
Personal thank you via social media: acknowledgement of your support via the platform of your choosing. We believe the community you cherish should know about your pledge. 
Inspirisles pdf: DRM/watermark free digital copy of our core book distributed via DriveThruRPG (BSL only)
Shaping tutorial: exclusive link to our British Sign Language video, demonstrating the art of Shaping through the alphabet and more.
Inspirisles hardback: Premium colour hardback copy of Inspirisles printed and distributed via DriveThruRPG (BSL only). Please note, both the standard and limited editions of the book have an additional shipping cost of £5 for the UK and £8 for the rest of the world.
Inspirisles ‘Limited Edition‘ hardback: Kickstarter exclusive: Premium colour hardback copy of Inspirisles printed and distributed via DriveThruRPG (BSL or ASL option). Limited Edition features a two page centre spread of Josh Somerville’s knot designs and a short story by Scriv the Bard.
Name in credits: your name will appear in our book credits.
HD wallpaper art pack: digital collection of the beautiful art you’ll discover throughout the final book. 
MP3 Track by Anthony & Tracey Hoskin: Gaelic soundscape that will transport you to an ancient Arthurian landscape brimming with nature and mystery. 
Pledge certificate: personalised pledge certificate to immortalise your support framed by more of Josh’s stunning Celtic knot designs.
All stretch goals unlocked.
Beta tester: access to playtest material before it’s released to the public and a chance for your feedback to influence and improve our final product.
Create monster to appear in game: working with our team, you will invent a terrifying beast to thwart our players in their pursuit of Belief. Your named creature will then be illustrated for the page.
Free shipping on this reward and above. 
Creature of legend: become a dragon in the core book. Work with the team to fully flesh out this infamous reptile and have them named and illustrated for the page.
Glorified: your name will sit highlighted at the very top of our credits list in its own knot art frame.
The 5th Inspired: become a mysterious deity thought lost with the arrival of Kilna, Egrain, Athelyn and Vorm. You will represent the communities of the Underisles, our setting’s equivalent of the underworld. There you will teach Foundlings the art of Shadowshaping. 
All stretch goals unlocked for backers of Guinevere/Arthur reward tier and above.
Interview with Adam Baffoni of Critical Success Podcast (@CritSuccess_), where our host chats to Scriv the Bard, Monique Franzsen & me about the benefits of tabletop roleplaying for children and families.
https://www.criticalsuccesspodcast.com/episodes/ep12-rpgs-with-kids-teens 
Interview with the Fires of Athelen team about Inspirisles and game development in general.
https://youtu.be/v9pCUqsK81w
 Interview with the Snap, Crackle and Pop Culture crew and a deep dive into Inspirisles. 
https://www.facebook.com/SnapCrackleAndPopCulturePodcast/videos/1725982290873780/
Promo for Inspirisles provided by prominent tabletop RPG personality, Bill Allan. His Youtube channel featuring Dungeons & Dragons with high school students has always been an inspiration.
https://youtu.be/PFiQ5lEQBx8 
We spoke to Devin of the Bardic Babble podcast about accessibility and how ttrpgs have to change for the better.
So why Kickstarter and crowdfunding? We are a small team of three passionate gamers, but also full-time parents and employees. While most of what you see on this page was created by us, we have our limits and would rather pay collaborators with the expertise to complete the work needed to make our core book the best it can be.
Josh Somerville (@mythiccomicsart) is a digital artist and comic book writer specialising in Celtic knot design. He is currently commissioned to produce our cover and interior page art, but we’d like his work to encapsulate the whole project. Web
Josh’s illustrative work
Anna Urbanek (@2xproficiency) is a graphic designer and layout artist of the Double Proficiency studio. She spends her life between tabletop roleplaying rulebooks and tomes on ethnobotany, drawing magical plants whenever she finds a free moment.
Lucille Nual (@luceals) is a Vegas-based, Filipino-American illustrator. She loves to create whimsical sci-fi/fantasy worlds and diverse casts of characters.
Dragon librarian
Ashley Irelan (@agrish11) is an illustrator, character designer, and lover of all things fantasy and fairytale. She has worked with indie game devs we deeply admire and is now a principle artist on Inspirisles.
Ashley is creating our sign language alphabets
Scriv the Bard (@ScrivTheBard) has been one of our biggest supporters since the beginning. She is a content creator for kids herself with her Heroes of Iyastera setting and a stalwart friend in the tabletop community. Web 
Scriv the Bard
Jamie Ross with his Bristol Adventurers’ Guild runs tabletop RPG sessions for children with ASD. We would like him to consult on the book to ensure it is as inclusive as possible. Web
Sash Steele (@sp1ritjam) is our map designer and will be handling our key locations and the battle maps included with our starter adventure. They are a talented illustrator and their style complements the art we have already produced. Web
Anthony & Tracey Hoskin are musicians based in Kent. They have recorded many theatrical scores and Tracey has a magnificent singing voice. I want them to record a track to accompany our Foundlings on their adventurers.
Monique Franzsen (@moniquefranzsen) is an educator and organiser of afterschool Dungeons & Dragons clubs. She has also written an adventure module I greatly admire for the DMsGuild. And like her The Laureate Trials, our starter adventure will test players as they take their first steps as heroes. We would love Monique to pen this adventure and many more besides. Web
Rajnie Kaur is a deaf friend of ours and will star in our British Sign Language tutorial video. Sample below only a placeholder due to studio filming restrictions caused by Covid19 pandemic.
PLAY

Rich Oxenham (@HatchlingDM) is the founder of Hatchlings and the lead worldbuilder, writer and artist behind the project. He earned a creative writing Masters degree and went on to try out the life of a novelist. Rich, however, is a born socialite and before long was craving collaboration. He returned to playing Dungeons & Dragons a decade ago after a hiatus of 30 years and is now DMing for groups of teens and adults. With Inspirisles, he has the opportunity to work with creatives he admires in the community, honour a decade working with the deaf and fulfil a dream of producing something his daughters will be proud of.
Kathryn Oxenham (@Kessa_Brae) got lured into D&D by her husband Rich and has never looked back. A born geek, she attended a theatre school for ten years as a child and found that this helped with her crippling shyness. Hatchlings and Inspirisles were very much Rich’s baby until she finally could no longer take an evening of gaming (Sims or Stardew Valley) interrupted and became his sounding board, editor and anchor when his flights of imagination bordered on the absurd. Kathryn works with vulnerable deaf adults, finds it incredibly rewarding and has loved the opportunity to achieve level two in BSL. In her spare time she enjoys baking, writing fan fiction, gaming, D&D and acting as referee to her young daughters.
Liam Hocking (@LiamHocking1) is a designer for Inspirisles with a fervent interest in promoting inclusion within education for teens and young adults. Growing up on a diet of all things gaming related, Liam discovered a deep and enduring passion for tabletop RPGs, with an interest in creating new worlds for players to explore. Liam is now a principle educator who works closely with young people experiencing a range of vulnerability issues. He is constantly searching for new ways to improve learning environments and researching ways to incorporate roleplaying and gamification within academia for young adults.
