campaign.story:
Art by Julianne Griepp
From the creative mind behind Icarus: A Storytelling Game About How Great Civilizations Fall, comes Spenser Starke’s next project Alice is Missing, a silent role-playing game about the disappearance of Alice Briarwood, a high school junior in the small town of Silent Falls. 
Developed by Hunters Entertainment and published & distributed by Renegade Game Studios, Alice Is Missing is a unique kind of roleplaying game in which players only communicate using their phones, sending text messages to each other as they unearth clues about what happened to Alice.
The game is played live and without verbal communication. Players inhabit their character for the entirety of the 90-minute play session, and instead of speaking, send text messages back and forth to the other characters in a group chat, as well as individually, as though they aren’t in the same place together. 
Haunting beautiful, deeply personal, and highly innovative Alice is Missing puts a strong focus on the emotional engagement between players, immersing them in a tense, dramatic mystery that unfolds organically through the text messages they send to one another. Right at home with games like Life Is Strange, Gone Home, Oxenfree, and Firewatch, it’s designed to feel as much like an event-style experience as it does a role-playing game.
Alice Is Missing runs over a single session of 2-3 hours, with 3-5 players. In the first 45 minutes, players create their characters, their relationships to Alice, and their ties with each other. The next 90 minutes are spent uncovering secrets and unearthing clues in an attempt to discover where Alice is, and who is behind her disappearance.
Though text messages seem to be the most common mode of communication in our modern era, they are rarely utilized as a storytelling medium.
The integration of texting into the gameplay unlocks a brand new way to play RPGs that is unlike anything you’ve likely experienced before. It’s personal, immersive, and perfect for remote play.

Powered by simple but unique card mechanics that give everyone equal footing in telling the story, the game runs without a GM, or gamemaster, and instead empowers the players to create the story together.
While in-game time is fluid and the text messages could take place over the course of a day or more, the actual gameplay lasts a total of 90 minutes and is accompanied by a beautifully cinematic, licensed music playlist (featuring artists such as Message To Bears, This Patch of Sky, Justin LaPointe, and Be Still The Earth) which acts as both a timer and a soundtrack for the game.
You’ll start by choosing characters, drawing a motive for how that character acts, and assigning relationships to one another. Then, using the appropriate prompts on your character card, each player will record a secret voicemail to be played at the end of the game.
You’ll then establish some important information about your town of Silent Falls by choosing suspects and locations you think could have played a part in Alice’s disappearance. Lastly, you’ll receive Clue Cards that will be used during the game to generate information about the mystery you’re unraveling.
Once the timer starts and the game begins, you’ll flip your Clue Card when the number on the timer hits the number on the Clue Card’s back. This will often result in you drawing a card from the Suspect or Location deck and combining it with the prompt on the Clue Card to create the information your character uncovers.
This clue is then worked into the text conversation between the characters organically.

These clues will continue to be revealed throughout the game, building tension and heightening the stakes until the 10-minute card flips, and the game comes to its climactic end.
 Once the timer goes off at 90 minutes, players will have the opportunity to send one last text message before the secret voicemails play over the closing music track. Once the voicemails are finished and the current song ends, the game comes to a close. 
By putting its lens on the relationships, tensions, and story arcs between the characters looking for Alice just as much as the search for Alice itself, the game challenges players to explore aspects of emotional intimacy and personal connection in a unique and accessible way.
Alice Is Missing inherently deals with mature themes and potentially-difficult topics such as gender, sexuality, violence, and grief. We’ve been lucky enough to bring on the incredibly talented Lauren McManamon (Girl Underground, Good Society: A Jane Austen RPG, Codex) as our editor to ensure these topics are approached in a thoughtful and responsible manner. 
We’ve also included important tools to help navigate these themes at the table (and off the table) to ensure everyone has both an exhilarating and positive experience.
Though the game has been in development for the last year, in an unintentional way, it mirrors the reality we now face during this era of social distancing; the craving for connection despite the distance that may be between us.
Alice is Missing provides a unique way to play without the traditional hang-ups that come with trying to structure a Virtual Table Top session. Since the only time you'll need to 'go to the table' is to grab a card. The meat of gameplay exists on your mobile devices.
 We’ve put a great deal of work into ensuring Alice Is Missing will be available as a marketplace item on Roll20 not long after the campaign ends. With the lack of in-person gaming opportunities given the current social distancing orders in place around the world, we hope by making the game available in this format quickly, it will allow players to share a unique roleplaying experience together from the comfort and safety of their own home.
The Roll20 version of the game will not replace the use of players’ phones for sending text messages back and forth during the game. It will instead serve as your shared table during online play, allowing everyone to interact with the cards that drive the narrative forward.
 For those of you who would rather not use Roll20, we are offering a PDF with a Print on Demand cards via DTRPG to use with your other messaging systems of choice. It’s important to emphasize, however, that the cards need to be communally accessible individually via a cloud or other software to manage remote play in this way.
We plan to release the digital version of Alice is Missing in July 2020. We plan to release the physical version to our backers in November 2020, with the game being made available to stores soon after through a global publishing deal with Renegade Game Studios. We will use DriveThruRPG for all of our digital fulfillment.
 For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING. 
We will be using a pledge manager to collect information from backers. 
 We will be using Gamerati for all of our domestic and international fulfillment purposes.
Domestic Shipping: For traditional USPS shipping, we expect to charge ~$8 USD per package through our warehouse for the physical pledge.
International Shipping: We will be working with our fulfillment partner for available countries in order to ship via local shipping options. 
We expect the cost of shipping for the physical package to be as follows: 
Australia and New Zealand: ~$8 USD
Canada and the European Union: ~$12 USD 
Europe (Non-EU): ~$19 USD
Rest of the world ~$25 USD
NOTE: The final cost of shipping may differ from our estimations.
NOTE: Roll20® is not responsible for the creation or timely delivery of this content.

campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message. 
Your shipping cost does not increase for add-ons regardless of your location or the amount of extra games you order. You will receive all add-on games at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery April 2021).  
The 18 original character paintings by Sarah Keele are available to purchase! The paintings are 8 x 10 inches and made with mixed media acrylic on masonite board. You can see some of the intricate details below. Email sarahmkeele@gmail.com for more details or to check availability of a specific character.    
Though this is not an add-on you can get through the campaign, the people at Next Level Board Gaming are selling 3D-printer files so that you can create an EPIC 3D version of the Bristol 1350 board that you can use with your copy of the game. You can see more details by clicking the picture below.
Regardless of order size or add-ons, shipping costs are $6 USA, $8 UK/EU, $10 Australia/Canada, $12 for the rest of the world. We work hard to find the best shipping rates out there, and we subsidize some of the shipping costs so that you don't have to pay as much. 
To avoid extra VAT or customs fees, games will ship to depots around the world (USA, UK, EU, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong) before being shipped to you. For non-depot countries, in most cases there will not be extra VAT costs because the price of our games is low enough to avoid the duties threshold.
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. Due to unreliable mail systems, we will not perform reshipments destined for Brazil, Ukraine, Russia, or South Africa. 
These days there are many projects that wait to charge shipping until AFTER the campaign ends in order to shift the risk from the creators to the backers. We have "done our homework" in regards to shipping costs and are prepared to take on unexpected risk. What you pay now for shipping is ALL that you will pay for this reward.
DISCOUNTED PRICE | Normal MSRP of the Standard Edition will be $25. If we release the Deluxe Edition to the public it will be at least $45. We also offer the best shipping prices we can during the Kickstarter campaign.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CARDS | The 9 Kickstarter Exclusive character cards (for a total of 18 characters in your game) will never be available again and will be unavailable to the public. Additionally, campaign stretch goals, as well as the Deluxe version, are only guaranteed through Kickstarter.
EARLY ACCESS | Receive and play the game before anyone else in the world. 
JOIN OUR TEAM | Get first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We will take your feedback into account before launching production.
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. (Per Kickstarter regulations, funds raised within Kickstarter will not be directly donated and have no effect on the donation amount).
This project is promoted by Green Inbox

campaign.story:
Series One from The Magic Puzzle Company is a set of three new 1,000-piece jigsaw puzzles with original art and a magical surprise at the end.
We set out to create the most entertaining jigsaw puzzle you’ve ever done by combining the traditional jigsaw puzzle experience with ideas from the worlds of tabletop games and magic.
We commissioned incredible, original art from independent artists, designed from the very beginning to be used in a jigsaw puzzle
We designed a surprise ending using techniques from optical illusions and magic that adds an extra experience to the end of the puzzle
Each puzzle has over 50 easter eggs to find as you solve (and they come with a guide to help)
Each puzzle is 28" x 21", and has 1000 pieces. That's about 4% larger than the normal size of a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
We imported the highest-quality puzzle cardboard in the world (1.9mm Eska "blue" stock) from the Netherlands and invented some new printing techniques so the pieces snap together and stay snapped
These puzzles have been extensively playtested to make the experience as smooth and engaging as possible from the moment you open the box to the moment you place the last piece of the last segment
When you're done with the puzzle, everything can be reset and all of the secret compartments close back up with velcro so you can share the puzzle with a friend or solve it again later.
No puzzle dust!!
Puzzle Art
Most puzzles start with stock art of some trees or cats or something. We wanted each of our puzzles to make a fantastic, tiny world. And we wanted the art to tell a story as you solve it. So we worked closely with independent artists like Sarah Becan, Boya Sun, and Felicia Chiao to create beautiful one-of-a-kind puzzle images loaded with tiny details, story quirks, and easter eggs.
"The Happy Isles" by Sarah Becan
"The Mystic Maze" by Boya Sun
"The Sunny City" by Felicia Chiao
Custom Dielines
To make the magical ending work right, we had to customize the shape of every single piece in all three puzzles. While we were at it, we also made sure that the individual puzzle-piece shapes highlighted the cool art details instead of cutting them in half.
Jigsaw puzzles start as one big piece of cardboard, and then a specially designed cutting tool called a die comes down like a stamp and slices it into a thousand pieces.
The die for the "Happy Isles" puzzle
Usually, the tolerance for that slice is about 3mm. But to pull off the magical ending in our Series One puzzles, we needed a 0.5mm tolerance. Nobody had done that before, so we had to work closely with our puzzle factory create new quality-control and die-cutting techniques to make it happen. Some of the roughly 3,000 blades that make up our dies actually had to be precise to within 0.1mm — 30 times more precise than a regular puzzle. 
An excerpt from Simon’s briefing for the puzzle factory
 One of the nice side effects of making a more precise die and using super high-quality puzzle cardboard is the pieces click together in a really satisfying way and stay together even if you need to move the puzzle.  
 Magical Surprise 
It’s always exciting to pick up a new puzzle with an image you like and then open the box and start putting together the corners and edges. But after a while, you get to the part of the puzzle where you need to assemble 400 pieces of blurry sky. And then when the puzzle's about 75% done, that feeling of “what am I doing with my time” creeps in. Eventually the last piece finally goes in and the puzzle is over. We’ve always found that part a little anticlimactic.
So we came up with a whole new way for a puzzle to end. When you place the last piece of what you thought was the end of the puzzle, you unlock a whole new part of the experience — a final act that includes both a magical illusion and a completion to the puzzle's narrative. We playtested these puzzles hundreds of times with people all over the world to figure out how to make this special ending as clear and engaging as possible, and we hope you're going to love it.
"The Happy Isles" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Mystic Maze" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Sunny City" 1000-piece puzzle

campaign.story:
HEL: The Last Saga is a cooperative fantasy adventure viking board game, created by the duo behind SMOG: Rise of Moloch by CMON, game designer David Rakoto and art director Christophe Madura.
The game offers players the chance to lead a small group of Heroes, each with their own rank, occupation and background. Despite all these differences, these survivors will have to cooperate if they want to survive the cold, hunger and hostile threats, but they will also have to unveil the mysteries surrounding the disappearance of the colony founded by their lost King to be worthy of the Saga that will retain their name.
HEL: The Last Saga is a highly narrative campaign game, with paragraphs to read according to what the players accomplish. The game mechanisms mix exploration, tactical combat with resource management. Storytelling and background are ubiquitous and replayability comes from the unique way you have to replay a failed mission.
Click on the image to know more about the HEL-in
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On


 NARRATIVE ALL THE WAY
Tell. Listen. Choose or test. Everywhere. Anytime. The game engine is based on the discovery or the triggering of events that lead to narrative chapters. These events can be hidden on the game board, placed on the turn track or on any other game component. The story  unfolds as you resolve these chapters by making choices, performing tests or simply listening.
UNIQUE HEROES
Play strong characters. Each Clan member has their own story, strengths and weaknesses. You will learn about them as you play them, by acquiring new individual Hero cards in a non linear way. Some of these cards will be the result of choices you made during the adventure.
SCENARIO BASED 
Conquer a mysterious land, found a colony and resolve mysteries. Scouting missions, search or rescue parties, raids, escape, defence, investigation, or intrigue. Whether it's located on the modular and expandable wilderness game board or in the colony camp, each scenario provides a new challenge to overcome in order to gain access to the next scenario.
PREDATORS & PREY 
Face hidden threats, which are controlled by a predation-based AI system. Use your perception and your pets to detect these threats before you face them, as an ambush can be fatal. Your enemies are vicious enough to target the most vulnerable or the highest ranking members of your group.
WORSHIP SYSTEM
Beg your gods to help you. Use your willpower, offerings, and the fervour of your companions to obtain permanent modifiers that will benefit all who share your faith.
SURVIVAL... 
Exploit scarce resources to survive and keep your clan together. Hunt for food. Collect that precious wood that will be a source of heat and an essential material for your constructions. But above all, maintain high morale to avoid sinking into defeat.
...HORROR
Night will eventually fall. For months. Second half of the campaign will take place into darkness. But only for Heroes who survive long enough to see the sunset. Forget every little knowledge or petty victory acquired. New rules. New threats. New objectives.

The USA, European Union, Canada, Australia, and UK will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes.
Shipping is not charged as part of this Kickstarter campaign but is instead done so on the pledge manager after the campaign ends. The shipping price you will pay is based on the weight of your pledge and the country to which it is to be shipped.
The above is a list of rough estimates for shipping. These estimates are based on the costs for our previous campaigns and an estimated final weight of the Core pledge at 5kg. Keep in mind that adding optional buys or additional pledge levels will raise the weight of your pledge and may also then raise the final shipping price.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
General

This is our ninth Kickstarter and we’ve learned a lot from our previous eight. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

To give you a frame of reference for exactly when you will get your game, Mythic Battles: Pantheon, Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1 and Reichbusters: Projekt Vril have been delivered. Super Fantasy Brawl is being printed and ongoing for a delivery by the summer, Solomon Kane, a big scope project, is at the printer and will be delivered in two waves this year. Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1.5 is on track and the first elements will be soon sent to production. Enchanters: East Quest development is finished and is going to production now and Steamwatchers is on track and will go to production this summer.
For all our games, we communicate with our backers with regular updates at least once a week, plus our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and our videos on YouTube.

Please note that the components, component counts, quality and rules, are all work in progress and subject to change.

Delivery

Our experience in our previous KS has shown us that there can be variances in terms of timing and remaining in schedule when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
At the same time there are also the unpredictable factors; recently it was the Coronavirus outbreak, but there can be others such as weather conditions, strikes and others.
The estimated delivery date for this project is June 2021, but please bear in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Shipping

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.
If you do not finalise your pledge and pay for shipping by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the pledge manager has closed.
If you confirm your pledge by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that outside of countries specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes or APO addresses.
All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

KSE

As KSE, or Kickstarter Exclusives, are marked the products that will not be available to retail. Mythic Games retains the right to continue to sell those in the Pledge Manager, the Mythic Games website, as well as conventions.

Refunds

We have a no-questions-asked refund policy.
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. In addition, if any part of your order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the full cost of this component regardless of the date.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter then we will only be able to refund 85% of it. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds will no longer be available.
Refunds within the first 14 days are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. Any refunds requested after the 14 day period may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe or your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will also be in USD.
If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.

updates.update_content:
Hello all and welcome to another What’s Up Wednesday!
This week we continue our review of the visual artists involved in the universe of Hel: The Last Saga.

Your great interest in this project has also brought frequently asked questions to which we have not yet provided clear answers. I will try to answer them as frankly as possible with the information that I have.
The Solo Mode
The Solo Mode is created and written as we go, as soon as the gameplay of a song is completed. It then requires the Narrative Designers to write a few paragraphs adjusted for this mode. As a reminder, the solo mode will allow you to manage the clan in a different way, adapted to this play style (by limiting the number of playable heroes to 4). For each situation that would require a sustained interaction between players, it will provide instead a small puzzle. For now, I can only refer you to the article detailing these intentions , which serves as our specifications. I would like to add that among the applications you have sent us for the upcoming test campaign, many subscribers have expressed their wish to test this mode only and some of them will receive an invitation for that indeed.

updates.update_content:
Hello all and welcome to another What’s Up Wednesday!

First of all, I would like to thank you for your welcome to our last update, your encouraging feedback and support has galvanized and comforted us in our willingness to work hard to achieve the best possible narrative experience. Without your support, the project could not move forward smoothly. We look forward to putting the test parts online. We will notify selected candidates just beforehand. We will start with the French-speaking candidates while the English translation is completed.

campaign.story:
Last time we started like this: "The aggressive rejection of any nude artwork (and specifically the female nipples) on social media has influenced creators to the extent that many artists now avoid working with nudity altogether. Posted uncensored, their work has led to blocked profiles, deleted images, and platform bans,  creating an industry stigma around the subject that artists are now cautioned to avoid. #hardcover is taking a stand; publishing explicit artwork created by established professionals who believe in the freedom to explore our sexuality and humanity through art."
And here we go again!
#hardcover is back with the second book made in the same spirit and again full of artwork from a stellar lineup of professionals, drawing up a diverse collection of artwork which has one thing in common: the topic of erotic explicit art.
Visit hardcoverart.com to check out the first book and our current contest!
The book will be bound as a red glossy hardcover and have 186 pages of content with the work of over 130 artists. The cover will feature a black logo, and we have a Kickstarter-exclusive tier that adds #softcover2, a sketchbook that is showing alternative work, processes, and also includes a slipcase. And yes, the slipcase has a nipple. Because. 
The single #hardcover2 book
The slipcase edition containing #hardcover2 and #softcover, a collection of sketches, processes plus alternative and additional artwork
The exclusive prints are showing artworks that are not in the books and are made by David 'Loopydave' Dunstan, Craig Elliott, Olga 'ASU Rocks' Andriyenko, Mariia Solyanik and as an extra: Davi Go.
Many of the artists contributing to #hardcover haven't published any adult art until taking part in this project. We wanted them to be free to create any content without boundaries. The book contains diverse depictions of sexuality including LGBTQ artworks and we wouldn't want it any other way. There is absolutely no discussion about the reasons, so please don't waste everybody's time leaving inappropriate comments over our social media and this campaign. The same goes for people trying to save our souls. We already accepted our place in hell.
You can check out the full list of artists and links to their pages here.

Even here on Kickstarter, promoting a book celebrating sexuality and the human form, we cannot show you the beautiful art contained within. We share the sentiment of sadness as we have no other option. The campaign would get rejected for anything but extremely cropped images, to a level where showing them defies the purpose of their creation. What we CAN show you is how the first campaign turned out!
More images here: https://www.hardcoverart.com/gallery-book
The artists contributing to this book will all be compensated for their effort. 80% of the profit goes straight to them. We want to be clear that by supporting this project you are also directly supporting the artists. As the publisher of Kim Jung Gi, Karl Kopinski, Jesper Ejsing, Claire Wendling, and the Superani Group, Éditions Caurette has a wealth of experience in fulfilling books like this.
In case you don't have a credit card to back the project, please reach out to us on orders@hardcoverart.com and we'll be happy to provide you with alternative methods of purchase (and getting all stretch goals of the campaign too!).
The entry phase for the third book just launched as well and will be reachable through this link. Please have a good look at the briefing and better start early enough with your entry. Even though the deadline feels months away it will come sooner than you might expect.
We heard each of your concerns from the last campaign and put a lot of effort into improving the shipping process. So we figured out a good price with our partners and will now offer global tracked shipping only! For the EU it is 10€, and outside the EU 15€ for the single books. For the slipcases and bundles, it will be EU 15€ and outside the EU 35€ tracked shipping. You will know where your shipment is at any time (as far as the post-service of your country provides updates).
We would have loved to show you images of the products, but using this platform comes with a price for all of us, which means that to actually use it, we aren't allowed to share the products with you. So they will be a surprise, and you have to trust us, just like last time :)
Just like last time, if we go higher than this we will obviously add more stretch goals!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the content and layout is finished. The only thing that is missing is the actual printed products for which we are running this campaign.

The fulfillment will be handled by the busy bees at Éditions Caurette who have great experience in publishing and cheap shipment to buyers of high-quality print products. They have been publishing works of artists like Kim Jung Gi, Jesper Ejsing, Karl Kopinski, and many more, so we trust their competence and judgment.

All shipping of the products will be tracked. In case of any problems, Éditions Caurette will be there to answer your questions through DMs on Kickstarter or by email.

We don't expect any delays but of course, we will update you all if there are any unexpected changes or unforeseen developments (due to COVID-19) as we work fully transparently.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: An update on the US shipment and #hardcover3
updates.update_content:
Soooo, dear US-Backers... the good news is that the shipment has been tracked and arrives today at the LA port. The palette is sent to Stuart's and they expect it in about a week, so the books are shipping to YOU mid June and arrive within a few days.  They are shipping with USPS so that means you should receive them in the same timeframe you are used to get your national shipments. I will keep you updated about all of this in the next weeks and am looking forward for the shipments to finally arrive at all backer's hands. Keep us updated if they arrive, we'd be glad to stay int he loop, too.
All this has a negative aspect, which is that I am again postponing the campaign for #hardcover3. It is all ready and basically I just need to hit a button to launch this, but I will wait for you guys to tell me that the book arrived at your place and when I have seen enough of such messages, I will launch the campaign. No fixed date for now as I feel it doesn't make sense to keep giving dates. The launch will probably be between the 15th and 20th of June, I'd assume. Can't wait to get this started and finally show you what we have been cooking :)

I think the best is to start with the email that I got from JC Caurette concerning the update we got from the shipping folks, who are bringing the books to the States. 
----------------------------
Hey Spiridon, how are you?
So, following our conversation, here’s some news about the shipping of the #hardcover2 books to the backers in the USA. We just received some info from the transporter and apparently, there have been some unexpected delays with the ship. From what I understood, the vessel carrying the pallets to the USA first came from Asia, was blocked before entering the Suez canal (you know, all the shit with the stuck boat a few weeks ago), then had to queue for unloading, etc… Long story short: we’re late, and I’m very sorry about that ☹

There is no easy way to bring bad news so I will just slam it on the table.
I just came off the phone and it turns out, it was good to investigate. The palette with the books meant for the US backers is held at the port because of a new lockdown going on and some regulations. Basically what I was told is that a mixture of prioritized goods and necessary papers will delay the shipping for at least another month, and if I could swear in French other than PUTAIN, then I would.

So if you received the slipcase edition you have to pay very close attention to the spot where the nipple is "hidden" because we had to stash it away so that the books aren't damaged. Here is a little hint to where to find it:

campaign.story:
Explore a wildly reimagined Caribbean, bursting with magic and mayhem!
Sea of Legends is a narrative-driven, open-world tabletop game for 1 - 5 players. Swashbuckle and swindle your way to victory as one of four unique captains. Raid ports, bury treasure, fall in love, and defeat your nemesis as you compete to become the most legendary pirate on the open sea.
Your decisions will make waves throughout the Caribbean as each player takes part in shared adventures woven together by our companion app. Choose wisely. In Sea of Legends, the fickle winds of fate can fill your sails or turn against you at any moment. With twenty-six writers, crafting over 400 unique stories, you'll never play the same game twice.
Navigate the shifting tides as you pursue multiple paths to victory and forge your own tale. Will you answer the call to adventure? The sea awaits! 
We have officially unlocked a HUGE stretch goal! Join our crew today and at the All-In Pledge Level and you'll receive this new faction for free. This faction will be fully produced with cards, miniatures, and stories for the Golden Horde. Back now and get 'em while you can!


In Sea of Legends, you'll manage multiple adventures between your Lover, Nemesis, and Captain, while building up the ultimate crew and acquiring treasure. The first player to gain 10 Notoriety wins! But if left unchecked, the NPC Factions can also claim victory. That means that as the players compete, they might also have to band together so they don't all lose.
Players roll dice and activate character abilities during combat.
Each turn, players may move and take one of three possible actions: attack, visit a port, or go on an adventure. When attacking, you'll gather your dice and utilize your crew,  ship, items, and Lover abilities to gain the advantage. But your Nemesis will interfere, so keep your wits about you as you face down mythical monsters and evil empires.
Visiting the tavern will gain players gold and items.
You can always stop at a port when you need a break from all the fighting. Find a Hideout to bury gold, while your crew rest and relax. Or maybe you need a bigger ship? Then stop at the Shipyard and get yourself a fancy new vessel. Perhaps a few of your crew aren't pulling their weight? Toss 'em overboard and find some replacements at the Hiring Hall! Or stop at every scoundrel's second home, the Tavern.
Being a pirate can really parch your throat! Why not stop and have drink? Play some games and earn yourself a few spare coins while visiting the Tavern. Who knows? You might even overhear a juicy rumor. Each rumor will lead you to a relic hidden on the map.
Adventures are branching narrative with unique rewards and stories.
Each adventure is part of a larger branching narrative that takes place in the Sea of Legends app. This is a choose-your-own-adventure like you've never seen before. You might help your Lover out of jam, hunt down your Nemesis, or even befriend the strange denizens of the Caribbean! Your adventures will help you find gold, items, notoriety, and other unique rewards. But whatever you choose, the Sea of Legends app will take note and connect your stories with those of the other players at the table.
This is a sandbox game and there are multiple paths to victory. You can hunt down relics, battle monsters, or build your very own pirate empire! It's up to you, but you can bet your dusty doubloons that your rivals won't give up without a fight. If you're raring for a shot at the pirate's life, take a look at our beta rule book and prepare for your maiden voyage! 
How to Play Sea of Legends
Sea of Legends Solo Play Through
Faction Overview
Each time you play you can select one to two factions for the game session in addition to the ever-present Spanish Armada. These factions determine adventure arcs, items, crew, and Lover/Nemeses you will discover. Each faction has their own unique mechanics and objectives that they will pursue during the game. They are presented below. Disclaimer, as is the nature of Kickstarter, the mechanics presented below may change before release.
The Dread Tide’s undead soldiers will try to form up into clusters of the three and transform into Skeletal Colossus. The colossus will infest ports, destroying them, and when the Dread Tide infest 5 ports they win--taking over the Caribbean with their undead hordes.
The Children of Tlaloc, our merfolk faction, move toward the corners of the map to collect relics. Once they have found them, they bring the relics back to Tortuga to summon the Sea’s Firstborn. Together, they’ll hunt for relics, chasing down captains who have them and once they gain four relics, they win!
The British Empire invades the Caribbean for queen and country, they take over shipyards to gain power and then move to unclaimed ports. They can spend their newfound power to take over that port and when they take over 4 ports they win.
Unlike other factions, the Atlanteans have a uniquely combative dynamic between their characters. The Atlantean King In Exile doesn’t start out hostile to the players. He’s been deposed and has come to the surface looking for aid. If the Atlantean Seekers catch and kill the king they win, leveraging his relics and throne to take over the Caribbean. It's up to the players to defend the King In Exile from the dissidents and in exchange they get access to Atlantis’ powerful artifacts.
The Ordo of Nocturnus sends their initiates to infiltrate the ports, establishing secret cults. Once they have five in place, they summon their demon-prince, Nocturne. Once unleashed, he will move across the map to devour his disciples and gain ultimate power. If he’s not stopped, he will cover the world in darkness.
When the Aztec Reawakening is chosen, players will receive a cursed Aztec coin whenever they’d gain 5 or more gold at one time. These coins have negative effects similar to Nemesis abilities. If Jaguar champions attack you, you may choose to give up the coin to avoid them or if they best you, they’ll take it by force. Once acquired, the champions will offer these coins to Quetzalcoatl. When Quetzalcoatl gains 6 Aztec coins, they’re able to summon their empire from the ruins and win.
When playing with Sea’s Fury, the coven of sea witches believes all pirates are guilty of stealing their relics. The Spirit of Vengeance summons Sea Elementals that will try to sneak aboard your ship and take relics back. These elementals do not start combat when they take back their relics, so players either need to be aggressive and attack the water spirits before they catch up with the player or they will chase them down after they’ve lost the relics.
In the Harpy’s Descent, the player with the most Notoriety will get a Hunted token, the Harpy chases down that player. If the Harpy defeats them in combat. The Harpy takes the token and their Notoriety. When the Harpy steals 6 Notoriety, she wins. However, if a player defeats the Harpy they gain all the notoriety she has stolen from the other players.
*The images above are mock-ups. Shipping is TBD.
These add-ons will be available through our pledge manager after the campaign concludes. So, save your doubloons for after we complete this wild adventure and then pick and choose which add-ons you fancy.  
As part of our lofty stretch goal, we asked for you to help shape our newest faction. Our crew of backers took part in shaping the story, design, and characters for the Golden Horde. You can follow the journey in the following updates: Update 14: Faction Face Off, Update 17: Monkey Business, and Update 20: The Golden Horde Advances Bearing New Add Ons. 
PLAY

Discover a world of desperate duels, dastardly villains, and romantic rendezvous. Make terrifying enemies and powerful allies all within the Sea of Legends app. Our app tracks and responds to your choices. Each decision you make will shape the Caribbean, introducing new challenges and adventures for each player at the table. The combinations are nearly infinite.
The Sea of Legends app pushes far beyond the traditional bounds of choose-your-own-adventure books, creating unique stories and endless replayability.
The Sea of Legends app procedurally integrates characters and storylines from NPC Factions, Lovers, and Nemeses in play. This also means that other players’ Lovers and Nemeses will show up in your stories! Together, these elements combine to create an anthology of interwoven stories that are unique to your playthrough. Players will see their choices make an impact both on the board and in the tales of competing captains. The app assures these stories aren't repeated, prioritizing unplayed storylines in your game sessions until every adventure has been experienced.

Guildhall Studios is the harebrained creation of legendary game designer, Jordan Weisman (Creator of Battletech, Shadowrun, Mage Knight), and two young upstarts, Zach Weisman (Calliope, Shadowrun Returns) and Ryan Schapals (BATTLETECH, Weave, Mortal Shell). With over 50 years of collective experience in the games industry, they’ve come together to give players an all-new tabletop experience.
 We’re working with a tremendous team of artists, writers, sculptors, and graphic designers to polish off the final components so that we are ready to place the order soon after this campaign concludes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sea of Legends is our first Kickstarter game as Guildhall Studios. However, the team at Guildhall has over 50 years of combined game industry experience. Additionally, we are working with the dedicated team of partners including Off Duty Ninja and Be Bold Games who have decades of tabletop marketing and Kickstarter experience to help us run this campaign in the best way for our backers.

We are committed to delivering this game in a timely manner with the highest attention to detail and quality.

That said, there are always many considerations in a project of this scope and unforeseen complexities that may cause delays. There are many steps in the process of manufacturing and fulfilling a game, many of which involve partnerships. Through careful and thorough planning, common mistakes can be avoided. However, possible delays can occur from circumstances beyond our immediate control. If such an issue is encountered, our team will adapt, and no corners will be cut to course-correct as needed.

Overall, our greatest obstacle is simply the funding to manufacture such an ambitious product of the highest quality capable. Your contribution makes this a reality!

The estimated delivery date for this project is February 2021. That is our goal and we are confident that we can hit that target. Although that date is specific for North America and because of the logistics involved in international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner or later than others.

There is one complication and that is COVID-19. We’ve been in communication with our manufacturing partner to prepare for these delays and built them into our timeline, but with this being a unexpected pandemic there may be other consequences that we can’t predict. Throughout Kickstarter and afterward, we will be transparent and open with our communication so that you’re aware of any wrinkles in the production and fulfillment process.

We've done our best to minimize any other complexities as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if the unthinkable happens and a pledge is undeliverable.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

This project is not final. The look, materials, and content of this game and all rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented on this Kickstarter page between now and fulfillment. Our goal is to change as little as possible between now and start of production, but development is an iterative process.

If you do not agree to these terms please do not pledge to this project and wait to purchase the game from us upon release.

REFUNDS
We will honor refunds within 14 days of the campaign’s end, including any fees.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Ahoy, mateys!
Today we’re excited to introduce two new members of our crew! We’ve brought them both on because their experience and skills will help us improve our organization, logistics, and customer service.
Sea of Legends was our first big campaign as a team and for some backers it wasn’t all smooth sailing when it came to shipping and logistics. A lot of the issues we encountered were not in our control (such as lost pallets of product), but some errors with our product allocation and miss-shipping products to the EU that should have gone to the APAC region were 100% on us. We’re dedicated to making sure this doesn’t happen again, which is why we’re bringing on Patrick Day as our COO.

Ahoy, mateys!
We’ve got a brief update on shipping for the APAC region today. We just heard back from VFI and they have given us updated ETAs for all of our remaining backers.
Shipping Now
Mainland China and Hong Kong's orders were sent out by SF express and currently en route to backers.

Ahoy mateys!
Today we have two announcements regarding the app and shipping. Let’s start with the app. Currently, we’re working on a major update to the engine that powers the app. This update provides a whole host of features for all of you. It also gives us some much needed improvements on the back-end editor. This does mean we’ve paused content updates, but this a worthwhile trade-off to prioritize stability and core features first and foremost.

First and foremost, thanks to all our backers who played Sea of Legends this weekend! While the launch was a little rocky, we worked through the weekend to push forward several patches. Fellowship Games is proud to bring you Punga Miniatures new project: Three new and unique Undead teams for Fantasy Football! More than 70 miniatures in 32 mm scale, all made in resin!
                            Tireless Vampire Buccaneers appease their bloodlust on their quest for glory. The Sons of Anubis seek to rule as they did in the past, and the Crypt Guardians are here to cause as much chaos as they can. Which group of the Undead you will choose? Or will you take them all?  
Please note that now prices are in USD.  We left the prices at the same level as two years ago, in order to be available to our backers! And now all models will come with plastic bases for free. 
Bats can be detached on these Thralls
Size comparison
You can add any of the miniatures to your reward by increasing the pledge by the corresponding amount. You can also add any single miniature from a previous projects (Pi'Rats and  Savage Orcs), or an entire team as an add-on. Teams Pirat's, Cursed Crew, Underworld, Savage Orcs, Magma Tribe come with their set of free stretch goals!
To see full Pi'Rats price list please follow the link:  http://pungaminiatures.com/pirats_list
In the Pledge Manager after the campaign ends you will be able to change your reward if you need and confirm which add-ons you've selected. 
Rat Box, size: 275*275*70, foam holder optionally
Vampire Box, size: 275*275*70, foam holder optionally
  Design for special Boxes for Egyptian and Necromance teams is in progress!
Punga Hoodie
More to come...
 We ship to all the world. Shipping costs vary depending of your location.
EU, USA, UK, Canada: 10$/ 15$
Rest of the World: 15$/ 20$
The estimated delivery date for the project is February 2021.
Here you can see live photos of miniatures from the last Punga project Pi'Rats, on a 32 mm scale. In this project, we estimate the same quality! We use resin cast on manual full-cycle manufacturing. 
Please note that each mini comes unpainted and unassembled.
Since founding, we produced more than 40,000 miniatures already. 
Each of our projects was a challenge for our team. In the first project (Savage Orcs) we needed to produce 3,500 miniatures, in the second (Canitaurs&Felitaurs) there were more than 5,000, and for Pi'Rats about 25,000 miniatures. Each stage of increasing the volumes of production wasn't easy for us, but we always tried to do everything for our fans to justify your trust.
And now we can say that we can efficiently produce many models with excellent detail. We improved the locks between the parts (we had such a problem in Canitaurs project) and reduced the number of parts in miniatures. 
The project is a collaboration of Punga Miniatures and Fellowship Games. 
Fellowship Games is a partnership formed from individuals from around the board game industry. We have several years experience in publishing, manufacturing, design/development, and distribution/fulfillment. We've formed a network of contacts that uniquely position us to work with creators from around the world (and here in the US too!) on making their dreams a reality! Working with Punga is just the first of many projects planned for the future!
Punga Miniatures was created by several friends in 2017. From the very beginning, we really liked unusual concepts, so we created our first big project by our original concept Savage orcs inspired Polynesian culture. After the successful launch of this project, we have greatly improved our production, and also started working in 3D and increased the team. 
Today Punga is an association of extremely talented people who, by some miracle, gathered in one place in the center of the city of Ufa, in Russia. The team squad became sustained and now without any of these people, Punga is not Punga.

campaign.story:
A quaint home packed to the rafters with trinkets, curiosities, and the occasional miracle. A sleepy kingdom on the cusp of disaster. A wicker gate hanging by its hinges, with Somewhere Else lurking beyond. Three guardians who can save everything-- if they can stop squabbling long enough.
Welcome to Wickedness, a fantasy RPG by M Veselak about the resilience and power of queer community. Form a coven between three mystical archetypes (the innocent and gentle Pure Heart, the volatile, revelrous Wild Spirit, and the uptight, scholarly Old Soul) and try to keep your world of magic and mystery in balance with the mundane world, in spite of its ignorance, poverty and violence.
The Game
Wickedness is a peculiar tabletop game written for exactly three players and one tarot deck, with no dice and no GM. It uses a bespoke tarot-drawing system loosely inspired by Jay Dragon’s Sleepaway, but is itself a departure from the Belonging Outside Belonging framework developed by Avery Alder and Benjamin Rosenbaum.
The game is played in three acts: in the first, players discover their coven, the sanctuary they call home, a mundane fantasy nation, and the treacherous underworld lurking beneath it. Each player will be assigned one of the three coven archetypes (The Pure Heart, The Old Soul, and The Wild Spirit) by the tarot deck, and then together they’ll create the world where they live, and the underworld's strange laws and denizens. Finally, they’ll ask heavy-hitting questions about the covens’ relationships to one another.
In the second chapter, the cards point to a series of challenges detailed in the games’ interpretation Guide, and the players respond: the coven can fall prey to their archetype-specific follies in order to collect cards, spend the cards to solve challenges with wisdom, or use the vast and terrible magic powers at their fingertips-- which is miraculous, but costs the user a piece of their essential nature, striking out and maybe even blackening and replacing a truth on their character sheet. So the players have to strike a balance between keeping the worlds from falling into darkness, and keeping one another from falling apart. If the scales tip too far in any direction, it’s entirely possible for the game to come to an abrupt and apocalyptic end.
The final chapter tempts the coven to go their separate ways, but also offers them opportunities to learn from their past mistakes and heal, and finally they'll face their ultimate fates, determining the future of the kingdom, the underworld, and the art of magic itself.
Because of the speedy episodic storytelling, the players will witness years of trials, triumphs and transformations in just 4-8 hours of gameplay. Jay Dragon joins our friends Jeeyon Shim and Brennan Lee Mulligan for a three-part actual play below:
Why Kickstarter?
Wickedness is already a complete game: it’s been fully written and extensively playtested. We’ve decided to bring it to Kickstarter so that your support can turn it into the best possible product it can be. While we considered a few different ways to distribute Wickedness, a Kickstarter was the best tool for promotion, production, and distribution.
This Kickstarter has a higher funding goal than many equivalent Kickstarters of a similar size and production budget. Everyone involved in the project is in some way a marginalized creator, and we felt it was important that the budget reflects the value of their contributions. Even if Wickedness won’t fund as quickly as other projects, fair pay and economic support are our highest priorities.
The Wickedness Budget breaks down as follows:
 950$ for printing, shipping to the distribution site, and packaging. The plan is to release the game as a set of three 32 24-page zines, each half-letter size and full color, with uncoated paper. We plan to use Mixam for printing.
 1750$ for covers, interior art and layout.
 1300$ for editing and writing, at industry-standard rates.
 1000$ for project management, promotion, and recording an actual play.
 200$ just in case money!
 580$ for Kickstarter and credit card fees.
Each of the zines will contain a portion of the game, allowing them both to serve as a beautiful collection and a useful tool for playing Wickedness. The first zine will contain the rules needed to play the game. The second zine will contain an interpretation guide, that explains how to understand and translate the cards of your tarot deck. The third zine will contain the covenmate sheets and setting pages, along with alternate sheets by our stretch goal contributors. 
The zine bundle itself will have two sets of alternate covers - the regular one by our interior artist Tucker Donovan, and a limited edition alternate cover by Sadia Bies. Sadia is an incredible artist in the Philadelphia region, who is planning on making a beautiful metaphorical triptych representing the three covenmates of Wickedness (the Pure Heart, the Wild Spirit, and the Old Soul) as abstract god-archetypes. 
Some examples of Sadia's work
Stretch Goals
Our first three stretch goals are as follows, after which we'll announce our plans for gracefully expanding the game with a load of new contributors, concepts and challenges:
FUNDED - Pack The Zines With Illustrations
At 100% funding, we’ve budgeted for 13 illustrations total, including art assets for each of the Covenmate and World Pages, illustrations for each tarot suit in the Interpretation Guide, and three silhouetted spot illustrations in the main rules text. Our first stretch goal is to expand the number of spot illustrations in the core rules and the interpretation guide-- we would really like to see the game’s three archetypes represented each with a diversity of body shapes and gender presentations. With $7000 dollars, we can add six more illustrations, to capture more of the diversity of the Pure Heart, the Wild Spirit and the Old Soul.
FUNDED - Alternate Set Of Play Pages by Jamila R Nejadi
If we reach $8000, in addition to three sets of the original six play sheets (The Pure Heart, The Wild Spirit, The Old Soul, The Sanctuary, The Kingdom and The Underworld), Wickedness’s third zine will contain an alternative version of each page, designed by special guest writer Jamila R Nedjadi, who will be doing a cyberpunk reimagining of Wickedness's characters and setting. (This is very exciting!)
FUNDED - Pay Rate Increase
As outlined in our original budget, everyone involved in the project is being paid a fair rate competitive with industry standards. But at $9,000, we can do even better, increasing the pay scale of our team of marginalized creators closer to what their talent and perspective are actually worth.
FUNDED - Even More Illustrations
With $11,000 dollars, in addition to covering the limited edition zines, we can ensure there's a story-inspiring image on every page. These images will flesh out the text with marginalia of witchy trinkets and tools, as well as the phantasmal effects of the underworld.
FUNDED - Alternate Set Of Play Pages by Caro Asercion
If we reach $12,000, in addition to three sets of the original six play sheets (The Pure Heart, The Wild Spirit, The Old Soul, The Sanctuary,  The Kingdom and The Underworld), Wickedness’s third zine will contain a second alternative version of each page, designed by special guest writer Caro Asercion, who will be doing a magical realist / urban pastel reimagining of Wickedness's characters and setting. (This will mean that the game can present a fantastic past, present or future!)
FUNDED - Pay Rate Increase
Our priority with Wickedness has always been a fair rate for our designers and artists. At $13,000, we'll be able to make sure everyone can survive and thrive in these difficult times.
FUNDED - Alternate Swords Challenges by Quinn Milton
At $15000, special guest writer Quinn Milton (stunning artist and author ofLet Me In) will write new challenges for the Swords suit, challenging the coven with new scenarios centered on outside ignorance and violence.
FUNDED - Alternate Coins Challenges by Adira Slattery
Special guest writer Adira Slattery (co-author of the seminal work Draw A Square In The Dirt With A Stick And Then Stand In The Square And Yell "Sex Is Here") will be writing an alternate set of challenges for the Coins suit, presenting new takes on the pressures of poverty and exploitation if Wickedness clears $16000!
FUNDED - Alternate Wands Challenges by Raine Grayson
At $17000, dramaturge, activist, and Queeries blog founder Raine Grayson will grace us with an alternate set of challenges for the Wands suit, creating even more messed up fantastical metaphors for mental illness and gender dysphoria.
FUNDED - Alternate Cups Challenges by Kira Magrann
Finally, at $18000, special guest writer Kira Magrann (author of A Cozy Den and Something Is Wrong Here) will step in to write an alternative Cups suit at $18000, designing totally new interpersonal challenges to test the bonds of the coven.
  The Team
M is a games tinkerer, body liberation essayist, and elusive cryptid. Her works center mythological identity, transformation and community-building. When she’s not writing, she can most often be found lounging around like a modern day Venus of Urbino and untangling the complexities of N-dimensional gender space. This is her first kickstarter!
Tucker is a 20-something queer artist living in the Hudson Valley. They enjoy playing fighters, drawing monster people digitally and in watercolor, and sampling fine European chocolates.
Ruby is a graphic designer and illustrator living in Philadelphia. She likes texture, critical theory, fantasy, and weird plants. Notably, she did the exquisite layouts for last year's Sleepaway.
Beau is a designer, journalist, leadership educator and editor for indie tabletop roleplaying games. Their work is predominately about queerness, self-expression, desire, and safety, and includes games such as Turn, the Let Me Take A Selfie collection, and the Script Change safety mechanic. When not designing games, they can often be found falling in love with their partners, practicing photography, and talking about Lord of the Rings.
Jay is a young game designer in the Hudson Valley, with a frantic attachment to creation. Jay manages Possum Creek Games, a small publishing company with a focus on zines and story games projects. This is Jay’s third Kickstarter involvement, and has handled a couple rodeos before.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re living in an unprecedented period of social and economic upheaval. The COVID-19 crisis means that there could be unexpected delays and issues with printing costs, international shipping, project health, and economic factors beyond our control. We will do everything in our power to mitigate those risks, and to develop alternative means of delivery if we encounter a setback.

On a brighter note, the text of the game is entirely complete and playable right now, making Wickedness a relatively low-risk project to back: the game is done. The main brunt of the Kickstarter work will be editing, art, layout, and distribution. If Wickedness doesn’t fund, we’ll likely release it as a simplified PDF on itch.io, but ideally we want players to enjoy it as a three-zine set with brilliant art and an eye-catching layout.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
