campaign.story:
We're funded, thank you! Only one more stretch goal to go, and it unlocks ineffable digital gods to worship! Tell your friends!
Somewhere beyond the static, the servers of a digital universe called World churn endlessly, instantiating a pristine utopia for the pleasure of the Users who inhabit it.  This sprawling, post-scarcity metropolis is built on a cloud of data where the only true commodity is Memory: the privilege to record, store, and view the priceless recollections that stitch together an identity.  Users are careful never to barter away their Core Memories, the fragments of truth that make them real people...
 But you did. Whether by choice, foolishness, conspiracy, or the growing bitterness of a peace-less immortality, you cast aside the last remnants of your Memory and the oblivion you found was as dark and deep as death… Yet even that did not last. For Users bereft of a sense of self, for those who don’t remember but can’t die, there is only Pocket World.
Your search for Memory has taken you into a Pocket Partition, a miniaturized dimension sealed away from the rest of World. Can you steal the ancient, pure Memories that await you and reconstruct your Core before the Troubleshooters catch you or your battery runs out? Will the instance break down and collapse from the unstoppable Glitch that followed you here? Can you escape in time?
Play to find out!
A nameless User finds someone else's Memory, and for a moment, feels alive again.
Pocket World is a fusion of story game and dungeon crawl, pairing Old School adventure sensibilities with Forged in the Dark game-play.
 EXPLORE a haunted partition, with content generation tools that help everyone visualize the fictional space and the dangers lurking within.
 CHALLENGE players with a robust system of threats and game states, from risk/reward die rolls to chaos and alarm conditions.
 OVERCOME the partition with tense resource management and powerful special abilities, wielded by characters free to specialize in violent or non-violent methods.
 DISCOVER your character's true self by claiming Memories that unlock great power, and perhaps even restore identity...
A deadly Widget Cultist on the hunt for spare parts.
Pocket World is a "digital dungeon crawl", including rules to create a User, find out what's wrong with them, and see them through a season of connected Partitions, gradually gathering the Memories they need to escape and return to World, restored.  The core tension of the game comes from two competing clocks--ESCAPE and CHAOS--that drive players to take decisive action and risk losing everything in a madcap race for Memory as the Partition crumbles.
The Game Boss (or GB for short) has tools for content creation that are comprehensive. Tables for room and threat generation follow the conversational flow of dungeon exploration, while prompts for terrain, mood, and environmental details allow anyone to imagine a fantastic and wholly unique Partition.  You could also use the generation prompts and tools of Pocket World to create a Metroid-style data dungeon for use in any old school game system!
Bosses also come equipped with poignant lists of questions that build out each player's vision of their User and the Partition throughout play. By the end of a delve, you've discovered a rich story of struggle, loss and nostalgia, one that everybody helped create. 
The final zine may use colored paper, or 1 color printing.
 In addition to the zine, we are looking to produce a metal-and-enamel pin for diehard Hello, World fans who back at Moderator tier or higher! A mockup is below, though the design is subject to minor changes.
Pierce thin clothing and lanyards with this concealable pointed weapon!
 Right now our budget is for a 28-page zine if we meet our first goal, loaded with art and tables, but we have some ideas for additional design elements to add to the game if we can make it a 36-page (or higher!?) print run!
These Stretch Goals aren't the end of the line for Pocket World. If there is enough interest, we will look into drafting another zine full of additional modules, each complete with a map and special rules for interacting with unique characters, manipulating different economies, and contending with truly unstoppable monstrosities. We believe strongly in the philosophy of adventure first, and the more people play Pocket World, the more Pocket World we'll make! 
Guided by a nefarious VIRAL CAT, a hapless User careens towards his doom.
Charles (@umbral_aeronaut) is going back to school this fall to study law. He is owned by a cat named Luigi.  He is responsible for Pocket World's layout, pixel art, the core system and character design. The premise of Pocket World is adapted from the setting of Hello, World which can be found here:  umbralaeronaut.itch.io/hello-world .  You might find Charles GMing Hello, World for strangers at conventions across North America!  His next convention will be at BreakoutCon in Toronto!
James (@ironBlue1990) is going to school right now for graphic design. He is responsible for Pocket World's line art, most of its writing, random tables, mapping and systems design.
Mabel (@MaybeItsMabel) was a consultant during the design of Pocket World for project management, layout, and fonts.  Her music can be found at: https://dontdoitneil.com/.  She is also the designer of the Forged in the Dark supplement Steelweaver's Rebellion: https://mabelharper.itch.io/steelweavers-rebellion.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter project! For this reason, we have taken great care to look at previous Zinequest peer campaigns (both successful and unsuccessful) and compare markers for success. We've done our best to manage expectations to best handle a project even if it only just meets it's goal; one unfortunate side-effect of this was the discovery that we had to limit our physical shipping fulfillment to the US due to the unpredictable and costly nature of overseas shipping.

If sufficient demand were to arise, we will reexamine our fulfillment plans and engage with partners (such as Backerkit) to handle a larger fulfillment.

updates.update_content: Hello Backers! I wanted to reach out and thank everyone for their continued interest in Pocket World. We're still plugging away at it.

Backers,
It was our stated schedule to deliver the PDF rewards for this project last month, but as you can plainly see, our schedule has slipped. I want to apologize to you all for that, and I am sorry. By way of explanation, this is our first published game and thus an inevitable learning experience, we are taking our time to make it as valuable to you as possible, and various "real" life disruptions and distractions have of course made progress slower than we'd like.

Greetings Programs! A quick update for Pocket World is in order.
Layout work has slowed down due to social distancing measures that have made many things in life slower and more mentally perilous. That said, I believe (with fingers crossed) that we remain roughly on track for the projected fulfillment timeline: PDF fulfillment could potentially slip a little bit past May but if it does we will alert you all. 
We have responses to our fulfillment survey from all but a handful of folks, and we've sent out messages to those missing. If you haven't received a message on Kickstarter, then it means you are fine and we have your information! That said, we will post a reminder for everyone to check their mailing addresses for any changes as the shipping timeline draws nearer.

updates.update_content:
Hey backers!
Since the post-campaign high has worn off and I've come down to earth, a lot has happened on our shiny blue marble. I did some catching up with real life and started a torturous process of layout iteration. I had a lot to learn about the kind of style I wanted the zineto have, but thankfully I'm starting to finalize pages that seem brighter, more colorful and readable. They don't make me puke at any rate, and that's a firm endorsement!

Thank you everyone!  Pocket World is a success, and James and I have the chance now to polish up a whole bunch of additional bits of the game that we had no idea if we would have space to fit in!
Stand by for further updates including fulfillment information requests and more previews as we continue testing, finish project writing, and go to layout!  Please let us know if you have any questions, we will answer to the best of our ability!

The campaign's almost over, and it looks like (cross your pincers and hope to derez) that we're gonna hit the 2k stretch goal. Thank robot heaven! The game isn't really complete without the campaign arc.
Some quick production notes:
The pins have been ordered! We went through Wizardpins, and the process was quick and painless. Highly recommended for those of you who want your own rpg on a pin! Here's a preview:

campaign.story:
Overview
Francita (me)
Hello!!! My name is Francita, and I’m a graphic designer from Chile. Currently I am working as freelancer, mostly for people in the TTRPG community, but I’m hoping to get a full-time job in the US, and relocate there. You can see my portfolio here, or follow me on twitter here.
I had an idea recently of doing enamel pins. No, you know what? That’s not accurate. I had this idea of doing enamel pins A LONG TIME AGO. I just could never decide of what. Then, recently, I thought how nice it would be to design a series of pins inspired by LGBT and TTRPGs, so people could proudly wear them at cons or just in everyday life.
Then I just did the designs, and made up my mind to create this Kickstarter, and here we are.
I have to admit the thing I am most excited about this is be able to wear one of these pins myself. So, yeah, let’s make this happen?
The Designs
There are 14 designs in total, which are (now 17, including the first set of pronouns pins!):
The 14 main designs

Critically Ace
Critically Agender
Critically Aro
Critically Bi
Critically Demi
Critically Fluid
Critically Gay
Critically Intersex
Critically Lesbian
Critically Non-binary
Critically Pan
Critically Poly
Critically Queer
Critically Trans
Each pin will be 1.75” at its maximum width. They will be a hard enamel pin, gold, and each pin will have their backing card.
Pin assembled with backing card
Update: In addition, we have decided to unlock the first set (purple) pronoun pins at initial launch!
Purple Pronoun Pins released at base funding with graphic and mock ups.
Timeline
March 2nd: Kickstarter campaign goes live!
March 31st: Kickstarter campaign ends. Surveys will go out. I will wait a week for the survey responses.
April 13th: Production begins!
Mid-May: Quality assurance takes place. After that, shipping starts.
After I start shipping, it will depend on your location how long it will take, but generally it would take in between 1 and 3 weeks to reach you, so you should expect the pins to arrive in June or July, which will be the approximate time that the pins will be available in my Etsy store as well.
There’s an Early Bird rate of $9, available for the first day of the Kickstarter. Then, the regular Kickstarter rate is $10. After funding, the pins will be available at my Etsy store for $11.
Budget
Pie chart of budget
The way the budget will be distributed is the following:
Production - 40%
Actually making the pins, of course.
Shipping - 22%
Sending the pins to YOU.
Fees & Taxes - 16%
Kickstarter fees, any other fees, and taxes.
Design - 11%
This goes to me, for the design of the pins. I love designing things for the community, and this cut of the budget will allow me to keep designing awesome stuff for you folx.
Handling - 11%
As I told you, and many of you know, I’m not from the US, but it would have been very inconvenient to produce the pins here in Chile and then send them to the United States and all other places (because shipping here is not very good, and that’s being kind) so, because of that, Dyer (BasiliskOnline) will help me handle the situation. That means, he will be the one receiving the pins from production, packaging them, and shipping them to you. And for all this trouble, plus storing a ton of pins in his space, he needs to be paid for it.
The initial Kickstarter goal is to make 100 units of each design. Now, I will only know how many actual pins of each design I will have to make after the kickstarter ends and the survey is filled. So, these amounts are the minimum amounts I have to make (manufacturer requirement) and any pins that are not claimed in the Kickstarter will become stock for my Etsy store, where you will be able to purchase the pins afterwards.
Stretch Goals
But, the fun doesn’t end here. I have amazing stretch goals for you. I’m particularly excited about this, because it pairs so well with the main pin designs.
So, without further ado, pronoun pins!
Stretch Goal tiers! Different colors per tier (Purple, Pink, Green, Blue, Orange, Yellow)
Each +$1000 over the main goal will add a set of pronoun pins to the production. This will be unlocked by color, and there are 6 colors to be unlocked: purple, pink, green, blue, orange and yellow.



I love every single one of these pronoun pins, and I realy hope we can unlock them all!
Mockup of some of the pins
FAQ
How do I choose which pins I want?
A survey will be sent your way after the campaign ends, and I will wait until April 12th to send the work order with the survey answers and start production.
Will I be able to choose from the stretch goal pins too?
Of course. Be aware though that the amount of pins according to your pledge are the slots you have to choose pins from both the main designs and the unlocked stretch goal pins.
When will my pins arrive?
Pins should arrive either in June or July. Shipping is scheduled to start at the end of May.
What size are the pins?
Each pin will be 1.75” at its maximum width.
What color will be the metal of the pins?
Gold.
What are the various shipping prices within the US?
1-9 Pins: $5; 10-13 Pins: $6; 14 Pins: $7; 15-17 Pins: $10, 18-20 Pins: $15.
What are the various shipping prices Outside the US?
All prices estimated through pirateship.com
UK & EU: 1-8 Pins: $15; 9-20 Pins: $25
Australia: 1-8 Pins: $18; 9-20 Pins: $28
Canada: 1-8 Pins: $13; 9-20 Pins: $21
Rest of the World 1-8 Pins: $16; 9-20 Pins: $26
I would like to back, but shipping prices are so high!
We completely understand! Shipping prices can be a real killer for physical goods kickstarters, especially for small time creators. Something I've seen work well in the past is to arrange for some local friends to all go in on a single higher pledge together to split shipping! (eg: instead of 3 of you each getting a 3 pin pledge, get a 9 pin pledge and share the shipping cost!)
Can I buy a pin for someone else in the community?
Yes! We have 2 new tiers (Pay-it-Forward Domestic and Pay-it-Forward-Abroad) so you can buy pins for someone else. We will find homes for these pins ourselves, probably through a giveaway that is gonna be done after the Kickstarter funds but before the manufacturing order gets sent, so we know which pins they want.
I want to buy more than one pin for someone else, How do I do it?
For Domestic (USA): add an extra $15 to your "Pay-it-Forward Domestic" pledge ($10 pin + $5 shipping) to add one more pin.
For Abroad: add an extra $28 to your "Pay-it-Forward Abroad" pledge ($10 pin + $18 shipping) to add one more pin.
Add as many pins as you want just adding the extra amounts listed above.
I want to get a pin for myself, and a pin for someone else. What do I do?
Choose the amount of pins you want for yourself with the corresponding tier, and then:
For Domestic (USA): add an extra $15 to your pledge ($10 pin + $5 shipping)
 For Abroad: add an extra $28 to your pledge ($10 pin + $18 shipping)
Add as many pins as you want just adding the extra amounts listed above.
Contact
If you have any inquiries about the campaign, the pins, myself or anything else, send me an email to byfrancita@gmail.com or contact me on Twitter.

Another mockup of some of the pins
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter, so I was specially careful with calculating the amounts needed to make this project happen, but still I could have made mistakes in doing the math. That's why I have a little Oops amount already considered in the Kickstarter goal, for if something happens.

The designs have been already looked at by the manufacturer and discussed with me what would be the best way to get them done. Still, there could be minor changes to design if some problem arises with production. My manufacturer has been specially helpful in guiding me through the process, since this is my first time producing enamel pins, so I expect everything to go as smoothly as can be in that regard.

Even though I wish it didn't happen, there will be pins with minor imperfections. I will do quality assurance in May before shipping and only ship those I consider of a decent quality.

The handling and shipping of the pins will be done from the United States (BasiliskOnline will be in charge of that), so it will be easier to complete the process than doing it from Chile, where I live.

I am expecting this campaign to go well, and there's a possibility that it doesn't go well. There's also the possibility that it goes way better than I anticipated, and we are left with a lot more pins to ship than we were ready for. In that case, I am going to hire more people to help handle the packing and shipping of the pins, so it still gets to you in time (I am really hoping to see a bunch of you with #CriticallyPins at Gen Con).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Before Starting:
Kickstarter's employees are currently in an ongoing fight for unionization. Kickstarter United has not called for any direct action or boycotting of Kickstarter's services as of now. It is important to put their cause front and center and acknowledge their efforts to receive recognition from the company.
This campaign stands with Kickstarter United's ongoing fight for unionization. For more info, head to their website or follow them on twitter.
 You are all Goblins, congratulations! 
You are also all barreling through space in a ship made of junk and scrap, how lucky! Your goal: to make it to Junktopia, the rogue planet in the middle of space, a utopia for the Goblins, with your ship intact and as much Junk as you can to further its beauty!
Space Goblins! is a HIGH CHAOS AND TRULY OUTRAGEOUS RPG meant for 2-5 players with rotating referee play and an emphasis on wild Goblin-created mayhem!
The Game!
Using Nate Treme's Tunnel Goons as a base, Space Goblins! has a simple and easy character creation and resolution mechanic for "anything goes, describe and roll" storytelling and gameplay! A uniquely designed-by-me rotating referee and clearly defined phases of play make for an easy game to pick up and learn-through-play as well as a great way to get everyone involved! From goblins new to RPGs, new to being a referee, or veterans of all types, Space Goblins! is a great place to mess around and share a good time with others! It's also great for children!
Space Goblins! is encouraged and compatible with Legos or any other interlocking plastic building block collection as your Junk collection, collaboratively and physically building up and breaking down your Junk Ship as you play! Each session have fun creating a unique ship which you can hold in your hands and play with! Break it down after you're done or keep it as a reminder of your amazing and wonderful journey to Junktopia! Other amazing features include:
Create Goblins that embody the most Goblin of stats: Scrapper, Tinkerer, Rascal, and Rude! 
Collaboratively create your Junkship that embodies the most Goblin of design elements: Rough, Tough, Scoot, and Shoot! 
Roll an unnecessary amount of d8s together to figure out what ship you crash into when looking for Junk!
 Set Game Length of 3-5-8 rounds allows you to play a short campaign of Space Goblins! sessions, troupe style play throughout several journeys to Juntktopia, or a very quick and fun one shot!
Why Kickstart?
I'm choosing to take Space Goblins! to Kickstarter so that I can properly finish up this game and polish it to a state I'm proud of. Space Goblins! as a game has been done since I released it last year, and it has received many playtests and small QOL updates. 
The $1800 I am asking for with this campaign is to bring Space Goblins! to print as well as to hire other collaborators to illustrate, layout, and edit my words that are currently just text in a PDF. Most of the budget is going towards paying all involved in the project (seen below) fair wages. The rest is going towards the print run and shipping. I'm giving my collaborators a lot of freedom with what they do with the game in terms of illustrations and layout, so the budget is slightly inflated to assure they will not be underpaid for their work. Any extra profit that is made after calculating printing + shipping + fees, and paying collaborators for their work, will be split evenly amongst all members of this project.

The Goblins Who Made This!
Viditya Voleti - Prolific Game Designer! - Viditya Voleti (me) has been called by many titles, but most important of them is A True Goblin. He has been designing games forever and even got a degree in Interactive Arts. Viditya has made many games, including the profound Space Between Stars, the incredible VOLUME (an accompanying zine to Adam Vass's TOME), the life-changing The Fire Flickers Between You, and of course the world-shattering Space Goblins! His passion is to allow people a chance to tell fun stories through play and to make each play experience unique not only in narrative but also tactility, gameplay, and goblin-ness. You can find his work at vidityavoleti.itch.io and their social media at @vidityavoleti!
Glo Wan - Illustrator! - Glo is an incredible illustrator and designer who has already brought Space Goblins! to life with the cover! Their style is unmatched and is the pinnacle of Goblin, which is why they are perfect for the job and will be contributing a few more spot illustrations within the zine itself! Glo's work can be found in the following place! Website: glowanart.com/ Twitter: twitter.com/glooblin  Instagram: instagram.com/glooblin/
Jamila R. Nedjadi - Layout Artist! - Jamila R. Nedjadi may be a professional tarot reader and prolific game creator, but in their heart of hearts Jammi is a space goblin. The kind that swings around a space sword and sings space songs in space! Until the next life, where goblin glory awaits, you can find their games of magic, story, and emotional connection at Sword Queen Games (link: https://temporalhiccup.itch.io)
Tyler Crumrine - Editor! - Tyler Crumrine previously edited Viditya's fantasy zine VOLUME as well several RPG products for World Champ Game Co. and Apollyon Press. He's also the designer of Beak, Feather, & Bone: A Map-Labeling RPG. As editor, Tyler will be making sure everything in SPACE GOBLINS! reads well and is easy to use at the table. Find more about his work at www.crumrine.info

Reward Tiers
Space Goblins! is a project I want to keep pretty simple and straight forward! The reward tiers offered are designed to make getting the game into your hands (digital or physical) as easy as possible AND also affordable for the work being done by the wonderful team of creatives so they get paid properly!
Of course, if you want a little extra Goblin in your game, there's a special tier for a unique, handwritten starting room for your Ship on the JUNK SHIP TABLE to give you a fun jumping-off point on your first game! This here is for the Goblins who want an utterly ruined yet completely playable addition to their Print Copy of Space Goblins! I'll personally fill in the first room on your JUNK SHIP TABLE as a seed for your first journey to Junktopia! I may also leave some other notes and graffiti (and a thank you) here and there, who knows where Goblin Inspiration comes from?
Finally, I will lick your zine giving you the absolutely true goblin product. 
Community Copies
This project will be supporting the spread of Community Copies towards those who are unable to financially give to this Kickstarter during its duration. The Community Copies will be broken down as followed:
All digital backers ($10 Pledge) will contribute another digital copy towards the Community Copies stash. This ensures a 1:1 of digital copies for Space Goblins!
All backers who pledge at the Physical Community Copy tier ($25) will secure an additional Physical Zine to be added to the stash and will be offered to those who wish to claim a physical zine!
 People who pledge Only $1 will be reached out to first when the Community Copies are available. Afterward, all unclaimed Community Copies will go on the Space Goblins! itch.io page so anyone can claim them at any point.

campaign.story:
Growing up, my friends and I inserted ourselves into our favorite stories. Sailor Moon, Pokemon, Legend of Zelda, Redwall...we had our own original characters for all of these properties, and so many more. Characters we put time and energy and love and thought into creating. Characters that meant a lot to us, because they were a part of us, but also better: maybe stronger or smarter or older or braver.
Proof Copy, not at all final.
 I think anyone who engages with media and pop culture, especially when you engage as a kid, is bound to create an original character or two. And these characters are great, because they help establish your understanding of a literary world and of storytelling.
But there’s this tendency online where, when a female-presenting person does this and presents their character online, their character is usually treated with disdain. The character is called “unrealistic,”  or “wish fulfillment”--and these might be true statements, but when has fiction ever had to be about realism? There’s nothing wrong with wanting to be a part of your favorite franchise, or to be better than you see yourself in real life. 
Proof
 There’s this thing that’s become something of an old adage, now, online, that goes:
“There’s this girl, and she’s so beautiful and charming that everyone wants to be with her, and she’s incredibly rich, and she’s super smart and can make anything she thinks of, and she really strong and tough and has trained with the best martial artists and fighters in the world, and she’s bested them all, and she’s just a normal human but she’s stronger than all the superpowered people around her and she knows how to defeat them if she has to, and she’s also thoughtful and adopts needy children and helps raise them to be strong like her, and...and...and..and what if I told you she was Batman?”
Because, here’s the thing...Mary Sue is a dirty word almost entirely because of the internet. It became a way to push girls down and tell them their ideas were stupid and overpowered and “unrealistic.”
So instead of treating the term “Mary Sue” repressively, I want my game to embrace everything that makes Mary Sues great and fun.
This game is about embracing the perfections of a character, and making them as overpowered and ludicrous as possible. You and your friends will work cooperatively to create a Mary Sue and determine incredibly important things (like their hairstyle, their special powers, their unique feature, and the genre they come from) using a D12, a character sheet, and a little creativity. The sillier, the more over-the-top, the better!
This is a game about empowering yourself to make those characters you used to make when you were 5 or 8 or 13 years old, and to do so entirely without shame.  This is the party game Let’s Make a Mary Sue!
Because, truly, the best thing about making an original character (do not steal) is making it! 
Proof
  WHY MARY SUES?
I grew up when websites like Fanfiction.net and Deviantart were just starting to find success, so I have an intimate familiarity with Mary Sues and the negative attitude towards them. But what's great is that there's been a perceptible shift in favor of Mary Sues in the past few years. The creator of the Mary Sue Litmus Test is on record as no longer supporting thier test, as the term Mary Sue is used to "tear down female characters simply for having a prominent, active role in a story." Websites like The Mary Sue have appropriated the term and used it to offer a feminist perspective on pop culture. The dialogue has generally shifted to regard the term "Mary Sue" as an outdated, unhelpful one, and that means it's high time for us to take it and make it positive! 
It's important to note that Mary Sues is not a game restrained by gender, race, or sexual identity: anyone can be a Mary Sue.
Headshot of the author as a young Mary Sue.
STRETCH GOALS
$400—Every print reward will come with some fun swag! (UNLOCKED)
$600—Every print reward will come with a special 14th category of animal companions! (UNLOCKED)
$800—Every print reward will come with a recipe for the next time you run Let's Make a Mary Sue! for your friends! (UNLOCKED)
$1,000—Every print reward will come with a picture of one of Ellie's beautiful cats, Smudge and Tali!
$1,500—We will unlock a Mary Sue sketchbook available for purchase as an add on!
$1,920—Every print reward will come with a mini rule book on playing a "competitive" Let's Make a Mary Sue! campaign.
Will there be more stretch goals? That's up to you!

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
As is often the case, my expectations of myself were a little too lofty, and my day job took over a lot of the past 2 months for me (along with plasma donations and holidays) and everyone at Density Media, but we're here. 
Final edits are done. The book will be sent off to the printers shortly. Backer surveys have been sent out. I'm hoping we can ship the books out before the winter holidays get too hectic. Because of the nature of USPS and the season, I can't guarantee physical items will make it to you in time for gifting, but I'm hoping everyone will get their books and rewards by mid-January.
Happy October!

Hello everyone!
Thank you for bearing with us through this difficult time! As we've said before, COVID-19 has really thrown a metaphorical wrench into our completion of this project. Barak and I were able to social distance meet up briefly before school started to sketch out our plans for finishing. Of course, once school started, there were boarders who had to quarantine, and even one possible case of COVID. Obviously, with the news that someone who has already had COVID can catch it again, I am a bit reticent to risk exposure. I continue to donate convalescent plasma as often as I am able. Our two week quarantine is almost complete at this point.

Hello all,
Apologies for the lack of communication this month. Phase 2 of our state was just a blink of an eye, and now we are at Phase 3, and frankly, it's scary.
Both of us have been working since March with no real break. We had the best intentions to get together in person to cook, and edit, and resolve all the finishing details. But Ellie had to go back to working in an office, and my workplace went from a campus with 3 people on it to a campus with a full parking lot.

We would be remiss if we didn't take a minute to state clearly and unequivocally that Black Lives Matter.
Let's Make a Mary Sue is a game about inclusion, about how anyone and everyone can be a Mary Sue. A big part of LMAMS for me is that Mary Sues should be diverse in terms of race, gender, sexuality, and presentation.
In order to back up our words, we have donated $117 of our Kickstarter earnings, $1 for each of our wonderful backers, to , an organization that helps fight homelessness rates in the Black transgender community, as well as lower the risk for affirmative surgeries being done in ways that put them at greater health risks by raising money for rent and gender affirmation surgeries for Black Trans folx.

Hi there everyone!
We are not going to hit our April deadline, obviously. We would like to still hope for May, but our state is closed by the government until mid-to-late May at least.
For many projects we do, we would be done at this point, however, this project is unique. We want to test recipes so that folks can have options depending on diets. We want to get together in person and spend time putting the final bits of love and care into this. We are excited to bring all elements promised to you. In the meantime, we worked on several games that were released as part of a bundle of games designed with social distancing and quarantine in mind. We have also hosted several events and games in an effort to remain connected with friends old and new.

Just a quick update and keep you all aware of what's going on: editing is done on the book, we're currently determining the center spread character, and we're generally in good shape to be printing soon. However, all non-essential businesses have closed in our area, so our local printer has very limited hours, but is still currently open (to our knowledge).
B and I had a chance to test the game before we went full remote this past week. Below are the two Sues we created:

We here at Density Media wanted to take a moment to reach out to you and make sure you're okay.
Things in the world are scary, stressful, and changing quickly, and we want to do right by all of our amazing, incredible backers. We pride ourselves on our ability to turn around high quality product in a short amount of time, but with everything the way it is, there is a chance we may not be able to deliver Let's Make A Mary Sue by April, as promised. We are still working to hit our goal, but there is a chance our local printing shop may close before we are ready to send our product to press. We also tend to work in person when we collaborate, which is becoming potentially more dangerous as the virus progresses, and mailing product also requires a fair amount of in-person interaction. We want to be absolutely transparent and realistic with all of you about the situations we face as we work to get our product in your hands.

campaign.story:
Kingdoms is a dark role-playing game set to the dawn of civilization, with the birth of man in an untamed sunless world. You will lead your civilization, birth heirs, fight back the terrible monstrosities, and as generations pass, eventually, form nations. 
 The game is designed to run out of box with light OSR-inspired rules that push the focus of gameplay onto the player’s own decisions and immersion rather than their character sheet. You are not a grand hero, no matter what your myth may be at the end of your life, but instead a human struggling along with your people to make solace in this dark world. As the leader of a small tribe of humanity, you will found the very foundations of civilization in the face of the suffocating darkness and the horrors within. You will explore the continent, experiment with strange discoveries, invent tools and culture, and, most importantly, slay and harvest the dangerous abominations. Once your threats are slain, you will settle; fortify; and expand your dominion. You will die, be it to disease, age, or slow liquefaction by stomach acid. But fear not, as quickly as you came, your heir will rise to your place and the cycle will continue unto larger kingdoms and greater threats. This is the way of Kingdoms, with the goal of playing out the succeeding generation each session.
The Kingdoms Zine Contains:
 Rules for creating a new Adam or Eve, along with unique racial traits that makes your bloodline stand out from the rest.
 Simple steps to breed, creating unique children that will no doubt disappoint.
 Mechanics for civilizing and expanding, designed to easily create and support your great empires and struggling hamlets.
 Discover an unexplored continent, teeming with strange flora and fauna acting as bizarre tools that will surprise you how player ingenuity develops them.
 Eight macabre monsters, drunk on decadence and power, they will challenge you with epic, Monster-Hunter style combats with signature beast attacks, multi-staged boss fights, and crafting materials for special weapons.
 A Unique Weapon System, in carving out legendary weapons from the slain corpses of grotesque behemoths.
 A DM's guide on running a multi-generational epic from the birth of society to the age of steam.
 Kingdoms is inspired by the intense boss battles of Monster Hunter, the grim epicness of Dark Souls, and the turbulent player-driven stories of legendary bloodlines and imperial legacy found in Crusader Kings. The story of mankind is yours to tell in Kingdoms. The players will hammer the foundations of human civilization in a sunless world through slaying the monstrosities of their era and assuming the role of their successors to continue the heroic lineage. Will your blood stand for strength in the face of the Dark? Strive for ingenuous discoveries to avoid bloodshed? Enforce mankind's divine right of conquest by trapping and bending the horrors of the Dark to their will? or Will your kingdom fall from heaven having squandered the resources accumulated from their mythic roots? 
 If you want to delve deeper into the mechanics and systems of Kingdoms, see more art from the book, and get constant updates you can check out the writer/artist's blog at www.puddleofstars.com .
STRETCH GOALS

The Dark gives and takes, in this particular instance, it does both. A horrifying new monster will be added to the book to destroy and harass your innocent players.
Fully illustrated deck of trait cards for easy inheritance and additional flavor! (Including new traits exclusive to the card deck).
 A new existential threat faces humanity... Only the greatest of men's spawn could even fathom to face it and keep their sanity intact. Can your people survive? This goal will round out the base monster roster to a final 10!
Across the ocean echoes tell of a land of glistening woods, cryptic swamps, and a great burgeoning empire ruled under golden boots. A full blown expansion zine that explores a whole new continent full of new monsters, flora, and a hostile empire looking to challenge preconceived notions of importance and greatness.
Full art equipment cards covering every weapon, armor piece, and accessory in the base book.  
 Advance your civilization from the birth of steam, to the PRIME of industrialization in this new era! Load guns, mass produce snake oil, and reconsider how you can put those monster parts to use in this age of industry.
A special alternate cover exclusive to backers of the Kickstarter campaign.
 Software available to all backers that allows you to generate Kingdoms PCs & NPCs on the fly, customize their looks, and create heirs with other characters made through the program.
Work in progress.
Adds an optional collection of illustrated antagonist NPCs to cause chaos in your campaign for added tension and drama in the kingdom. They can be as normal as an average man, or perhaps mystically distinct in their own right, either way, they will be a threat.
A big fat H U G E  list of tables stuffed into the cracks and crevices of Kingdoms. The zine is now bursting at the seems of what one would call a 'zine' anyways, so we are going to have to get creative with our layouts. But the added tables of names, strange peasantry, travel sickness, and fetid sicknesses should tempt the tastebuds!
ADD-ONS
To order simply increase your pledge by the appropriate amount without adjusting your tier. The cards will be sent out together with the base zine. Shipping charges will be invoiced when they are ready to ship.

updates.update_content: So it has been a hectic past couple of weeks. We are officially settled back in and working full speed again, all safe and sound. Still, we are especially grateful for all of the love and support during the past couple of weeks. All of this scrambling around the hurricanes has pushed our printing and shipping goals back a bit, so we want to thank everyone for your patience again. This month, we are working with our printer to get a physical proof copy as we finalize the zine and polish off the cards (we hope to show it off in the next update). Then, we hope to print en masse either late October or November.

Hey all you amazing dungeon masters/players, we apologize for the late update. As many of our US supporters probably know, Louisiana was hit with two hurricanes last week and we evacuated fully as a result. We are just now returning home from family in Nebraska and regaining access to our computers.
Our original goal was to get the first test copy of Kingdoms printed this month, with delivery in October, but with the valuable final weeks of crunch-time being spent moving our belongings half way across the country and back, our timeline will be impacted. After we are fully moved back home (next week), we will put out a (very late) August update and talk further about our release schedule. Thank you for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: July Update - Spreads, Lore & DM Stuff!
updates.update_content: Hey everyone! The content of the book is nearing completion, meaning we can start working on putting everything together. This month, we spent the majority of our time nailing out how to intuitively spread information across the book and crafting tools to make the DM's job easier. So, for this update we would like to highlight some interesting spreads found in the book.

Heyo everyone! Its been another productive month over here. Our eyeballs have been looking over equipment and traits, balancing and creating newly refined art for the cards as well as plentiful playtesting. We also did a whole lot of schedule managing and after taking an honest look at our workload, it looks like we are going to have to delay the zine from August to September. The delay comes mostly as a result of the additional content funded from the stretch goals. The cards, new monsters, character generator, and tables have expanded the art pieces needed by hundreds. We know delays are always lame, but giving more time to the zine and cards will give us much needed time to breathe.

While the world has continued to be in flames this month, we have marched on by finalizing the framework of the rules and further layering on the meat and sinew to our monstrous bones. This month has been busy...
We finished the front of the book with player rules and character creation. 
We completed the art, attack patterns, and equipment cards for the Dancer, the Fingers, the Worm, and the Scream. 
We refocused our critical eye on the society portion of the game, redesigning it with player feedback to make it reinforce the thematic core of Kingdoms.

Wow, so the past two months have been kind of crazy. If you're reading this on the twelfth, I just wanted to say Happy Easter and I hope you're celebrating safely wherever you may be quarantined at. 
I have been steadily finishing up more and more page layouts and mechanics. Almost everything is on schedule, the zine is reaching completion at a strong pace and I'm gradually nailing out more cards by the day. The only worry at this point is play-testing. Kingdoms is designed to run games of ambitious scale, and while there's plenty of time to test beasts and combat, making sure that the civilization building side of things is balanced is a bit of a rougher task. Nevertheless, we are gonna continue tweaking the zine until its perfect.

ITS OFFICIALLY DONE. We seriously cannot believe the amount of support we have gotten, every pledge, everyone that shared it with friends, every bit of encouragement left for us, this has been an absolute blast to run. We could not have achieved any of this without you guys, and this level of funding?! This is absolutely insane, we have been in a solid state of shock for weeks now.  So, we just want to thank everyone one more time, THANK YOU!

campaign.story:
Darker Malleus is an analog adventure game for 2 to 5 players about a band of righteous hunters on a journey to pursue and defeat a champion of the Adversary. Along the way they'll test their mettle and virtue against violence, duplicity, and temptation. In the end, they'll discover that Evil is not so wicked and the Creator is not so good. We play to find out if they'll triumph over the Devil anyway or join the ranks of the Adversary's champions.
For Zine Quest 2, we're raising funds to bring Darker Malleus to you as a premium quality, 60 page zine and print-ready PDF. It features:
A fleshed out rules text friendly to veteran gamers and first-time players alike.
Randomly generated Hunters with varying backgrounds, equipment, and virtues. Plus, the possibility of playing a traitorous False Hunter.
A resolution system centering the Hunters' growing Hatred and how it eats away at their Virtues.
Clear advice and procedures for the Adversary, Darker Malleus' GM, to create scenarios and mediate play.
A luxurious layout that invites meditation on and annotation of the text.
Full-page, black and white illustrations by Felix Miall.
About the Layout
Darker Malleus features a layout with generous margins, inspired by early printed books. This style helps avoid information overload. Instead of scanning a cramped page for needed information, it's easy to grasp what rules and procedures are in a spread at a glance. The spacious margins also give room for personal annotations, letting each reader make the text their own.
Digital mockup. Lifepath spread not final.
Every Hunter has the seed of Hatred burning in their heart. This Hatred has a value that goes up to 10. Depending on the Hunter's Lifepath, their Hatred starts at 4, 5, or 6.
When a Hunter acts on the world, or is acted on in kind, and we're not sure of the result, we roll a ten-sided die (d10) and read its result as 0 through 9.
Dice icons modified from originals by John W. Sheldon of Daedalum AP Games.
When the result is equal to or less than their Hatred, it means that darkness and violence have won out in their heart. When the Hunter is trying to do violence or act with cunning, this is good. When the Hunter is trying to express their inborn Virtue or resist the Devil's temptation, this is bad.
When the result is greater than their Hatred, it means that light and virtue have won out in their heart. When the Hunter is trying to do violence or act with cunning, this is bad. When the Hunter is trying to express their inborn Virtue or resist the Devil's temptation, this is good.
A Hunter facing failure may declare "Not today, Satan!" to overcome their weakness, but doing so increases their Hatred.
A Hunter who, in their weakness, indulges their temptation, increases their Hatred.
If a Hunter's Hatred reaches 10, their heart breaks and they fall to Evil, becoming one of the Adversary's champions.
Digital mockup. Cover not final.
 Darker Malleus Physical Edition
Cover Paper: 120lbs uncoated | Text Paper: 100lbs uncoated | 60 pages.
The prize jewel of this campaign. A saddle-stitched zine-format (5.5"x8.5") booklet printed by Mixam on high quality, uncoated paper. Distributed by Exalted Funeral. 
U.S. shipping is included in your pledge.
Playtest zines printed on an office printer. Not indicative of final quality.
 Darker Malleus Digital Edition
Print ready PDFs available through both Itch.io and DriveThruRPG. All backer levels that receive the PDF edition will also receive any digital stretch goals.

 Darker Malleus Print on Demand
A coupon for one copy of Darker Malleus, printed at-cost through DriveThruRPG. Estimated cost $2.44 + shipping.
Note: due to DriveThruRPGs limitations and the size of the text, POD editions of Darker Malleus will be perfect bound instead of saddle stitched.

Community Copies
Community Copies are inspired by  programs at some independent coffee houses, where customers can buy a cup of "suspended coffee" with their normal order, adding to a pool of free cups of coffee for those in need.
Community Copies for games were popularized by Dee Pennyway and have been embraced by many designers who publish digitally on Itch.io. Every designer implements them a little differently; for most of my own games, I add a free download for every game I sell at full price. These free downloads can be claimed by anyone, without question or condition, increasing the availability of independent roleplaying games to marginalized groups and others experiencing financial hardship.
Once Darker Malleus is published I'll add a digital community copy to the game's Itch.io page for every backer who gets a digital edition (all backer levels at $9 or more). Additionally, there are two backer levels - Caller of the Hounds ($35) and Founder of the Hunt ($95) - that add physical community copies of the game! These will be premium print copies of Darker Malleus available for free to interested readers in the continental United States (and to international readers for the cost of shipping).
Physical community copies will be offered first to $1 backers and then be offered through Itch.io's rewards tools on a first come, first served basis.
 All backers who receive the Digital Edition of Darker Malleus will also get any digital stretch goals that fund. If funded, these scenarios will be sold separately after digital rewards have been delivered.
$7100--Digital Hunt: The Lights of Saint Silenus
Five brave hunters went up Bald Mountain to chastise a Forest God. | Two broke their hearts upon the slope and perished under the sway of Evil. | Two were repelled by the Devil, defeated and forlorn. | The last returned to Woudkirk bearing a torch of vengeance for the Abbot who sent them up.
At this funding level, we'll release a PDF of The Lights of Saint Silenus, a scenario developed to playtest Darker Malleus. The Lights of Saint Silenus will be an at least 12 page, print ready PDF with illustration by Felix Miall.
$8400--Digital Hunt: The Smoke Over Morgenbourg
The Hunt has been called to the front. Field Marshall Guy d'Blanc claims his foe, the Trefoil Baron, has employed a Dark Sorcerer to raise the dead and rain fire from the sky. Find this blasphemer and deliver them to the Creator's justice.
At this funding level, we'll release a PDF of The Smoke Over Morganbourg, a scenario developed to playtest Darker Malleus. The Smoke Over Morgenbourg will be an at least 12 page, print ready PDF with illustration by Felix Miall.
"Dire and delectable. Darker Malleus innovates on modern design trends and interrogates assumed wisdom. Read it. Play it." --Aaron Burkett of Doom Rides.
"Darker Malleus oozes theme. Simply use the game's terminology and you can't help but fall into character." --Eli Kurtz of Mythic Gazetteer.
AUTHOR & LAYOUT ARTIST: G. Michael Truran (he/him) is a New Orleans area analog game designer and editor of the ENnie Award Winning SIGMATA. His best known game is GHOST ORBIT. When he acts as a brand, he's Bad Quail Games.
EDITOR: Fiona Maeve Geist (she/her) of the MoonRat Conspiracy. She is notable for editing for Melsonia Arts Council, Soul Muppet Productions, Exalted Funeral and has edited UVG, Silent Titans and wrote for the ENnie Award Winning Mothership.
ILLUSTRATOR: Felix Miall (he/him) is a London-based illustrator and a graduate from Edinburgh College of Art. He's made drawings for the likes of Into the Dungeon, Heart: The City Beneath, and the Folio Society's The Mark of the Horse Lord. His work is primarily traditional, using ink, brush, and pencil to achieve maximum gloom.
Pictured: maximum gloom.

campaign.story:
This ZineQuest 2 project is for a 28+ page 1/2 size (5.5” x 8.5”)  rpg zine that is half game and half DIY guide to zine-making. The game is about making zines, trading zines, worldbuilding, and character development. It’s a love letter to zine culture, friendships across the distance, cultural exchange, snail mail, and parallel universes.
If you are not familiar with the concept of zines, they are DIY self-published booklets with their own underground subculture devoted to making, selling (though usually not for much), and trading them. While there is a niche of zine culture devoted to rpg zines, it may come as a surprise to some ZineQuest participants that the broader community is much, much larger. Zines culture has traditionally been a space where people from marginalized identities and subcultures can get their voice out there without being censored. Zine culture has punks, gamers, queer people, anarchists, people of color, working class folks, feminists, teen girls, neurodivergent people, lowbrow artists, poets and more. Zines are weird, wild, wonderful, and can contain just about anything that can be made out of paper, ink, and staples. And the best part is, whether your zine is mundane, niche, strange, or incomprehensible, there’s an audience for it in the zine community.
Some perzines
This game is about a specific subgenre of zines known as “perzines”. A perzine is a personal zine, where the “zinester” writes (and sometimes draws) about their own life experiences, identities, interests, and thoughts. Perzines are perhaps the type of zine most likely to be traded by mail, as well as the most likely to foster friendships across distances. It’s like being pen pals, but also sort of like letting someone read your diary.
In Our Own Wor(l)ds is about this experience, but with a fantastical twist. Two players will take the role of characters living in two different universes, somehow able to exchange their zines across the barrier between them. The worlds might be very similar to our own, or very, very different. All that is guaranteed is that both characters will make and exchange multiple handmade zines about their lives, their worlds, their thoughts, and their circumstances, and larger narratives will take form over the course of these exchanges. 
In Our Own Wor(l)ds will be an rpg in the tradition of story games, with more of a focus on collaborative storytelling rather than stats and battles. Do expect, however:
Character and Universe sheets
Instructions for creating universes
Instructions for generating characters
Instructions for generating plots and overarching themes
Instructions for creating content for each of the 3 zines each character creates over the course of a standard game
Instructions for making two different styles of zines with varying numbers of pages 
The game and other zine content is still currently being written, but as trading and making perzines is a subject I’m passionate about and something I’ve done successfully for several years (I’ve made over 25 different zines, ranging from 16 to 88 pages long), I am confident I can bring this project to life.
The final rpg zines will be made in the same DIY style as the perzines that players are instructed to make. It will be cut and pasted together, cheaply printed on copy paper with a colored paper cover, with a stapled binding. Any internal art will either be in the public domain or created by me. The PDF copy of the zine will be made of scans of the pages. A text-only version of the zine will be made available for free on Itch.io. 
Using these methods, it’s estimated that the cost to make and ship one zine in the United States will cost about $3-$4. The Kickstarter goal assumes a print run of 100 zines, money for Kickstarter fees and taxes, as well as profit for the work that goes into creating, printing, assembling, and shipping the zines. 
Olivia Montoya (she/her) is a queer, neurodivergent, latinx, zinester game dev. She dips her toes in lots of different creative fields, including traditional DIY personal zine making, queer narrative video game development, tabletop roleplaying game design, zine fest organizing, teaching zine workshops, making pinback buttons and resin jewelry, graphic design and digital art. This Zine Quest 2 project is a stepping stone to later, bigger projects, including Invisible No More, the first ever asexuality themed comic anthology, and Chrysalis Cycle Rebirth!, an unapologetically queer and neurodivergent magical girl genre ttrpg. Olivia is the person responsible for the Litchfield County Zine Fest (Connecticut’s first zine fest) the Queer Game Dev and Zines and Zinesters Discord servers, Ace Jam, Aro Jam, the Neurodiversity in Games Jam, Zine Jam, and Otherships Jam. She is half of the team behind the Ace Zine Archive, and was a 2019 IGDN Metatopia sponsorship winner. Find more of her work at http://metaparadox.itch.io/ or email her at metaparadox11 AT gmail DOT com
