Shipping details
 [First Kings content can be defined as moderate. read more at the end of this page]
In First Kings, you’re going to play your semidivine characters during the so-called Royal Age, in the Rome of the very beginnings: built on a land barren and swampy, grim, misty and often inhospitable, protected by rawboned walls erected to keep out unspeakable horrors and obscure threats of which the world has lost memory of. 
Players take on the role of the Romuli, men and women of the few gentes (families) descended from the first king of Rome: Romulus, son of the God Mars.
      Through their veins, drops of the divine blood still run deep, making them stronger, faster and tougher than common human-beings. 
Also, their bloodline is blessed by the Lupercal Gifts the God Lupercus had transmitted to Romulus and his twin brother. These Gifts, supernatural powers, allows all Romuli to rely on extraordinary capabilities and enables some of them, born under a specific moon - and thanks to the influence of the Vibrantes Lumina (the reverberation of Mars through the moon) - to shapeshift, taking on the different wolfish forms and qualities that once made Romulus and Remus the First Werewolves ever existed.
some of the horrible creatures of the night.
 You are the Cerberus Legion. You defend Rome from the corruption and the darkness that patiently wait outside the city walls. 
Not only the ferocious and dangerous Remos, the thirsting-for-revenge descendants of Romulus’ twin brother, are to be feared. Many other terrible entities and creatures threaten the lands of the Romans: old terrible giants, murderous beasts and despicable monsters, deadly spirits from the underworld, Gods and demons of the forgotten folks.
Dangerous & Deadly is the Old Dark World.   
Here's the story of Romulus and Remus, the story of Rome. 
Born from the abuse thatthe God Mars perpetrated against Rea Silvia, a vestal - a virgin priestess of the Goddess Vesta – the illegitimate sons of the God of War were abandoned still in swaddling clothes in the perilous lands of the Cermalus and left to die. 
However, the infants were miraculously saved and weaned by a she-wolf, who was actually nothing but an ancient Divinity of Nature, known as Lupercus. 
Romulus and Remus grew up as extraordinarily capable men on one side, and as powerful beasts on the other. Their divine ancestry made them more than just men.. made them Gods among human beings. 
Endowed with the supernatural power of Mars, which had made them as powerful as dozen warriors in battle, and of the Lupercal Gifts - which had made them able to shift their human form into that of wolves or werewolves - were the First Kings of a wild world that clamored for being shaped and guided towards its own, glorious destiny. 
The hands of the two Kings rose from the swamps of the Velabrum to seize the sky from which their godly father watched them, and laid the foundations of the largest and most great Empire that the history of man would have ever known.  
..a rising Rome, between swamps, forests and hills.
Unfortunately, ambition, power, and the enormous differences of opinion about their place in the world, their nature, and about and humanity itself, made them enemies and finally led to an infamous, cursed epilogue: the fratricide. 
The progeny of the defeated Remus - the furious and savage Remos - swore bloodthirsty revenge against the First King, his entire race and Rome itself.
"Vindicta Comitatur Remos"("revenge accompanies the sons of Remus") was the cry with which they left the city howling, to take refuge in the darkness of the wildlands outside the city borders. Their lands, the lands their father considered the true Kingdom the Gods would have wanted him and his brother to rule upon. 
That very sentence, shouted at every ambush, every raid, and every massacre they perpetrated against the Romans from that moment on, gave them the name "Remos".
The Romuli, however, swore to defend their father's kingdom from their blood-cousins and any other earthly, divine or infernal threat.  
That's how the Cerberus Legion was born: a silent army, an occult brotherhood. All the descendants of Romulus, every single man and woman endowed with part of his supernatural powers and extraordinary abilities has the sacred duty to fight the darkness, wherever it arises, to protect human kind from those dangers that from deep darkness try to seize them and devour them, and to face the Remos, as well as death, with courage and honor, in the name of Rome, in the name of Quirinus, in the name of the Moon and Mars.
This whole revisited legend, function as a background to the endless, exciting and terrible adventures of an original setting where REAL history and mythology merge with horror and and fantasy, to give the best of themselves, thanks to a unique, modern, fun and successfully play-tested system.
First Kings is a narrative RPG with a modern system that involves numerology and moon phases during the character creation,  and that drives the players to use narration, storytelling, zodiac, and brains (along with a pool of d12 sided dice when necessary!) to approach and solve the scenes that the Game Master creates for them.

CHARACTER CREATION
First of all, set an "off game" date of birth of the player/character (you can invent it, you can choose your own date of birth, your mother's, your favorite sport player's, the date of a particular event, etc.).
Now, adding the units composing the date, one after the other, you can determine your Guide Number, a number that defines - on a specific list - your character's Lupercal Gifts (special abilities & talents).
The Moon under which your character is born (again, you can arbitrarily choose one, or look up the moon phase corresponding to the date of birth you previously chose) determines which kind of Romulus (singular for Romuli) is your player character.
 A character born under a Full Moon is called Lupus Rex. 
 A character born under a Perfect Half Moon is called Lupus. 
 A character born under a Waining or Waxing Moon is called Falx. 
 A character born under a New Moon is called Obscuratum. 
The first three types of Romuli all gain, thanks to the heritage of Mars and Lupercus, a Superior Strength, Animal Senses (human senses improvement) and the Howl (with the howl,  like wolves, Romuli can communicate with each other, in disguise); 
then - through the conveying of the Vibrantes Lumina - a Lupus Rex is capable of changing into a Werewolf Form, a Lupus can instead turn into a Wolf Form, while a Falx can't shapeshift as the others, but possesses the Will of the First King that makes him naturally intimidating against the Remos, naturally inspiring for humans, and more versatile and better skilled than the rest (more Attitude Points* available in the Zodiac*).
The Obscuratum - even considered a cursed one between the Romuli - has got nothing in common with the others. Not a "wolf", not receiving the influence of Mars through the riverberation of the moon, receives instead the influence of Hecate, a dark Goddess which guarantees the Obscuratum powers beyond imagination: this type of Romulus can change into everything he wants, but a wolf or a werewolf. He could change into any other animal, person, vegetal, or element thanks to the spell of Hecate.

SCENES & ATTITUDE TESTS
When the Game Master unfold a scene that involves a challenge for the characters, players have to face it, narrating their act as protagonists of the Scene, and including an Attitude Test.
First Kings is focused on role-playing and storytelling. The first thing you need is to create a dynamic Scene, which manages to convey all the sensations and the purpose you have in mind. 
In this game there are no pre-established turns, initiative rolls and other traditional stuff, everything happens dynamically and coherently, so if you pass an Attitude Test, just let yourself go and let your imagination flow: the Scene is in your hands, and you can pick at it in the most spectacular, glorious, normal, dramatic, epic or moving way.
A Scene is a short narrative arc without a specific duration (it can last a few minutes, like a few hours), and within it, players can perform one or more Attitude Tests: 
Once the player has described his intentions and how to put them into practice, the Game Master declares the value of the Difficulty Class (DC) of the Scene andthe Zodiac Symbols involved and/or needed to solve it.  At this point, the player can evaluate whether to change strategy or optimize the current one, continuing the narration and counting how many Attitude Points (AP: points assigned to certain symbols during the character creation) his character would score, based on the chosen Zodiac Symbols and their related AP.
If the Attitude Points reach the DC, the test is passed, and the narration is totally in the hands of the player until the end of the current scene. 
the other way around, if the Attitude Points are not enough,  then the player has to force the action using the Attitude Roll, which consists in throwing 6 twelve-sided dice (d12), where each number of the dice corresponds to a Zodiac Symbols (as indicated on the character sheets):
If the player rolls and obtains one or more numbers corresponding to the symbols he chose for his act, filling the missing points to reach the DC, then he passes the forced test. 
If, on the other hand, an Attitude Roll fails the narration goes back in the hands of the Game Master who tells the consequences and dynamics of the failure. If the character's state of health gets involved in the scene, in any way (from a fight to a danger related to the environment), the player compares the difference between the Points of Failure and the DC and determine how many steps towards the Avernus (hell, or underworld) the character takes.  (The use of protective equipment and/or the temporary use of Aries Points reduces the gap) 

ZODIAC SYMBOLS
Character Sheet (Back)
From the beginning, the players have 6 Attitude Points available to be assigned to various Zodiac Symbols, thus giving shape to their type of character. 
Through Zodiac Symbols, players can approach the various Scenes and Attitude Tests that the Game Master puts on their way. Based on their AP,  players can act most appropriately and consistently, impersonating their characters.
Depending on how the players decide to take a test, the GM stabilizes the difficulty of the scene and suggest which Zodiac Symbols make sense to be involved.
There are no lists of skills, talents, features, etc. All these series of information are managed in the game by the Zodiac Symbols that represent different general attitudes, and divide into three branches: 
 Corporeum: Taurus, Aries, Pisces, Gemini.
 Res Militaris: Leo, Sagittarius, Cancer, Scorpio.
 Doctrina: Virgo, Libra, Aquarius, Capricorn.
The Corporeum branch represents the physical attributes such as strength, resistance, agility, senses, etc.
The Res Militaris branch represents tactical attitudes such as close or ranged combat, the use of the environment,  stealth, equipment, military knowledge, etc.
The Doctrina branch represents the relationship with the Gods of the archaic Capitoline Triad, with the Dark Gods, the knowledge, the political art, diplomacy, etc.

RITUALS TO THE GODS    
Lupercalia Ritual
Rituals in the game can have the most different effects, but to officiate a ritual, it takes time and concentration. They have to be officiated in advance, and if well executed, they offer gifts that can to be used quickly. 
In First Kings, rituals are fully created by the Players who have characters with at least 1 AP in Virgo or Capricorn. 
Rituals require ingredients, which serve as a narrative cue to create the effects of the rite. ingredients serve to stimulate the imagination and to always put the narration at the center of the game.

DISTANCE FROM THE AVERNUS
The distance from the Avernus can be compared to the state of health of the character. The Steps from the Avernus are 3:
 "Far Away" from it, 
  "A Few Steps Away" from it,  
 "At the gates" of it.
After that, players fall "into the Kingdom of Pluto". (Taking steps towards the dark doors of the Avernus implicates malus, both narratively and mechanically, that gets heavier the more the character gets near the Avernus.)

AUTHORS:
The idea for the setting and the game system of First Kings was conceived by Matteo Sanfilippo, a cook and an unpublished Italian author. He met Epic Party Games last summer (2018) while looking for game designers and/or publishers to take part in his project.  
Matteo Sanfilippo, Max Castellani, Andrea Macchi (@ PLAY Modena Comic Con)
Andrea Macchi and Max Castellani (Epic Party Ltd founders) studied and play-tested the game in its rough first draft, and immediately knew that, yes, they should have worked a lot to bring that draft to become a tested, bug-less, running game, but the premises were nothing but extraordinary! The depth of the setting, its extreme originality, and particularity, not to mention the winning intuition that was already palpable about the game system mechanics, although it would have required lots of late-night design sessions to make it entirely work at its full potential! 
Andrea & Max are the Authors and Designers of a previously successful campaign here on Kickstarter for the Myth Punk RPG Shattered Tower (delivering this summer).
They founded Epic Party Games last year, after that success, and hope First Kings RPG will be their consecration into the Role-Playing Game Industry! #FingerCrossed :P 
MAIN ILLUSTRATOR:
For First Kings we knew we needed the right artwork.
The Dark-Horror vibe of the setting suggested us to work with black and white illustrations and the need to get simple but highly evocative images, pushed us to call up an old friend (the main illustrator for Shattered Tower RPG): Daniele Solimene 
We're really proud to have him on this project too, and we hope we'll reach those goals that will allow us to make him upgrade the current artworks and to add tons and tons of new and gorgeous ones! 

NOTE:
First Kings content is moderate in impact and could be classified as Mature.
The Game contains fiction content of moderate impact. Anybody can have access to this material, however, games of fiction may include classifiable elements such as violence, nudity, slavery (in the historical epoch in which the game takes place, slavery was largely practiced.) and other themes of moderate impact that may be not recommended for people that could find themselves uncomfortable roleplaying with those tones.
 Obviously we do not personally approve, endorse or promote - in any way - any of these themes or practices, in real life.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First of all, w may not be total beginners, in fact we've got a successful Kickstarter Campaign behind us, but still we think that every different game is a whole new adventure! 

By the way, we're EXCITED indeed! 
This time we wanted to get to the crowdfunding campaign with an RPG mostly developed in terms of game design, mechanics, background, setting, and storyline, with almost two years of playtesting on its back, and maybe less developed on the graphics side: we currently have just a few of the illustrations we'd like to put into the finished game.
With the stretch Goals, we called up friends and influencers from the Italian and American RPG scene so to try to bring on a very interesting supplement with the Kings Compendium!

Me (Max), Andrea and Matteo (the creator of the original idea for the game) - we already worked a freakin' lot to the basic game setting, background, and mechanics.
We've already designed the main layout and published a 60 pages starter guide of First Kings called "The Red March" (you'll be able to download it from the first paragraph of this campaign), that includes all that has to be expanded in the final core book.

Now, what we need is funding. The purpose of this new KS Campaign is in fact to raise enough funds to increase the quantity and quality of the material to make FIRST KINGS the best game we could even try to conceive! 

thank you <3

Découvrez la campagne en français
“We are the Company. Hunters, warriors, mages, scholars, nobles, barbarians, we have been brought together for one purpose: to put an end to the reign of the Titan. This gigantic being has caused only ruins and desolation to our world for generations and generations. Progress and wonders are constantly at the mercy of the Titan’s whims. Despite their differences, an agreement exists between nations. The Company. Us and others. We have each followed a mystical teaching, a physical training, a spiritual journey or all at once. The decisive day is approaching. The one where the Company will be reunited. The one where we will stand up to the Titan. We have been preparing for this confrontation, but we must not neglect our instincts in this battle. Let us get to know each other and rediscover each other after all these years. Tonight, let’s share our experiences so that tomorrow those who will survive can tell the stories of those who will succumb.”  
Read the FAQ here. 
Facing the Titan is a GM-less roleplaying game in which you’ll play as the Companions, the ones who will face the Titan that reigns over the world. It’s a story-game set for one-shot games. Each game will feature a different cast of Companions, a different Titan, a different Setting. This game is a discussion, and as the Companions, you will recall your journey before facing the Titan.
Facing the Titan is not a game of tactical combat. It doesn’t feature a riddle to solve in order to win the fight. It’s a game to tell the stories of the Companions and the Titan. And the epic fight that will ensue. The Companions are set to win this fight, but at what cost, with what consequences?
Facing the Titan will be released as a PDF and as a Print-on-Demand softcover book. The book will feature the rules for running the game, advice on how to play the game and six Titans. Each one of the six Titans will be illustrated by Roger Heal and will be included in a micro-setting, ready to play. The book will be around 160 pages, in a 6''x9'' format.
Facing the Titan is a game Descended from Monkeydome, and share some rules and principles with Monkeydome, by Epidiah Ravachol, as well as with other games that followed it: Swords Without Master, Sorceress Bloody Sorceress, With Great Power, Invisible Empire. Other games that inspired me to create this game are Fiasco, Protocol, Death of Legends, Summer Camp.
Want to know more about the game?
 Read the current draft of the game rules 
A preview of Vamakaskan, the Beast of Origins and its associated Setting
A Warm-up Workshop that will help you understand how Motifs work
What did I learn from the playtests ?
An overview of the first physical proof of the softcover book
And many more informations on the official blog 


Kickstarting this project allows me to purchase the art and cover by Roger Heal. It will also cover expanses for the software and graphic resources needed to get the look I want for this game.
Roger Heal is an artist and game developer from New Zealand who has worked on various projects. Check out what he's currently working on with his team at their game company Whistling Wizard (Twitter/Instagram).
Lofituina, by Roger Heal
The game will be available in English and French. French is my main language, but all communication during the campaign will be made in English here, and in French on my blog.
If the funding goes well, I planned additional content for the project as Stretch Goals. The list will be available below. Some of these include external contribution with new Titans, and also articles about the game and how to get something else with it.
The game will be available after this Kickstarter, as a PDF a POD book. This kickstarter gives you the opportunity to get PDF & POD at a lower cost, and also to contribute to the game with the higher rewards.
Bystander Level
You’ll be featured in the Hall of the Companions. Learn more about the Hall of Companions in the Update #1.
Companion Level
You’ll be featured in the Hall of the Companions.
In addition, you’ll get access to the PDF of the game via DrivethruRPG. You’ll also get a coupon for an at-cost print of the game, as a softcover book. You’ll need to pay print production fees and shipping to DrivethruRPG in addition to get the book. See below the DriveThruRPG section for further information and cost estimation.
All unlocked Stretch Goals will be available for the backers at the Companion Level.
Noble/Barbarian Companion Levels
You get everything that is offered in the Companion Level.
In addition, you’ll get to pitch me a character that will be included in the book, in a list of pre-made characters. Your character will be introduced in the Noble/Barbarian Tone, and will have a Name, a Description and a Question to start his/her story. Learn more about the pre-generated Companions in the Update #2.
I will have the final word on this creation, as it will need to match the tone of the game. There will be a delay of one month at the end of the campaign to submit your proposition.
Company Host Level
You get everything that is offered in the Companion Level.
In addition, you’ll get to pitch me a Reunion Site for the Companions to gather, that will be included in the book. Your reunion site will match the Noble or Barbarian Tone, and will have a Name and a Description. Learn more about the Reunion Site in the Update #3.
I will have the final word on this creation, as it will need to match the tone of the game. There will be a delay of one month at the end of the campaign to submit your proposition.
Archivist of the Order Level
You get everything that is offered in the Companion Level.
In addition, you’ll get to pitch me a Company Name that will be included in the book, in a list of Companies to be played. You’ll give me a Company Name and a short Description that stays generic enough to be used in various settings. Learn more about the Company Names in the Update #4.
I will have the final word on this creation, as it will need to match the tone of the game. There will be a delay of one month at the end of the campaign to submit your proposition.
Titan Level
You get everything that is offered in the Companion Level.
In addition, you’ll get to pitch me a Titan that will be included in the book and illustrated by Roger Heal. Together, we will define its Tones and the Threats & Mysteries related.
I will have the final word on this creation, as it will need to match the tone of the game. There will be a delay of one month at the end of the campaign to submit.
Vamakaskan, by Roger Heal
The funding goal for the game is set at €900 (roughly $1000). If we get to this goal, the game will be published and available in both PDF and Print-on-Demand!
But there is more…
If we exceed the planned goal, there is much more to be added to the core book. Here are the first stretch goals to get to:

Who am I?
My name is Nicolas Ronvel, also known as Gulix on various communities. I’m French, living near Nantes. I’m a player of all sorts: roleplaying games, board games, miniature games, videogames. And also a father and husband. I’m 35 years old, and been in RPG since I’ve discovered Hero Quest and the Fighting Fantasy books at the age of 12.
Outside games, I like to watch sports, have been a soccer player for 20 years and a fan of Liverpool since almost ever. I like to read fiction and sports/explorer biographies. Also a big comic book reader. I like being outside, walking in the nature. I enjoy good beers (IPA, Stouts, Crafts…).
I always created stuff for the RPG I played (and for other games too). During the last years, I started releasing translations (in French) of story games and micro-RPGs. I also started to work on my own stuff, like Fiasco playsets, Monster of the Week mysteries, and one-page RPG (Gangs of Mutants of New York, Crime Scene Investigators, You are all Duncan!). I also joined RPG-Creation contests (Game Chef, French ThreeForged Challenge, 200-Word RPG…).
Facing the Titan is my first attempt to get a full RPG in a neat book and PDF. It’s auto-edited, tested in various French conventions, and revised, and revised.

campaign.story:
The current book as a pdf is available through drivethrurpg 
All actions in The ADVANCED are done through the use of one, or more, d10s. Roleplay is at the forefront of this system and thus actions that are not under duress, such as combat, and have a small penalty for failure should be treated in a roleplay manner, rather than relying on a die roll.
Non-combat actions like competencies within the pursuit system, such as lockpicking, roll a single d10 and apply the user’s knowledge (pursuit bonus) and compare it to the level of difficulty. The result is either a success, success with a bonus (allowing an additional effect), success with a minor penalty (allowing success but at a minor penalty, such as breaking the lock in the process), success with a major penalty (a more significant penalty, such as breaking your tools or making a large amount of noise) and finally failure, which like it’s name means the competency check fails. 
Combat actions fall into two categories, main combat rolls and secondary combat rolls. Main combat rolls are the base actions, such as attacking and defending, and use the hit degree table. To make an attack, or to defend from one, a single d10 is rolled and the specific statistic is then added to the roll, such as offence for an attack. This result is then reduced by the enemies opposing statistic, such as defence for the same action. Finally, this result is compared against a short table which specifies any bonus damage or loss of damage from that roll and can on rare occasions even end in a missed attack, although as specified earlier, this is not often the case. All attacks have their damage further reduced by any mitigation the target has.
Critical miss/hit. A critical hit is only applied to main combat rolls and adds a small bonus based on the roll result of a second d10 result. To get a critical hit the roll result after all bonuses and penalties must be a 15 or higher. A critical miss not only misses the target as normal, but also causes a minor penalty based on a d10 result. Getting a critical miss is caused when the full roll result is lower than a 1.
Secondary combat rolls are the simplest of rolls. They function in the same way as a main combat roll, adding the statistic to a single die roll followed by reducing the amount by the enemy’s statistic. The difference here is that the result must be a 5 or higher or simply fail entirely. This form has no critical successes or failures.
Disclaimer: All artwork shown here is either owned by Beirdo Games LLP or licensed for use with this kickstarter and owned by Mike Corriero who will be doing the artwork for the game book. See his website. 
Why Kickstarter?
The funding we are asking is the minimum required for the editing of the books through a professional editor and the artwork from Mike Corriero, a great artist. Kickstarter isn't just a great way for us to get funding, it's an amazing way of connecting with the people interested in our project. Our aim is to work together with you, the players, to make The ADVANCED: Pandemonium everything it can be. 
What you get
PDF: The pdf is a digital version of the different books which are available in their early versions while the game is on kickstarter as well as the finalized version after Kickstarter. The pdf will be constantly updated and available for download for the owners, always containing all changes and new artwork.
Book: The book contains everything in the pdf version, albeit changes in the form of errata's will only be in books purchased after the changes are made.
Dice: We offer as a kickstarter exclusive, 2 ten sided dice made especially for this system. One die with the numbers 0-9 and one with the numbers 00-90 to be used for percentages.
Guideline Cards: Like the dice, we offer a kickstarter exclusive set of poker sized cards that contain the information of all ailments symptoms, conditions, stances and special attacks for easier referencing.
Poster: A nice poster of Pandemonium's cover art.
Game master's screen:  Like the guideline cards, this four piece cardboard screen has the most important rules and options written on it to make the life of the game master easier.
Concept Art Book: A beautiful art book containing the art in progress, showing how the final art got to where it was.
Astral Edition: A Collector's edition book with additional artwork and a special cover.
Dice Box: A special wooden dice box with 3 slots, 2 for the 2 dice and 1 large slot for the pack of guideline cards.
Bestiary: A book containing all of the creatures and beautiful artwork depicting the magnificent creatures.
Extra Information
The Books: The full PDFs will be available shortly after the Kickstarter campaign is successfully completed, expected delivery time is 2 months. This is so that our editor can read through and refine the book, ensuring clarity, whilst our designer can prepare the book for artwork. After the initial release, we will regularly update the game PDFs as artwork is completed so that you don't have to wait to play. The finalised hardcover books are planned to be shipped in the summer of 2020, when all artwork should be completed. All the reward tiers that include a hardcover book will also have access to the game book PDFs as they are updated.
Shipping: On top of your backer tier cost, we will be charging for shipping to ensure the books can be delivered reliably and safely. Shipping costs below are an estimate and we will be making use of DriveThruRPG 
US: €6 - 10
Canada: €15 - 20

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The ADVANCED Pandemonium is finished as far as rules go. The reason we're here is to fund the artwork and the creation of the game book.

The main risks involved are those regarding delivery, which is why we plan to partner up with distribution companies that can do this for us, as opposed to trying to manage it ourselves. However, despite our efforts there is always a risk of shipping delays or lost shipments and we have set aside a small portion of our funding budget to ensure that if something does happen, we can immediately resend lost packages without a problem. in addition, we will be utilising tracking on all our deliveries to ensure backers know exactly where their package is.

The other risk we have is the potential for a delayed book release due to how long artwork can take to complete. It's impossible to predict this, we can only estimate, so please bear with us if there are delays. We can promise that we will be doing everything we can to minimize delays if they occur and will make it known as far in advance as possible.

campaign.story:
GeneFunk 2090 is a biopunk/cyberpunk RPG and setting made using the D&D 5E Open Gaming License. Players take on the role of elite mercenaries that specialize in investigation and violence. No magic or fantasy, but tons of cybernetics, genetic enhancements, nanobots, drones, hacking, androids, high tech guns and armor, and other amazing tech! 
Cadre of Professionals.  You and your allies are a cadre, a lean start-up corporation that specializes in investigation, intelligence, protection, and violence. To keep their hands clean, the syndicates often outsource this kind of work to smaller outfits, like yours. Your cadre's skillset is in high demand in this intrigue filled world, being sought after by megacorporations, nation-states, organized crime, or wealthy individuals. As an autonomous entity, your cadre of elite agents takes contracts as you see fit, navigating the shadows of corporate espionage and savagery with competence and panache. Discreet. Elite. Disposable.        
Two cadre mercs negociate with a client regarding "acquired" transgenic embryos
Plasticity of Genes, Form, and Human Nature. Large sections of the human population have had their genes chosen before birth to breed success, while others have had foreign DNA included to produce wholly different physical traits that were once thought inhuman. On top of all the innate genetic tweaking, individuals modify themselves through cyberware surgeries and biohacks, to the point where some are considered entirely "posthuman". 
A large cadre of bioengineered badasses!
Supercomputer in your Bloodstream. The human condition as a whole has become something somewhat different. Somewhere along the way almost every single human has been modified to have a powerful supercomputer coded directly into their DNA and physiology, one that has merged with their consciousness. In this world the internet has become as real as the physical world and hackers have become manipulators of the very stuff of the human psyche, probing and rearranging memory and mind the way a potter molds clay.
Nu-Pets™, a subsidary of Apollo Laboratories, produces many lines of transgenic critters!
Violent, Shallow, and Unequal. Multinational corporations have gobbled each other up, producing ever larger entities until only nine remain, each of which is a superpower bigger than most of the world’s countries. Corporate executives have the power to shatter entire governments in the name of their company’s share value and their own ambition. Gangs and organized crime saturate every urban environment. This world, bloated from overpopulation and consumer greed, has become one of the most violent eras in human history. The rich segregate themselves from the poor, and the tension caused by this wealth gap is causing the world to burst at the seams.
Virtual Immortality.  Recent innovations have allowed the rich to undergo a process that maps their entire nervous system, connectome, endocrine complement, DNA and gene expression, and every other feature relevant to the human mind. This digitization of consciousness allows the world's wealthy and powerful to essentially live forever, switching from one bioengineered shell to another as they see fit.  
A cadre merc from the Asura genome persuading a suit to give up the goods!
 GeneFunk 2090 Core Rulebook 
The full hardcover of the GeneFunk 2090 Core Rulebook will be printed on thick #80 paper in premium color, a full offset print run! Everything you need to run and play GeneFunk 2090 at a table. It will be around 224-260 pages, depending on how the layout develops! 
The GeneFunk 2090 Core Rulebook PDF will be fully bookmarked, for easy navigation, and will work well with tablet users.
Both will be filled with lucious cyberpunk art, including full page spreads, with over 100 beautiful illustrations from William Liberto, Dean Spencer, Nate Artuz, Dimas Raviandra, Enmanuel Martinez Lema, and others! These artists really bring the biopunk world of GeneFunk to life!
GeneFunk 2090 comes as color PDF, or premium color hardcover book!
To get a sense of what will be in the final book, you can check out our GeneFunk 2090 Setting Book, for FREE here, or here! 
The Busan Bamboozle - A Starter Investigation
This 20 page starter contract is set in the bustling port city of Busan, Korea. Busan is a hotbed of criminal activity, with four different major crime syndicates (North and South Jopok, Russian Bratva, and Yakuza) perpetually vying to expand their borders in a zero-sum game with their competition. Can your cadre navigate their way through the fierce criminal ecosystem and transgenic gangs to complete their contract, and raise their Mosaic score?
It will also contain beautiful, thematic, biopunk art throughout! 
It is designed for level 3 characters, that takes from 1-3 sessions to complete, and ends with the characters being level 4.  
GeneFunk 2090 Fillable Character Sheet
It's always nice to have a character sheet to match the setting, and who doesn't love the option of having it as a fillable form? It is two pages, with the back side containing area for known hacks.
The GeneFunk 2090 Core Rulebook will include mechanics for:
60+ CYBERNETIC UPGRADES!
13 DIFFERENT BIOENGINEERED GENOMES!
45 DIFFERENT GENETIC ENHANCEMENTS!
8 NEW CLASSES WITH 21 ARCHETYPES!
31 NEW FEATS!
13 NEW BACKGROUNDS!
MIND HACKING, BIOHACKING, ENGINEERING HACKING!
ROBOTS, DRONES, AND ANDROIDS!
BIOENGINEERED BEASTS, PLANTS, AND FUNGI!
DRUGS!
LOTS OF GUNS AND ARMOR!
RANDOM ENCOUNTERS!
CHASE RULES!
The Jötunn Ultima cybernetic arm, doing what it's made for!
A biker injecting some Nootro to gain an edge (left), and a Ronin Soldier happy to be wearing an Atomos™ Battlesuit (right)!
Just a tiny sample of the drones available!
 7,500 - PREGEN CHARACTERS. ***UNLOCKED***  There will be pregenerated characters made for every class at levels 1, 3, and 7, compiled in a PDF to aid in getting right into the game!
 10,000 - GM SCREEN (PDF). ***UNLOCKED***  A nice handy dandy GM screen, summarizing all of the regularly used rules on an 8-panel PDF with art, in both portrait and landscape orientation.

campaign.story:
See bottom for video description and transcript.
Come Down to Sundown
We're Grasswatch Games, a partnership of two queer disabled folk.
We're making our debut with Sundown, a low tech science-fantasy set in a transhumanist frontier. Think cyberpunk goes wild west. It's an episodic game that focuses on otherism, class, and colonialism.
Sundown is a dyslexia-friendly, campaign-length rules-light tabletop roleplaying game for 2-6 players, one of whom is the lorekeeper, with a suggested session length of 3-4 hours.
Sundown tells political stories of a small and intimate scope. You play multiple campaigns and characters in the same world, your next one inheriting the world from your last. Your actions, though small, will ripple across history.
You play a drifter: a queer, punk outcast taking work wherever you can from folk that hate you.
Lotus and Sati fighting off a swarm of Crowdogs by Mayara Sampaio
Fiends, the monsters of this world, linger at the edges of civilization. There’s always someone who wants some fiend dead.
Autocrats and Lords point their fingers at each other while Syndicates and Revolutions rot their thrones beneath them. Drifters who don’t slay fiends oft find themselves slaying folk instead.
But maybe you prefer to keep your hands clean. You’re a spy, stealing secrets from one corporatist for another, or you’re a thief, liberating the hoarded wealth of lords and bankers.
Maybe you’re lucky. One of the few of ‘legitimate’ employ. You work for the Merchant Protections Guild, a diplomat and ambassador to the townships of Sundown, struggling to keep the highroad from crumbling… and Sundown’s delicate peace with it.
A Map of Sundown by Tad Davis
Sundown brings body mods into the frontier with some things called changes. 
Sundown is littered with things that change your body - slip into some tailtar and you'll grow a tail. Snack on some indigoji, and you'll turn blue. The science of changing takes these things from the wild and combines them in new ways to create totally different changes. The experiments are mostly consensual.
Peek's Peak, a massive spire of rock jutting out from the sea, with buildings along the spire and boats at a small dock - by Orion
To get your changes, though, you'll need the coin, the reagents, a scientist that likes you, and a month of spare time. Be cautious. Most folk in Sundown don't take kindly to changelings. The march of science pushes us further and further from tradition, and the demagogues of yesteryear struggle to keep power.
Take the long sail to Sundown and fight for the right to mold your body as you choose.

How Does the Game Work?
Sundown uses a simple roll to resolve every situation, from slaying a fiend to giving a speech. You roll a single 6-sided die and try to overcome a difficulty between 1 and 9.
To make your drifter, you answer six questions about their life. You’ll refine each answer into a short, snappy statement about their personality or skills. These are called Traits.
A frogbeast, sitting with its wings splayed in the floodgrass, a cat perched on its head. - By Orion
When you roll against a challenge, the lorekeeper sets a difficulty, and you count the traits that could give you an edge. Each adds 1 to your roll. Sometimes you’ll be in an advantageous position or have the perfect tools for the job. This can give you an edge, too. If you meet or exceed the difficulty, you succeed!
But if you fail, you take Stress. Stress is kind of like Sundown’s hit points. There are three kinds: Anxiety, Exhaustion, and Injury. Stress is hard to get rid of, too. Healing items have severe overdose penalties, and you can only heal naturally with your precious downtime.
Stretch Goals
$7,500 - Hardcover Upgrade
If we reach $7,500, we can print enough books to upgrade the hardcovers from casebound to a foil stamped faux leather binding. It'll be much nicer to touch, hold, and use, and you'll get to show off your fancy book to all your friends.
$10,000 - Sundown Audio Book
If we reach $10,000, we can produce a Sundown audio book with twitch streamer and voice actor Astreigha's melodious voice. Everyone who gets a PDF will get this audio book, too!
$15,000 - Art & Layout Upgrade
Currently, we do our layout in house. We're pretty good, but we're new to this, and we can do better. With $15,000, we can hire a layout artist and graphic designer and commission even more art to bring Sundown that next level up to Gorgeous.
$20,000 - My Name is Vengeance
When an Aehalan weapons master dies, his former apprentice is sent out into the dangerous world of Sundown, deeper than they've ever been, to discover the truth of their Master's death. Was it the brutality of man, the jaws of a beast, or something much worse. 
My Name is Vengeance - Sel Bell
'My Name is Vengeance' will be a novella set in Sundown, written by Sel, a Tsalagi author and language revival activist. It will be produced as a PDF, and everyone who gets a Sundown PDF will receive a copy.
$25,000 - Offset Print Run
Currently, we're looking at digital printing simply because we don't know how many folks out there want to join us in Sundown. For low quantities, digital printing is ideal, but if we hit $25,000, we'll have enough orders to get offset printing for our books. This will be a significant bump up in print quality!
$30,000 - Extra Module
Sundown’s ‘Heat Cheats’ give you evocative but short notes to seed your creativity as you create your own adventures. With $30,000 though, we can bring on a fellow game designer to craft a full module complete with multiple heats, new wonders, and new changes for you to explore and experiment with. 
What Else?
If we fund even higher, keep an eye on our stretch goals. See what we dream up, or tell us what you’d like to see. 

What We Have For Our Backers
BackerKit & Shipping
We will be using BackerKit as our pledge manager for this campaign. If you'd like to increase your pledge or add things to your pledge, like extra dice, you'll be able to do that through BackerKit. If we fund, you'll even be able to pre-order well after May 10th, up until we send Sundown off to the printers!
You won't be prompted to pay shipping or tax up front when you back. We collect your information, like the address we'll ship to, after the end of our campaign in a survey. We will use our survey to collect the cost of shipping and taxes on all your backer rewards.
Below with each physical tier are estimates for shipping to the United States, United Kingdom, European Union, and the rest of the world. We can't promise this is exactly what you'll pay, but this is our best guess, erring on the high side so you hopefully won't pay more than you expected.
Play It Forward!
Once we get our BackerKit rolling - it could take a day or two - there will be an add-on option in our pledge manager to pay for an additional PDF. Give it to your friend, or leave it with us and we'll make sure it goes to a fan in need.

Testimonials
We're proud of Sundown, and it makes us giddy when our industry peers say nice things about it. Here's a few examples of that!

“Sundown asks an awesome question: What if Cyberpunk but Cowboy-Western But Bloodbourne But Gender-fluid But Wild But Nuanced? 
This is a game that will excite and inspire your table. The world is bizarre, creepy, and very VERY cool. 
Sundown feels like a fully realized world, but it's also waiting for you to jump in and make it your own. It's beautifully crafted and easy to pick up and play. The game has fantastic bones to it, and the character creation process is one of the most fun things I've experienced!”
-Jamila R. Nedjadi of Sword Queen Games

"The world of Sundown satiates the hungriest of players looking for a wild west/sci-fi collaborative storytelling space. It inspects cyberpunk through a lens that focuses on the characters. It's so easy to get lost in this beautiful immersive world!" 
-Banana Chan
Sketches of four different poses of a Frogbeast in flight
"Sundown is a deceptively simple game, written with brevity and clarity. It centers an experience of small, personal struggles as outsiders in a world that changes you, and fast. It takes the tone and scope seriously and puts safety tools in your hands up front to help with that. The setting is fractured and beautiful and leaves so much room for stories and exploration, and it lends itself to the picaresque style of play I so enjoy."
-Michael T Lombardi
"Sundown is an RPG That places culture, class and history at the forefront of its setting, exploring these ideas in a vibrant and exciting new world full of unique twists on old concepts and evocative mysteries. Combine this with a simple, robust system and some snappy clever writing and you have one of the most exciting little games out there."
-Liam Ginty of Sandy Pug Games
Sandy Pug Award presented to Grasswatch Games For outstanding achievement in the fields of queerness and also making cool games back Sundown on KS now.
"Sundown has a compelling, unique setting with easy to learn rules that express the setting and your characters. I love the descriptive Traits & Aspects system and how it defines characters. The chapter on consent at the table is a vital element for most modern RPGs."
-Adrian Thoen, creator of Impulse Drive

"Sundown’s an honest to goodness diverse science-fiction weird-west setting. The system is simple enough to run with little prep, but is set up for long term play. The wealth, reputation, and resource mechanics are not too crunchy but also expansive enough to make character advancement rewarding and meaningful. It’s the perfect set up to play a number of games in different, fascinating locales, to develop a meaningful legacy of play. I’m so glad I picked up the beta, I’m looking forward to the full version."
-Chris Challice, author of Seith and Sword, Space Pirate Alice Black: Blood Tribute, and Vanagard

"Sundown is a new exploration on identity and our place in the world that takes elements of cyberpunk and puts them in a new environment. It approaches changing your body frankly, which appeals to me as a trans nonbinary person, and makes something fantastical instead something real, something imperfect in the fiction but still impressive. All of this while including some fascinating approaches to healing, and touching on how politics affect people. I certainly haven't seen anything like it!"
-Brie Beau Sheldon
Reviews

Watch Logan Chops Reviews talk about Sundown!

Check out our 28 page excerpt of Sundown to get a grittier look at the mechanics and a better feel for the setting. And to see what this sunring hype is all about, check out Frogbeast, a short story set in Sundown.
Whether you can pledge or not, you can be an active part of our community by joining us on discord or following us on twitter @grasswatchgames.
Where Does the Money Go?
Percent-Based Expenses
 35% - Fulfilling rewards 
 10% - Kickstarter's cut & processing fees 
 10% - Unexpected or additional expenses 
 6% - Sensitivity editor bonuses 
 3% - BackerKit cut 
Fixed Expenses
 $475 - Sundown's map 
 $450 - Sundown's cover 
 $800 - Illustration of Sundown's 11 fiends 
 $240 - A yearly InDesign subscription 
 $500 - Graphic design 
 $500 - Remaining miscellaneous art 
 $300 - Sundown's Kickstarter video

 $200 - Facebook marketing campaigns

Stretch Goal Expenses

 $1,500 - Sel's author fee 
 $500 - Art for 'My Name is Vengeance' 
 $1,000 - Author fee 
 $500 - Editing fees 
 $500 - Art for the module 
Where Does the Money Go? A pie chart of our financial data based on the $5,000 kickstarter goal, in percentages.
Why $5,000?
The total of our fixed expenses is $4,165. We have paid $3,070 out of pocket, leaving us $1,095 more to cover. Our percent-based expenses total 64%, turning $5,000 into $1,800. This will cover all our future expenses and leave us with a little to start paying down our past expenses.
Anything left over after covering all of our expenses will pay us for the work we put into Sundown's two year development cycle, as well as funding development for future games.
Our Team
A picture of L A Wilga
Hi, I'm L A Wilga! I've been writing games as a hobby for 13 years, and I've decided to throw my game design hat into the ring with Sundown. Sundown is my first full book, and I'm already designing more.
Follow me on twitter @lawilga! 
A picture of James
Hi, I'm James, or more often Nova! I helped found Grasswatch Games by accident when just trying to help L A with some monsters for their book. I somehow wound up as the layout artist, editor, and general paperwork nerd for Grasswatch Games, and it was the best decision I've ever made.
Follow me on twitter @NovarionNoel!

ᏏᏲ ᏂᎦᏕᏭ! ᏎᎵ ᏓᏆᏙᎠ. ᎠᏴ ᏥᏣᎳᎩ ᎪᏪᎵᏍᎩ ᏣᎳᎩ ᎦᏬᏂᎯᏍᏗ ᎠᏍᏗᎵᏍᎩᏃ . ᎤᏬᏚᎯ ᏔᏂᏏ ᏥᏁᎳ, ᏛᎩᏨᏍᏔᏅᎢ, ᏦᎢᏁ ᏪᏌ ᏕᏥᎾᏝ - ᏲᎾ ᏂᎦᏪᏍᎩ (ᎤᏓᏂᏘ) ᏚᏳᏂᏍᏘ ᏚᎤᏂᏙᎠᏃ. ᏍᏊ ᎠᏯ ᎠᏦᎢᏁ  ᎠᎴ They/Them ᏲᏁᎦ ᎦᏥᏴᏗᏍᎪᎢ. ᏩᏙ ᎠᎴ ᏙᎯᏭ ᎨᏎᏍᏗ ❤
Hi ya'll! I'm Sel (Seli). I'm Tsalagi, a writer and a Tsalagi language advocate. I live in beautiful Tennessee, I'm married and have three cats named Bear, Cryer, and (sweet) Pea. I'm also Non-Binary and use They/Them pronouns. Thanks and be well ❤
(Please do not follow Sel on social media.)
A picture of Chelsea
Hi, I'm Chelsea, a Jahajee writer. By day I design and write about health technology, but my real hobby is helping people with all aspects of writing, research, and design. I am humbled to have been a part of bringing Sundown into words, and hope you enjoy!
(Please do not follow Chelsea on social media.)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are a new company, and this is our first product. This is our first time contracting a fulfiller, using a printing service, producing exclusive items like dice, and using BackerKit. These are all things we’re figuring out for the first time.

There’s always the risk that we will have to change printers, suppliers, fulfillers, or pledge managers.

This is a two person outfit. If something happens to one of us, such as illness, injury, or even death, it will cause delays.

Our suppliers and fulfillers have all done this before. They know what they are doing even if we don’t, and our project is almost complete. Sundown just needs art before it’s ready to print.

We have a wide safety net of peers who have run tabletop rpg kickstarter campaigns before, and we have a small but devoted fanbase eager to see us succeed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey y'all,
As far as we know, everyone should have their books.
Sooo, if you don't have your book, let us know on this post. It's possible that the plague could still be delaying some deliveries.

Hey all, just wanted to remind our international backers to fill out this survey by February 14th!

More people have said yes than we expected, which is great, but please don’t feel shy to answer no if you haven’t received your copy. All answers help us put together a better picture so we can get Sundown to everyone who still needs it.
PS. No news on the postal claim.

This link is a survey for our international backers asking whether you've received your copy of Sundown. The survey will close on February 7th, in two weeks, and we will send new copies to anyone that answered no. Every backer that responds yes significantly lessens the financial load on us, so we appreciate your responses.  
Thanks!
PS. We have filed our postal claim, it'll be a bit for we hear anything else with that, but we're hoping that USPS will honor the claim.

Hey folks!
We know that we said last time would be the last you hear of us, but we’ve had a little… incident.
The first leg in the journey of our international orders was from the United States to the United Kingdom. Our fulfiller sent twenty books, and only five arrived. At some point in shipping, the books were repackaged by the postal service, and we have no idea where the rest of these books are.

Hey Backers!
All going well, this will be our last update.
Since our last update:
The Books Finished Printing
We Received and Signed the Hardcovers

Hey folks,
We got our print proofs back and they look amazing! We've approved the print run - that's starting now. We'll be signing the hardcovers next month. On top of that, the dice and boxes are weeks away from being finished.
Everything is full steam ahead! Make sure to put in any address changes now. We'll be locking addresses fairly soon, so if you need to update please do so as soon as possible.
In a favorable twist, our backer keys were approved at 9am this morning. Enjoy, and we'll see you all when Sundown prints.

Hey folks,
You may have seen our comment on our last update: the Itch keys for our backers did not send as a result of a security measure on Itch's part. Well, as of now, Sundown is one hour from going public, and we've heard nothing back from Itch in the way of progress.
It was a tough choice, but rather than delay the release to allow our backers the first look at Sundown, we've decided to proceed as planned and promised.

Hey y'all, we've got our Sundown PDF keys out a touch early! The full release for sale will still be October 1st, but our backers get it a few days earlier.
We regret to go back on our word, but we won't be producing an epub version at this time. It breaks in exciting, new ways with every export, and in the interest of getting the rest of Sundown finished, we've put this on an indefinite hold.
If anyone is having trouble accessing their copy of Sundown, please reply to this update, send us a message, email, DM on twitter! We'll respond to any of our contact methods so don't be shy to say you're struggling to claim a key!

campaign.story:
Mockup of the hardback book
An ancient, crystal-encrusted planet is rocked by war. As Kingdom fights Empire and the borderlands are caught in the middle, you are sent to rebuild the liberated city of Montara and make the surrounding lands safe for your Houses. As the years pass and this city makes its mark on you, where will your loyalties lie? With your Kingdom, with your House, with this new city, or only with yourself?  
Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands is a tabletop roleplaying game about politics, adventure and discovery in a geomantic fantasy world based on Tabula Game's Mysthea Universe.  It fuses the grand strategy of board games like Twilight Imperium, Scythe and Mysthea itself with the tense character-driven adventures of pen-and-paper roleplaying games. With your help, we'll fund a beautiful print run of the game to end up in your hands and in shops worldwide.  
Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands builds on our successes with Legacy: Life Among the Ruins. Adapting elements from the Apocalypse World engine, it's a game system that gets you into the heart of the action, while at the same time allowing your stories to zoom out and take in the broad sweep of geography and history. It's based on the universe developed by Tabula Games for their board games Mysthea, Volfyirion and the upcoming Icaion, and we're delighted to bring it to life at your table. Here's what makes it special: 
Legends From the Borderlands takes place on a backdrop of war. A few hundred years ago, the floating continent of Mysthea was home to dozens of independent city-states, with the world-shattering cataclysm an ancient memory. Now, only two major powers remain: the Kingdom of Ahatils and the Kitrean Empire. The Kingdom is aggressively expansionist, lead by a conqueror-king whose boredom with governance lead to him delegating rule of his conquered lands to the ancient Guilds of Ilvash. The Empire is more insidious, letting its territories rule themselves freely only as long as they cast aside their old customs and religions and follow the Empire's doctrine. And between these two monoliths lie the borderlands - a narrow strip of territory whose cities are treated as pawns in the game of empires.
Now a great war has been sparked into flame, and its battles shake the continent. As the war front moves ever closer to Kitrean heartlands, the Ilvashan Guilds send a convoy to control, reinforce and rebuild the newly-liberated city of Montara. But as the Guilds meet with local Orders and Cabals, and contend with the perils of the too-close war front, they may find their loyalty to Ilvash and Ahatils tested. Will they stay true to their mission and make this city a vassal of their ancestor guilds, try to secure its independence, or use its resources to gain dominion over the Guilds in the Kingdom's capital?
Your group will have strong world-building tools, letting you make this story your own. Most important is Montara: it's up to you what form this war-scarred metropolis takes, though we will present examples in the book. The wider borderlands can shift and change as you play according to your decisions, and the final state of your city will be unique. Don't worry, though: the game's procedures will give you inspiration and easy choices to make, while making sure that your world remains coherent and full of mystery.
Each player controls a House present in Montara. They may be a Guild sent to this city from the ancient Kingdom of Ilvash, or an Order local to the borderlands. Together these factions form a venture, dedicated to putting the city back together for their own reasons. Your House is your constant as you tell a decade-spanning saga of discovery, conflict and rebuilding. Each will have a certain vocation that defines them, whether that's the Guild of Varorin's focus on commerce and production or the Order of Kyradar's quest to hunt Mysthea's strangest monsters. When they act in concert, you trigger special abilities that work through the consequences of conducting diplomacy, sabotaging your enemies, claiming vital resources or many other approaches. 
You'll jump forward through history, visiting the different flashpoints your venture experiences. At each flashpoint, you'll focus on a particular hero from your House. The hero archetype you pick gives you a particular skillset and role within the House, but it also gives you a new perspective: a gregarious Matchmaker will present a very different side to a House of soldiers than a battle-scarred Veteran. 
Once you're done telling the story of a particular flashpoint, you jump your story forward in time. You go as far ahead as the group likes: a few months, a year, maybe even a decade. Over the time skip your House can experience great fortunes or suffer trials, the world can change dramatically, and new threats and opportunities can emerge from the borderlands. Once you've set up your new flashpoint you can make new heroes, still able to call on the powers of those who have gone before. Or perhaps you'll show how an old hero has been changed by the passage of time?
With Legends From the Borderlands, we’re inviting players to dive deep into a world still reeling from a meteoric impact that shrouded the world in endless storms and studded the landscape with shards of crystal. Rising above the endless storms are floating islands and continents, buoyed by shifting tides of gravity: this is the land of Mysthea.
Crystals are vitally important to this world. The strange shards of crystal dotting the landscape – named Qoam – react strangely to gravity, energy and most importantly thought. Each resident of Mysthea has the ability to exert telekinetic control over Qoam, though individuals vary in the strength they can exert and the kinds of crystal the best resonate with. The subtle arts of Qoam manipulation are core to your society – Qoam crystals line warrior’s armour, and resonators communicate across great distances. Qoam prostheses enable amputees to walk with the power of their will, and labourers build structures by exerting their collective will on blocks of crystal-studded stone. The most delicate artisans can even spark life in the crystal, creating servants made of stone and gleaming Qoam facets.
Finally, there’s the inhabitants of this world. None of them have escaped unchanged by the great crystal’s impact. The humanoid folk that make up the bulk of its population have changed the least, growing grey-skinned and pale under the gloom of the endless mists. The awoken automata are rare, often labouring under cryptic ethical codes put in place by long-dead civilisations. And then there’s the monsters, who cannot control Qoam and instead struggle to avoid frenzies when bombarded with its unrefined energy. These ‘monsters’ greatly value cities, where the controlled Qoam allows them coexist peacefully with others.
Watch us play the game on Hijos Del Rol's twitch stream!
Interviews about the game:
Legends From the Borderlands has 9 Heroes and 8 Houses for you to try. Look below for details!
Click through for full-size Heroes
Click through for full-size Houses.
If you'd like a closer look, check out our quickstart.  This document gives you a jumping-on point for Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands, letting you try out the core game rules and pre-generated player options before breaking open the full suite of options available in the main book. 
Click through to download the quickstart
If you want to go deeper, take a look at the full handout and basic rules sheets!  
 All backers will get access to the game as a digital PDF, with hyperlinked bookmarks and indexing.
An example page spread from the book.
Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands is planned as a full-colour hardback book,  8.5" x 11"/21.6 cm x 28 cm/US Letter in size. We're estimating it'll extend to 240 pages, and it'll be packed with Travis Anderson's gorgeous art.
Mockup of the hardback book.
 We're also making a kickstarter-exclusive deluxe edition. This will have a dark soft-touch matte cover, embossed in silver with the House's logos on the cover and the book's name on the spine. It'll come in a full-colour, durable slipcase.
A mockup of the deluxe edition of the book.
 If you're a retailer interested in stocking the book, back at the £1 level - when our BackerKit goes live we'll open special retailer tiers up to you.
 With this game delivering a year from now, it's difficult to put a definite estimate on how much shipping is going to cost. To help mitigate that uncertainty, we're not charging shipping fees now. Instead, we'll charge them using BackerKit when we're ready to ship and know exactly how much it'll cost.
YOU DON'T NEED TO ADD ANYTHING TO YOUR PLEDGE NOW.
For estimates of what it's likely to cost to ship after the campaign, see this diagram:
These costs are estimated from the predicted size of the book. If you add more items to your order (see Add Ons), your shipping costs are likely to be higher.
We'll keep you updated as shipping cost estimates change, based on the scale of the eventual fulfilment effort.
Douglas Santana Mota is the lead developer for this campaign. As one of the lead designers for Legacy: Life Among the Ruins 2nd Edition he's adept at writing rules that blend grand scope and personal drama. When he's not designing RPGs, he works as a safety officer in an offshore oil rig. If you can't find him online, don't worry! He's probably hiking somewhere with his adventurous wife and their orcish dog.
Jay Iles is the head of UFO Press, and the other lead designer on Legacy. She's also designed such games as Rhapsody of Blood, Harder They Fall and Transmission Burst. For this campaign, she's handing additional design, book layout and production assistance.
James Mendez Hodes (7th Sea, Scion, Thousand Arrows) is Mysthea’s cultural consultant. He’ll watch over the development of the Borderlands’ cultures and power dynamics to ensure they reflect the best lessons we can learn from parallel situations in the real world.
Rebecca Curran is our editor; she's a veteran of multiple UFO Press books, and we have a great working relationship.
Travis Anderson is continuing to provide the incredible aesthetics of the world of Mysthea. You can check out his portfolio here.
Leonardo Bertinelli and Alessandro Veracchi of Tabula Games are the creators of the Mysthea Universe and its lore. 
The Mysthea Universe comes from Tabula Games;  check out their games Mysthea, Volfyirion, and Icaion to delve deeper in this world they created. We are very happy that they'll be working with us on this project. It couldn't exist without them!
Finally, we're getting production and distribution assistance from Modiphius Entertainment. They have a lot of experience shipping crowdfunding projects all across the world, and I'm confident their help will make this project a success.   
As we go over our Kickstarter goal, we'll be able to make the game better! Here's how:

Hit! At £15,000, we'll get  even more beautiful pieces of art - one for each Hero in the book, and each of the non-Ilvashan Houses.
Hit! At £17,500 we'll improve the quality of the book with full-art endpapers and a ribbon bookmark.

Placeholder art
Hit! At £20,000, we'll be making map boards for use with the game. Folding out to an A3 size, this board will have a basic map of the area the game takes place in. And it'll be ready for you to customise, covered in a layer that's friendly for dry-erase markers.
This board will be included for free in all pledges at the £70 tier and above. For those at lower tiers, it'll cost £10 to grab a version for yourself.
Hit! The first Shard of Mysthea: a complete expansion for the game, opening up a new area of gameplay. The Rebel Underground is all about the resistance movements that sprung up in Montara under the Kitrean Empire's occupation, and how those movements grow and find new forms after the Empire's expulsion from the city. 
Play as the shadowy Disavowed Order.
Turn the city on its head with a Revolution.
Bring your protest movements to life with guidance from guest star writer Helen Gould.

Hit! If we hit £25,000 we'll make further physical addons to the game.
Render from Chessex Dice
First, a set of ten dice in five different colours, bearing the symbols of the Five islands revered by Lusma. These colours are particularly important in the solo play mode! They'll be available for £10.
Render from Tabletop Simulator
Second, a pack of A4 dry-erase handout cards, one for each House and Hero type. Currently this is 23 cards, but as we unlock more houses and heroes with the Shards of Mysthea they’ll get added to this set.  They'll be available for £15.
Finally, each city map board will come with four sheets of reusable stickers representing the different buildings, landmarks and factors used in this game. The stickers will be illustrated by Cecil Howe, designer of Hex Kit. These will be free to everyone getting a city map board!
Hit! At £27,500 we’ll unlock the next Shard of Mysthea, all about the inhuman intelligences of this land. In it you’ll find:
 The Foundling, a Hero who grew up among inhuman creatures and now finds themself pulled between their House and their monstrous family.
 The Chimera, a weapon of war created by the Kitrean Empire’s experiments with ambiance who has broken free from their handlers and now seeks their own path.
Essays on inhuman sentience from Sawyer Rankin, and weird fantasy warfare from Thea Don-Siemion.
 The Crucible - a wonder your House can work towards to reshape their biology or that of another group.

Hit! At £30k, we'll unlock The Silent Arts. In this Shard of Mysthea, we look at Qoam magic in full, glorious detail. How does society change when everyone has some measure of telekinetic power? How can ambiance warp the biology and social fabric of a community? When your bonds with others empower your strongest magic, what does it mean to be a powerful mage? Authors Kira Magrann and Erika Shepherd will be guiding us through these topics, and more. We'll also include:
A boundary-pushing Hero in the Warlock.
The Crystal-claimed, a House changed and made immortal by exposure to Qoam ambiance - but who are now forever tied to their crystal keep.
A Wonder to bring together the borderland's greatest minds in a Great Network.
 The Great Binding, a Quest your characters can embark on to seal away an arcane horror for good.
But that's not all! If we hit this tier we'll include every shard we unlock in the core book - both PDF and Print options. We estimate that this'll add around 30-40 pages to its page count.
Hit! If we hit £33k we'll upgrade the accessories again! The handout cards will become handout boards, made of thick, glossy, beautiful cardstock. And we'll also add another card deck - a deck of Resources to help you keep track of the Surpluses and Needs your Houses are grappling with. Expect more details on these as we approach the goal!
That's all, folks! Everything from here out will be put into making sure we make an excellent game.
Pledging isn't the only way you can help this project grow. Help spread the word and we'll unlock all sorts of extras - wallpapers, an interactive character builder, and postcards and posters included with every book!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our sixth Kickstarter - we have the infrastructure in place to deliver on time and on budget. We hope to use the same printers as Legacy: Life Among the Ruins, the same designers, and (depending on the final shipping quotes) the same distributors - but life happens, and we’re a small business working with small suppliers, so we’ve built in a contingency fund to help solve any problems we face over the development of this project.
We're also aware that Britain is due to exit the European Union during the duration of this project. It's impossible to say how this will affect our ability to deliver this project, but we have budgeted a significant chunk of money to pay for any Brexit-related costs that may crop up.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey folks!

There's been a bit of a production delay on the slipcases for the Deluxe editions, but I'm told they'll be at the warehouse within 3 weeks. At that point, Deluxe editions will start shipping.
Non-deluxe editions are on their way to non-US backers.
We're going to ship the US normal and Deluxe orders together, and then fulfil them from our US-based distributors. We'll give you a time estimate for how long that'll be once the pallets of books are safely on their way.

Hey folks,
A quick note to say that we plan on starting to send out books next week! If you need any address changes, please let us know as soon as possible.
Very excited to start seeing the books in you folks' hands!
Best wishes,

Hi all,
Firstly, I’d like to apologise for my lack of communication concerning this project. After the last update in November, there were unexpected issues with the print files, but even after signing off on the final files with the manufacturer back in early January various shortages and delays related to Brexit have interrupted the printing process and pushed back delivery by several months. It’s been frustrating to not have any news to give you, and I’m sorry that I’ve left you in the dark.

Hey folks, I thought I'd give an update on the production timeline.
First up, thank you for your patience. 2020 has been one hell of a year and this game has hit some unexpected hurdles on the way. I'm glad to hear reports of people playing the game out in the wild (e.g. these two articles from Paul Mitchener at the Indie Game Reading Club), and it's been good to hear stories of each different groups' Montara.
Second: the card addons have been completed! I'm very happy with how they turned out, and both the A4 handouts and poker-sized decks are looking great. See below for pictures:

Hey folks,
I'm very happy to say that Shattered City is now out! You should all have DriveThruRPG codes on their way to you - if you haven't got it by this time tomorrow (and checked your spam folder!) please get in touch. The itch.io listing has also updated with the final files: core book, handouts with and without art, landmark and factor cards, and the borderlands map.

campaign.story:
AcadeCon 2019: Ours goes to 7
AcadeCon is a 3-day tabletop gaming convention at the Dayton Convention Center, in Dayton, Ohio. November 8th - 10th, 2019.  
AcadeCon would not exist if not for The RPG Academy podcast and they are forever intertwined.  The motto of the Podcast is "if you're having fun, you're doing it right!' and our goal has always been to help more people play games and have more fun while doing it.
We're not into telling our listeners they should play the way we play, but instead - play the way that's the most fun for them at their table and with their group.  And that's the same attitude we bring to AcadeCon.  We don't go in for edition waring or gatekeeping. AcadeCon is open to gamers of all types and experiences levels. No matter which games you love, you're likely to find people at AcadeCon who also love that game and if not you'll probably find people open to learning it from you or happy to teach you the game(s) they love. We want to provide a place for people to play these games and have fun. 
AcadeCon started in Michael's basement and no matter how large it grows, the idea of playing games with your friends will always be at the heart of what we're trying to do and that's where the AcadeCon motto comes from:  Gaming with friends, old and new!
In addition to playing games with friends (old and new), AcadeCon offers almost unprecedented access to some amazing RPG designers, authors, and fan favorite podcasting personalities. At AcadeCon, these people are there to have fun and play games, just like you. Join into one of their events and don't be surprised if they join into one of yours!
If that sounds like something you’d like to support then this is the place for you. If you can, support our Kickstarter by going ahead and buying your badge now. We know it's early and life can change so we do offer the option of getting a refund (minus the 10% we lose to Kickstarter fees) up until November 1st.  
Thank you for checking out our Kickstarter and we hope to see you in November!
                                 What's AcadeCon all about?
AcadeCon is specifically designed to be a smaller, non-traditional convention. We are not trying to (nor do we want to) compete with or replace the huge conventions that attract a national audience. At our convention, you're going to get access to some of the most amazing GMs and players, a better chance to play in the games you want, the opportunity to spend time and game with special guests, and time to hang out with some of the best gamers in the world—the fans of our show and returning AcadeCon alumni.
Joe Meade is taking some play testers through a session of Omens of Destiny. Look for it soon from NobleQuest.
Whether you are one of our listeners, are interested in meeting and playing with some of our special guests, or just found us by accident, we hope you'll consider grabbing a badge or maybe just a donation to help keep AcadeCon around in Dayton for years to come.
Mike from Flatworks Gaming grabbed one of our vendor tables and ran demos and sold copies of Dwarven Smithy all weekend long.
AcadeCon 2019 is our 7th annual gaming convention. From that first year of 15 people to last year with over 500, AcadeCon continues to grow. Help us grow by coming to play games with us and telling all your friends about us as well.
Want to see more pictures from previous AcadeCons?

  Special guests.
Each year we invite a wealth of RPG Podcasters, Game designers and fiction authors to come hang out with us. Some do panels, some hold live events, some run games and some may join into your game.
  In addition to covering our deposits, this KS will help us set our budget for bringing in guests for this year and scheduling them early helps ensure they are able to join us.
