updates.update_content:
It's been a really hectic couple of months. One moment things were fine and the next moment we were in the middle of an apocalypse. It's been quite a trying period personally and I know its been a struggle for all of us to deal with the Covid pandemic. Please stay as safe as possible.

We thought this time would be an amazingly productive period for us but sadly it was hard staying focused when you're worried about paying rent, surviving and just generally navigating our way through this tricky time. All of us are working part time on the game and things, especially in April/May were quite bad with some of us losing work and wondering how to get by.

Here in Cape Town, on the southern tip of Africa, winter is making way for the bright sunny days of spring and summer as we fast approach the end of the year.  In another age and place winter's cold bite is just beginning to sink it's teeth in and Freja's journey is well underway.  Well, perhaps not all the realms, Muspelheim is a scorcher all year round.  But enough about the weather, there's been a lot more exciting things happening in the world of Freja and the False Prophecy that we can't wait to share!

The undead Draugr are sharpening their weapons for battle, evil sits on a throne in the depths of the viking  fortress, ancient recipes are being discovered and gifts have arrived from across the raging seas.  It's time for another update and behind the scenes look into what's been happening in the world of Freja and the False Prophecy!

campaign.story:
EMBERWIND is a new breed of tabletop RPG based on the belief that games should adapt to their players, and not the other way around.
EMBERWIND's modular game engine allows you to combine rulesets to suit the epic Heroes in your party. We're turning to Kickstarter to launch the EMBERWIND Core, an engine that offers the base for fast, fun, intense, customizable gaming. In the future, we'll release additional modules and content packages to help you further customize and deepen your play experience.
The Core engine combines the best elements of our favourite RPGs and video games from the past 20 years, plus some new innovations of our own, all streamlined to make it easy for new players to pick up and for experienced players to dive deeper into strategy and storytelling.
We think there's a lot to be excited about here. That's why we're releasing our beta live during the campaign and letting backers judge for themselves.
Take a look yourself with our first standalone campaign The Skies of Axia, our free monthly DLC packages on Drive-Thru RPG, or our new playable lore Vignette "Sunlight and Sky."
You can also preview new content on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and see some of our most definitive mechanics lower down on the page (see "A Look Under the Hood") or in the FAQ.
The EMBERWIND Core rules are intuitive enough to learn in minutes, but offer untold depths of strategy through co-op tactics and modular plugins.
We believe that a modular RPG has more to offer players, because players have more to offer each other than a static rules system will allow. That's why we're turning to Kickstarter not just a fundraising platform, but a community of tabletop-lovers.
We're looking for your input as we build a community and decide which rules modules to build onto the Core, and release new campaigns, storylines, and settings.
This starts with the EMBERWIND Hero Manual: Core Edition, a resource book that gives players everything they need to create fully fleshed, customized Heroes using the game's nine main Classes and drop them into new conflicts, storylines and challenges to test their mettle.
We think you're going to love our system. So much so that we're already releasing the beta of our Hero Manual to all reward tier levels during the campaign. We send new invitations to all backers every Monday and Thursday, but you can get yours sooner if you create an account on emberwindgame.com and message us your username or registration email via the Kickstarter messaging system.
*Cover artwork not final.
To get your Heroes into the game, you'll either need one of our two campaign book releases, or our free DLC, which includes Foe Cards (monsters you can fight) and Vignettes (playable scenarios), both of which are accompanied by lore stories.
Sample Foe Card DLC, available for free right now on www.emberwindgame.com
All books come with complimentary PDFs tied to your emberwindgame.com account and offer lifetime access to future versions of that same book. That means if we go back to fix errors, update rules or add new sections, you will be able to visit our website and download the updated version from your account.
Our campaigns teach players the rules as they play, so no one needs to spend hours learning the manual. Even better, we've made GMs optional, with a branching Crossroads system run by rotating narrators and dynamic party voting. Our combats are driven by a hex-based AI system for Foes so everyone can get in on the action.
You can show up to the gaming table and begin playing in minutes with pre-gen Heroes and a few print-outs. 
Sasmple pre-gen Hero Card. Click to download the Skies of Axia campaign's Support Package and see Hero Cards, Foe Cards, and the quick guide to turn rules.

For those who love deep dives, the Hero Manual helps you create your own characters. Plus, you can also have one player take on the full-time role of Storyteller and use our campaign books' enhanced Storyteller content for a more immersive role-playing experience with deeper ties to lore.

Scroll further down the page for a complete live playthrough of The Skies of Axia on Arvan Eleron's YouTube channel.
The Skies of Axia is our first campaign, released in March 2018. Take to the skies on a life-or-death mission to save Gelspar, the dangling slum district of the great airship city of Adriel. Deadly foes and hidden threats lie in wait around every corner, and it will take every bit of skill and knowledge your Heroes possess to uncover the secret of the hearth crystals and return before Gelspar falls from the sky—forever.
*Cover artwork not final
The Songweave Tapestry takes place on the eve of the Festival of Sparks. The mountaintop city of Summit teeters on the brink of chaos. The scions, a once-extinct order of heretic mages, are on the rise. Rumours say the cult plans to unveil a dangerous invention restored from the age of the Unravelling. As the festival approaches and the city becomes a madhouse of controversy, you find yourself at the heart of a conflict that threatens to tear the city apart.
EMBERWIND's game system, which we call the RISE Engine, has been in the works for a decade. Here are some of the features we're damn proud of.
You always know your target number. Rather than bogging down gameplay with complex calculations on both your roll modifier and target number, EMBERWIND uses a streamlined d20 system with simple math on one side of the roll so you always know the odds of pulling off a masterstroke.
CAP checks make attack rolls simple and fast. In EMBERWIND, it only takes a single die roll against a pre-calculated set of values to instantly determine if you hit your target, if you penetrate their defences, and if you score a critical hit.
We made our Classes as flavourful and adaptable as possible. They draw on elements of real-world history and culture, from Taoist philosophy to African war tactics to 12th-century Persian assassin training, re-imagined through mechanics and abilities that let you push past fantasy tropes.
Tell stories without a GM. EMBERWIND campaigns are told through a series of linked encounters read by a rotating narrator, so nobody needs to sit out as GM. At the end of every encounter is a Crossroad, where your party faces a set of branching narrative choices that you navigate together through dynamic voting systems. It's choose-your-path adventure book with epic combats and cascading consequences that culminate in epic finales.
Combats run themselves with Foe AI. Every EMBERWIND Foe has an AI Hex Grid that lets you roll a die and randomly execute a preset attack sequence. Default Characteristics determine how they move and attack, Optional Modifiers grant additional depth to combat, and learning mechanisms keep Heroes on their toes. Switch between Skirmish and War modes for AI to keep larger battles moving smoothly.
You can learn more about these specific mechanics in our FAQ section, including how GM-less storytelling works, how Foe AI Hex Grids, how to make a CAP Check, and what a Round of Combat looks like in EMBERWIND.
You can also review the quickplay combat turn rules from our Skies of Axia campaign for a simple walkthrough.
Click to download.
Or see the mechanics in action in Arvan Eleron's YouTube-streamed playthrough of The Skies of Axia!
Enter the EMBERWIND battlefield with nine powerful Hero Classes that let you reinvent your role in the party and your path to victory. We decided to build our Classes not around fulfilling a single role in the party, but by achieving any number of roles using a particular flavour or play style.
Commander Classes
The Atlanta is the lion of war, always found where the fray is thickest. She relies on her mastery of arms and supernatural charisma to carry her allies to victory. With an Atlanta in their ranks, a small unit can fight with the ferocity of an entire army.
Spell Schools and Exploit Expertises: Restoration Magic, Skirmishing Expertise, Inspiration Expertise, Shielding Expertise
The Spiritualist moves like water. He is a sea of calm on the surface, hiding powerful currents of energy in his depths. He uses his mystic arts to raise fallen allies, drain the vigour of his enemies, or deliver blows that turn bone to dust.
Spell Schools: Healing Magic, Harrow Magic, Involution Magic
The Tactician is the most adaptable frontline leader. A good Tactician knows how to read his opponents, stack the deck in his allies’ favour, and play the odds to come out on top in the mud, blood, and chaos of the battlefield.
Exploit Expertises: Motivation Expertise, Bravery Expertise, Warfare Expertise
Soldier Classes
While the Archer is peerless in ranged combat, she can fluidly shift between combat styles to dispense with enemies near and far with and respond to the rhythms of combat to make sure every shot and slash lands true.
Exploit Expertises: Preparation Expertise, Wind Dancing Expertise, Sharpshooting Expertise
The Rogue uses a trickster’s cunning, a gambler’s courage, and an assassin’s unflinching instincts to claim victory. Relying on expert positioning, lightning reflexes and deadly poisons, the Rogue always ensures a swift kill and safe retreat.
Exploit Expertises: Trickster Expertise, Serpent Expertise, Slayer Expertise
To the Warrior, the battlefield is a canvas that can be painted with a hundred different kinds of bloodshed. A cunning fighter, the Warrior overpowers foes and defends fellow heroes with a constantly evolving arsenal of battle maneuvers.
Exploit Expertises: Armsman Expertise, Brutality Expertise, Defender Expertise
Harbinger Classes
The Ardent weaves arcane power into complex chains of magic that can lay waste to a battlefield or strike down single targets with merciless efficiency. As dangerous as the magic she parleys with, the Ardent is driven by a burning obsession with power.
Spell Schools: Needling Magic, Destruction Magic, Manipulation Magic
The Druid is a keeper of the wilderness and an enforcer of its harsh laws. Like the natural world they draw their magic from, Druids are extremely adaptable, capable of unleashing a full spectrum of regenerative and destructive forces.
Spell Schools: Regeneration Magic, Degeneration Magic, Growth Magic
The Invoker is the unmatched master of control magic, capable of reshaping the battlefield and bending the minds and abilities of enemies. She specializes in adapting her strategies and directing combat with a well-placed curse or boon
Spell Schools: Alteration Magic, Curse Magic, Geomancy Magic

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We made a point of releasing our standalone campaign EMBERWIND: The Skies of Axia completely independently so we could run through a full project cycle from budgeting to delivery and learn the ropes without risking your time or money.

We’ve also hard-baked a live-development model into our company DNA to make sure we correct for mistakes, our consumers get value, and we have room to experiment with new gameplay features. We believe that if a customer buys a product, they've got it for life. That's why we offer lifetime PDF access to all future revisions of the print and digital books you buy through your account on emberwindgame.com.

The Core Combat rules have already been released for free use. The Core Roleplay are finished and will be released shortly once they’re finished their final editing and playtesting pass. Variant rule modules will be released in the future to provide players with new ways to customize their EMBERWIND play experience.

We've planned ahead to accommodate for delays and budget creep. As with any product, there is the outside possibility that some reward components could be delayed by production issues beyond our control, but we've built allowances into our delivery schedule to minimize the chance of you being affected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Created by Game Envy, The Hobby Holder is the only all-in-one mini holding solution and the most versatile painting holder and grip on the market. 
And now it is better than ever with the addition of an injection molded Ergonomic Grip and XL Stability Bar that seamlessly integrate with the original Hobby Holder to give you the most enjoyable and precise painting experience ever.
Since our first campaign was a smash hit last year, the original Hobby Holder All-in-one Miniature Painting Handle and Grip (Patent Pending) by Game Envy has had a global impact on miniature painting. Now, with the introduction of our new parts, well over 8000 painters in more than 50 countries are using the Hobby Holder as part of their painting arsenal!
We have talked to hundreds of painters across the globe at conventions, online and in person, and we have listened to your wants and needs. Now we are back to add two new pieces to the Hobby Holder system: the Ergonomic Grip for even greater control and comfort and the XL Stability Bar for more support with a wider range of miniature sizes. We are also adding more color to your desks with New Colors of the original Hobby Holder parts with a second production run!
All 11 Colors are Available in All 4 Parts - Mix and Match
The Hobby Holder is the World's Most Versatile, Comfortable and Precise Miniature Holder and the ONLY All-in-one Miniature Painting Handle and Grip. 
The translucent blue parts are resin printed prototypes.
Attach Miniatures to the Hobby Holder with Standard 28mm Bottle Caps or Even Wine Corks for Pinning.   
Accepts 28mm plastic caps; Citadel ™ Paint Caps; Formula P3 paint caps; and 20mm wine cork.
With the innovative bottle cap attachment method, just stick your miniatures, based or unbased, to a standard soda/water bottle cap with your favorite sticky stuff (we use Loctite Fun-tak, the best blue-tak on the market!) and you can quickly and easily screw them on and off without ever touching the miniature! Perfect for batch painting because you can switch even wet miniatures without smudging. 
Batch paint with ease and never touch a wet miniature again!
Pin your miniatures? No problem! The center hole of the Hobby Holder is perfectly sized to press fit standard wine corks or any 20mm cork. Just push them in, place in the pinned miniature and get painting! Done with the cork? Insert a paintbrush through the middle hole in the bottom of your Hobby Holder.
360 Degree Rotation in Any Position for Ultimate Precision
360 Degree Rotation Overhead Stability Bar Mode with the New XL Stability Bar
360 Degree Rotation Stability Bar Grip Mode
360 Degree Rotation in Ergonomic Grip Mode
With our unique patent pending design, the Hobby Holder threaded base can easily rotate 360 degrees in the Overhead Stability Bar mode, with the Stability Bar functioning as the grip in Grip Mode and now when clicked into the Ergonomic Grip Mod, with or without the Stability Bar attached, in Ultimate Support mode. This affords more control and the ability to get all around your miniature without letting go!
 New Ergonomic Grip Provides Even More Control and Comfort Tailored to How You Paint. 
Clicked into the Ergonomic Grip rotate your mini 360 degrees easily with one hand!
The new Ergonomic Grip gives even more support when attached to the bottom of the Hobby Holder Base and allows the use of the Stability Bar and Grip at the same time. Simply click in your Hobby Holder Threaded Base and start painting. The QuickClick design allows for Full 360 Degree Rotation of the Threaded Base with one hand while attached to the Ergonomic Grip.
The Ergonomic Grip is two pieces and can be taken apart and weighted if desired. It also has the option to add two standard nuts to screw in the original #6-32 bolt to lock down the Hobby Holder Threaded Base and now a 1/4" bolt to attach larger platforms if desired.
NEW XL Stability Bar Offers More Room For Larger Miniatures With the Same Superior Support.
The New XL Stability Bar uses the same QuickClick design as the Standard Size Stability Bar and attaches right onto the Hobby Holder Threaded base in Upright or Grip modes.
The XL Stability Bar accommodates miniatures with up to 70mm bases with ease and the offset finger support design allows you to attach miniatures that are even taller than the bar itself. The angle of the XL Stability Bar has been adjusted slightly so that even with the taller profile it is comfortable and easy to use with large or small hands.
Ultimate Support, Brush Control and Comfort with the Original Stability Bar and NEW XL Stability Bar  
The stability bar rotates 360 degrees so you never have to let go of your miniatures.
Paint with ease with unparalled acces all the way around your miniatures, even the top!
The original offset Stability Bar allows you to paint miniatures with up to 50mm bases in Overhead Stability Bar. Now with the XL Stability Bar you will be able to paint miniatures with up to 70mm bases. 
With the offset design of the Stability bar you can even paint taller miniatures. And with the multiple pinch and finger rests built into the Stability Bar there is always a comfortable way to hold your Hobby Holder while getting even the trickiest areas painted.
Want to paint even larger miniatures? Simply flip either Stability Bar over into Grip Mode or click on the new Ergonomic Grip and the Hobby Holder will accept any size miniature.
Easily Switch Between Base Only, Holder, Grip and Ultimate Support Modes with the QuickClick Connection.
High-strength ABS plastic means durable, longlasting QuickClick connections
The Ultimate All-in-one Painting Handle and Grip Now Has Even More Customization with Hundreds of Holding Positions
As the Hobby Holder can be customized so can your support and comfort!
More Great Features
Made from strong, yet lightweight ABS plastic
4mm center hole for removing corks. Just push a brush, file or cork popper through and out pops the cork.
Ergonomically designed and tested for maximum comfort while painting or sculpting
Dishwasher and Simple Green safe for quick cleaning
Reduced mess! Keeps your hands and work space cleaner
Made in the USA
Great for everyone – from those just getting into a hobby to seasoned professionals! 
Check out some amazing painters who use the Hobby Holder!
"As essential as a brush and pallet, the Hobby Holder is a must." - Sam Lenz
"I have been painting for over 20 years  and one of the things I advise everyone on is how to hold your miniature while painting. The Hobby Holder is the best on the market for this. You customize the grip to how you paint and it has endless options to personalize your painting experience. Hands down the best holder I have used." - Neil Hollis
"You can't paint miniatures without a brush, shouldn't paint without a lamp and you won't want to paint without the Hobby Holder once you have tried it." - Watch It Paint It
"Well, in short, it's really dope... I'm doing all sorts of flips with this beast and got mad angles sniped with the brush with fluid ease. Highly recommended y'all!" - Malev Minis
"I've been painting for about a decade now, and one thing I've always struggled with was holding the miniature well; to help stabilize it, I always pinched down on the top of the model, which often lead to rubbing away some paint. The Hobby Holder has been a game-changer here - the vertical stability bar takes the place of that pinch, without needing to touch the model at all. The handle is comfortable and easy to use, and you can modify it to suit your needs - I've filled mine with a bit of wine cork for holding pinned models." - Mike Cousins, Epic Duck Studios
"From the first use, I fell in love with Hobby Holder, and MANY of my viewers in my stream have also fallen in love with theirs as well. Now with all of these great accessories available, how could you not use and love these products? Hobby Holder is the perfect tool for commission painters like myself, who need to quickly switch from model to model while batch painting, or get in tight on a competition piece. Hobby Holder is for literally anyone and everyone, and I feel it will help elevate any skill level!  Thank you Kit, for such a great set of products!  They really have changed my painting in a great way!" - Impending Duff
"The Hobby Holder has truly been a game changer for me! Not only for improved comfort while painting, but an overall improvement in the quality of my work. The handle is just amazing! I no longer have to touch my minis messing up the paint, and the handle has an area wide enough for me to stabilize my pinky on while I paint the tiniest of details. If that isn't amazing enough,  the addition of the large hand grip is just icing on this already amazing cake. I highly recommend the Hobby Holder and the super comfortable grip for every mini painter!" - Super Sarah
"The Hobby Hobby is hands down my favorite way to hold miniatures.  It gives me a consistent, adaptable way to hold just about anything.  I've used it for everything from mouselings to large terrain pieces due to its flexibility of use. With the large grip mod attached to the bottom I always have a perfect hold on my piece, no matter the size.  It's the tool I reach for with every mini." - Spotted Painter
"The Hobby Holder is seriously the best holder I have used; for my shaky hands, the Hobby Holder miniature holder, gives me the stability, control, and comfort I needed." - Brushforhire
The Hobby Holder does exactly what it says on the tin with its grip, handle and bottle cap base! It is easy to use and quick to swap bottle caps over while batch painting troops and even holding bigger models. - Garry's Workshop
The Hobby Holder is the perfect addition to any hobbyist's table. Whether you're clumsy of a good ol' perfectionist, it allows for comfort and precision for massive painting sessions as well as a handy way to switch between projects. I am so glad I discovered them!" - Samriel Painting Studio
Check out #hobbyholder and be sure to follow us Facebook, Instagram and Twitter to see all the amazing painting happening on the Hobby Holder!

Don't Already Have a Hobby Holder? Not sure what to get?
Below is an outline if you do not have a Hobby Holder. This is just a guide. Remember you can choose any combination of parts you would like.
 If you want the very basic setup you just need 1 PART: the Threaded Base. This allows you to screw on minis on caps or on corks and offers some grip support.

 If you want the complete Hobby Holder line  you would want 4 PARTS: the Threaded Base, the Standard (50mm) Stability Bar, the New XL (70mm) Stability Bar, and the New Ergonomic  Grip Mod.

Injection molds are expensive. With the creation of the original Hobby Holder, we put a lot of research into finding a US-based manufacturing partner who could produce exceptional quality parts. We have been thrilled with the results and our painters can attest to the quality of the parts. With this new campaign, we plan to have the molds made by the same company to get that same superior quality.
When the funding goal is reached with your help, we will be able to produce a family mold for the Ergonomic Grip Mod, a 3-part mold for the new XL Stability Bar, and machine time to get parts made from our existing molds. 
Packaging proofs for various parts
Working closely with our US-based manufacturer we have the injection mold files approved and waiting for the thumbs up to move forward. Once the go-ahead is given, we will see injection molded samples in about 15 days.
Pressure testing and quality review
During this time, we will be sending out surveys through BackerKit for you to select the various painting handle and grip parts and add-ons you would like. Once the surveys are completed, we will place the order with the manufacturer and anticipate receiving the new parts at the first half of February, with pledge fulfillment starting the beginning of March.
After fulfillment is complete, the entire Hobby Holder system will be available on the Game Envy website at www.gameenvy.net
My wonderful, supportive family <3
As many of you now know, my name is Kit, I am the founder of Game Envy Creations and creator of the Hobby Holder and many unique hobby accessories. I am a husband to a wonderful wife, father to two sweet boys and one cute kitty. I am self employed and dedicated to bringing amazing hobby products to life through Game Envy Creations and creating beautiful design through my freelance graphic design business. Making makes me happy and being able to share it with the world makes me even happier!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In our first Kickstarter campaign we learned a lot about the manufacturing process and acknowledge there is always the risk of delays. Working with a US-based manufacturer means we have better communication, only being one timezone apart. It also means we can get changes and parts done in several days, rather than months.

We are using our same trusted vendors who we are in close communication with to make sure everything is on track and have backup plans available if there are any hiccups. This combined with open and quality communication with our backers we were able to start delivering rewards within three months (two weeks early) in the original Hobby Holder campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I want to provide you a prescription to improve how you navigate intimacy and relationships. And I want you to giggle some while we do it. -Dr. Faith G. Harper
Featuring illustrations by Trista Vercher of sex-positive, science-informed brains!
This book is about building intimacy, with or without a partner, through personal and sexual expression. Especially through shit like consent, boundaries, and communication—which we don’t talk about on the regular, although we really fucking should. 
And this book is also about sex.
For most of us, sex is a big part of our lives and romantic relationships. It’s not the foundation of a long term partnership, but it is that super-important spray insulation foam that fills in all the cracks and gaps, keeping the foundation airtight. 
We can’t separate the relationship stuff from the sex stuff, because they are not separate issues. Sex is an instrumental part of connection and communication between partners. So information on building, or rebuilding, that connection is here as well.
Dr. Faith's mission in her newest book is to help you make your intimate relationships more awesomely satisfying—whatever that means to you. 
In Unf*ck Your Intimacy, you'll learn practical knowledge and advice around:
Three major factors that hold us back from satisfying intimate relationships: Trauma, conflicts with our religious beliefs or upbringing, and our uncooperative, constantly changing bodies
Self-compassion, boundaries, and consent—the basic foundations of a healthy intimate life
Figuring out your own sexual identity, wants, and needs
Core skills for finding a date, dating, and relationshipping
Rockstar communication skills for any kind of relationship
Sensual and sexual touch, by yourself and with partners
Steps for recovery from cheating
Good boundaries and communication for open relationships, kinky stuff, and any time partners have differential desires
This book is for everyone who is open to exploring their intimate life and who wants some permission, perspective, skills, and science to help get them there.
The author is kind, wickedly knowledgable, swears a lot, and is mindful of potential trauma histories and other vulnerabilities. If you're single, partnered, polyam, queer, trans, hetero, pan, ace, demi, figuring it out, or have no idea what any of that means, you're welcome in these pages. 
About the book
Unf*ck Your Intimacy is divided into three parts. Here's how the author describes them:
Part One: How Our Intimacy Gets Fucked
Human beings are epically skilled at fucking up a good thing. How many bizarre messages have you received about sex and love over the years that really crimped your game? We’ve got shame issues, abuse issues, religious messages. That’s a lot of shit to navigate.
Part Two: Unfucking Our Relationship with Ourselves 
Have you never had a handle on what you want and who you are? Or did you once, and then everything changed because you changed? We certainly can’t have the deep, interpersonal connections we want if we don’t know what we actually, really want. That doesn’t make us shitty human beings. It makes us products of a society that tells us how to be, what to be, and who to be. Which means many of us have work to do. What’s our identity? How do we communicate with others? How can we interact with our own selves in order to be authentic, connected human beings? 
Part Three: Unfucking Our Relationships with Others
Once we get a better handle on who we are, then we have to figure out who we are in connection with other people. And we need to learn to express that honestly, vulnerably, and all that horribly difficult shit. Remember, intimacy is interpersonal. Very few people are an island unto themselves. So how do we do this well in a world that is designed for us to fuck it up?
About the author
Dr. Faith G. Harper (aka The Intimacy Dr.) is the author of the bestselling Unf*ck Your Brain and a growing number of useful, hilarious, and down-to-earth books and zines that use science to teach you essential humaning skills. She’s a licensed professional counselor, board supervisor, certified sexologist, and applied clinical nutritionist with a private practice and consulting business in San Antonio, TX. She has been an adjunct professor and a TEDx presenter, and proudly identifies as a woman of color and uppity intersectional feminist. 
About the publisher
Since 1996, Portland-based independent Microcosm Publishing has been creating and distributing books and zines for the purpose of reader self-empowerment, on topics ranging from punk to bicycling, healthy eating to healthy relationships, social skills to social justice. 
About the rewards
The book itself
Unfuck Your Intimacy: Using Science for Better Relationships, Sex, & Dating by Faith G. Harper, PhD, LPC-S, ACS, ACN is a 192 page paperback book, 5.25x6.75 inches, with illustrations throughout by Trista Vercher. It comes out in June, 2019, but Kickstarter backers will get their copies in February. 
Intimacy & Coping
We're releasing two books at once by Dr. Faith: Intimacy and Coping Skills. We ran the Kickstarter campaign for Coping last month, and as promised, you can save a bit on shipping by backing both at once here. Also, these coping skills are gonna come in handy as you face your stuff about sex and relationships. Trust us.
Intimacy Outtakes
At this level, you'll get the Intimacy book, plus these Dr. Faith & friends zines that didn't make the final cut:
 Sex Toys - this is a full chapter that we had to cut out of Intimacy for space reasons. 
 STI FAQ - co-written with Dr. Aaron Sapp and Bonnie Scott, this guide to sexually transmitted infection demystifies the medical side like whoa and offers valuable emotional advice for living with an STI.
 BDSM FAQ - Dr. Faith's first-ever zine! Parts appear in the Intimacy chapter on kink, but the whole thing is super helpful if you're at all interested in exploring this sort of play
 Woke Parenting #4 - co-written with fellow sex therapist Bonnie Scott, this issue of the popular Woke Parenting zine is all about how to teach your kids good interpersonal relationship skills, including in sex and dating
Heal Yourself
So this book (and all of Faith's work) is very trauma-informed. If you're struggling with past trauma of any kind, it probably affects your intimate life. These books can help. Along with Intimacy, you'll get:
 Unf*ck Your Brain - this is the classic! Learn exactly what past shit you've gone through is doing in your brain and how to recover fully, because yes that is something you can do
 Support - Cindy Crabb's small resource on healing from sexual abuse, and helping others heal
 Self-Compassion - another one by Faith. There's a short chapter on this in Intimacy but the whole, uncompressed thing, including more exercises, is really nice to have
 Coping Skills - because this is powerful stuff and you need as many resources as you can get
Dating & Relationshipping Toolkit
Want a level-up with your partnering or partner-seeking? Along with Unf*ck Your Intimacy, we'll send you this practical and entertaining list:
 Sex From Scratch - Sarah Mirk's guide to the range of healthy relationships provides excellent perspective and food for thought on what you want your intimate life to look like, and with who
 Consensuality - Helen Wildfell and friends' meditations and exercises are all honed for developing better skills around boundaries and consent, even if you've never learned that stuff before
 Learning Good Consent - Cindy Crabb's classic guide to this much-misunderstood term and practice
Sexitimes Superpack
Sex is something you can always learn more about and get more inspired about. This extremely sexed up zine collection starts with Unf*ck Your Intimacy and goes on to include
 Sex Toys - yup, the chapter that got cut, you can now have in your back pocket!
 Sexing Yourself - the masturbation chapter did not get cut, just edited down a bit, but we figured you might need it anyway. The perfect gift for your friend who's recovering from a fundamentalist upbringing
 Go F*ck Yourself - a handy guide to crafting your own sex toys!
 Dick Ain't Sh*t - because there is so much more to sex than putting dicks in places
 Sex Without Roles - while Eli Sachse's excellent zine is written specifically for people in transition, it's a good read for anyone seeing to know and communicate what they want sexually
 Adult Themes - Chantel G's sexy stories and poems are a nice break from all the instructional stuff we're laying on you here
 Chocolatology isn't intentionally a sexy book, but the chocolate truffles / hot chocolate / savory chocolate meals you produce from it may or may not significantly improve your chances of successful intimacying. Let us know how it goes!
Love Stories (Kind of)
Whether or not you care about sex, maybe you're a romantic, or maybe the romantic part of your life is what needs more work and inspiration. Pay good heed to the many communication and boundaries skills contained within Unf*ck Your Intimacy, and also enjoy these tales, fictional and non:
 Aftermath of Forever - Natalye Childress dishes the dirt on her many dates after a young divorce, from the humorous to the poignant
 White Elephants - Katie Haegele's touching true story about finding love in the midst of grief
 Portland Queer - many contributors write about pursuing love, sex, and getting to live their own lives in the Rose City, edited by Ariel Gore
 The Velocipede Races - Emily June Street's exciting novel of bicycle racing and coming-of-age
Dr. Faith Book & Zine Superpack
Our own doc Faith is a prolific creator. We're not above turning one of her zines into a chapter of a book or vice versa. So this is her full complement of stuff we've published. Some of this content has some overlap (eg, the Anxiety and Depression books started as chapters of Unf*ck Your Brain and were greatly expanded so that they're pretty much new works) but we've left out the stuff that is basically just a copyedited version of a chapter in something else. So along with Unf*ck Your Intimacy, you'll enjoy this still-vast collection including five other books:
 Unf*ck Your Brain- the Dr. Faith classic, it's a bestseller for a reason!
 Unf*ck Your Adulting - how to act grown. Spoiler: it's not about making your bed, it's about how you treat yourself and others
 This is Your Brain on Depression - the science of how depression happens and how we get better
 This is Your Brain on Anxiety - another sciencey take, with lots of practical measures to get free again
 Coping Skills - from everyday stressors to major impacts, these skills will get you through
And a whole stack of zines:
 Unf*ck Your Sleep - the most basic, necessary, and overlooked thing of all
 Self-Compassion - another extremely basic need, expanded from the chapter in Intimacy 
 Woke Parenting #1-4 - co-written with Bonnie Scott, these parenting zines teach you to raise intersectional feminists who can fend for themselves in this messed up world
 Getting Over It - how to move on from whatever's holding you back
 Emotional Freedom Technique - aka "tapping," this helps with the getting-over-stuff
 Achieve Your Goals - a miniature workbook for actualizing your dreams
 Working - how to get by, get ahead, and achieve more goals, via working for money
 Defriending - because all this intimacy stuff aside, friendship breakups are the worst
 Sex Toys - maybe we should have cut the chapter on resolving fights and just put this one in anyway? 
 BDSM - it's really all about consent, communication, and boundaries, not that 50 Shades crap
 Unf*ck Your Brain Workbook - exercises to help you human better
 STI FAQ - co-authored with Dr. Aaron Sapp and Bonnie Scott, all the medical and emotional issue you need to survive getting a sexually transmitted infection
 Detox Your Masculinity - another Dr. Aaron collabo, this one is all about body image issues, specifically for men and masc folx
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If we let you get close enough to read this book, there's a very good chance we might be rejected or hurt. What if we share a beautiful moment and then you abandon us for some Penguin Random House relationship guide? But we're bravely putting ourselves out there anyway, because when it does work out, the rewards of forging genuine relationships with readers are so much greater than the risks. It's what keeps us going, actually. Thanks for being part of this.

updates.update_userinfo: A virtual Dr. Faith event (and a sexy new Kickstarter project!)
updates.update_content:
Hi all - we hope you're all as well as you can be, and that the tools in Unf*ck Your Intimacy have been helpful in navigating this wild year. 
Portland independent bookstore giant Powell's is hosting a virtual book release event for Dr. Faith's 3 new books that have come out so far in 2020. You're invited! It's on Sunday, Nov 29th at 2pm pacific time.  Registration is required, and free.
*ALSO* we are proud to be getting into a whole new genre of publisher: Queer erotica! Sadly, we haven't gotten Dr. Faith to write for it yet, but we're honoring what we've learned from her by making sure that everything we publish is brimful with consenting adults communicating their boundaries in a red hot respectful manner. Check it out for some fun fictional inspiration.

updates.update_userinfo: How to be Accountable (a new Dr. Faith book!)
updates.update_content:
As the world burns (yeah, here on the west coast of the US, that's literally), it seems extra important to hold close the people we trust, strengthen our relationships by setting good boundaries, and be the best versions of ourselves that we can be. 
So the next Dr. Faith book, co-authored with Microcosm publisher Joe Biel, couldn't be more timely: How to Be Accountable is all about how to step up and build the life and relationships you want, using brain science to change the habits and behaviors you don't want.

updates.update_userinfo: Love in the time of coronavirus (and a new Dr. Faith workbook/planner
updates.update_content:
Yesterday, a friend and I spent maybe a little too much time talking on Facetime about the Netflix reality series Love Is Blind and how perfectly timed it is to come out in a moment when it's literally illegal (at least in Oregon) to touch another human that you don't already live with. And when the people we do live with are getting on our last nerve.
Hopefully the lessons in Unf*ck Your Intimacy are helping you through making stronger connections in these weird times, regardless of your relationship status. If you want to share about that, we'd love to hear it!

This is a project I'm extremely passionate about. Starting with the discovery of magic and delving deeper into a dark past, the story of Charlotte (AKA Charlie) Ambrose is one about finding empowerment and inner strength. I have been working on this project since February 2018 and the story has been in the works for several years now. 
Featuring 124 full color pages, Knights of Asherah Volume 1 covers the first several chapters of my comic, which you can read for free, here. However, Volume 1 features brand new artwork and longer chapters than what is currently available to read online. Plus it's signed. Just saying.
$6,000 Stretch Goal Hit! - Volume 1 has been upgraded to 148 pages
$10,000 Stretch Goal Hit! - Every physical order will receive a free kickstarter exclusive hard enamel pin as a thank you gift! 
$14,000 Stretch Goal Hit! - Knights of Asherah Volume #1 has been upgraded to a hardcover edition!
$18,000 Stretch Goal Hit! - A softbound art book has been added to the reward tiers! Collector and Cameo tiers automatically receive this, and you can add on the book by adding $12 to your pledge or pledging the art book reward.
The art book will be approximately 8x10 inches with approximately 48 pages including art, concepts, originals and even some behind the scenes stuff like sketches and tutorials.
$20,000 Stretch Goal Hit! - A holographic postcard will be added to all physical orders as a thank you gift!
All goals hit! Thank you for your support!
What genre is it, you might ask? Well, it's got a little bit of everything. Fantasy, magic, a smidgen of action and a dash of romance. 
Magic isn't real.... except that it is.
Charlotte "Charlie" Ambrose discovers that magic is real in the modern world and that she's a descendant of the Celestials; God like beings only known in myths and legend.
All artwork and story are by me, Anadia-chan. I'm a one woman show and a freelance artist in Southern Oregon. I'm an artist... so being a liiiittle weird comes with the gig. Art is my passion and I try to express myself through my stories. I hope you'll enjoy it as much as I do. Thank you for your support!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The kind of challenges this project presents is nothing I haven't faced before. Reformatting my webcomic into a printed version is going to be no easy task and neither is redrawing hundreds of art frames. It's a project I'm working on though; regardless of whether or not I raise the funds this time around. I've been working on redrawing my old frames for several weeks now and I can assure you that it won't disappoint.
Right now our biggest risk is delays. Due to all of the stretch goals that have been unlocked, there is a higher work load on me and I am working very, very hard to make sure all of you will be satisfied.

updates.update_content: In case you guys  missed the launch, Chasing Stars, my other comic, is currently finishing  up its Issue #1 campaign. This will be your last chance to back it  before it ends. You can find the campaign HERE and check it out!

I'm excited to announce that Chasing Stars has been launched! You can go check out the page HERE
It's an exciting fantasy comic featuring a strong female anti-hero and a too-serious knight in charge of catching the elusive thief.
In a world brimming with magic and spirits, we introduce the charismatic  Emery Moon, Asteria's most wanted thief. Aston White, a rising knight  eager to prove himself, is tasked with her capture, but there is more to  the elusive thief than meets the eye. Our story genre features strong  elements of fantasy, action, and magic in this exciting game of cat and  mouse.

Thank you everyone for the completion of Volume #1! If you have any issues with your order, please contact me immediately.
If you haven't already backed, Volume #2 is already in the works. The campaign ends in two weeks. You can find the campaign HERE. There will be similar rewards as Volume #1 and our next stretch goal unlocks a free gold phoenix enamel pin.

updates.update_userinfo: If you haven't gotten your books yet-
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! I've been working really hard to try to make sure everyone has gotten their books.
It took a lot of badgering, but I was finally informed by USPS that a large amount of my packages were on a pallet that was damaged. This caused a lot of books to be delayed or lost. If you haven't gotten your book yet or if your book was damaged, please inform me immediately via PM (PM is easier to pull up your order info, as I cannot do this from a comment.)

Hello everyone and thanks for being patient. I've seen quite a few comments and messages saying that they have yet to receive their package. I'm doing what I can to look into it and figure out what is causing these shipping delays. 
If you have not received your book by next week in the United States, please message me (via PM, not comment. I cannot pull up your order from a comment but can in a message) then I will send out replacements free of charge. I am so sorry, and like I said, I am doing what I can to figure out what is causing these delays.

I am working on shipping out the last few hundred books this week. I'm hoping to get through all of them this week, so if you haven't gotten your book yet it is most likely in this batch. I also see that some of you have already gotten your books! I hope you guys are enjoying them!
I've also noticed that some of you have marked an Art Book as an add on but without adding the additional $12 to your kickstarter price. If you missed adjusting your pledge and would like the art book, you can finally get it on Etsy Here.

Thank you all for being patient! I see that some of you have already gotten your packages and I hope with all of my heart that you enjoy it as much as I do! 
If you haven't gotten your package yet, don't be worried because I am still packing books up and shipping them and haven't gotten through all of them yet. You all need to understand I am doing this all by myself and wrapping, packing, and printing shipping labels is a lot of work for one person, especially when the package count is roughly a thousand. I'm getting them done as quickly as humanly possible and I promise that you'll get your package soon if you haven't yet. Also note that international packages will take a little longer to receive.

I am working super hard at getting packages shipped out! The first round of packages will be shipped out tomorrow and I'll be getting as many as I can shipped throughout the week. These were the expedited copies and the rest of the books (still over a thousand copies on their way!) will be shipped out as quickly as possible too. 
Here is a quick glance at the books and my mess of a table. The books turned out gorgeous. I really have to thank all of you again for making this dream a reality and I hope that you all enjoy it as much as I have :)

Hello everyone and thank you so much for your patience. I have great news! After over a month of waiting... I finally got my shipping notification that the books are on their way to me! I talked with my printing press this week and they informed me that because I am ordering such a large quantity of books and they're much longer than the average comic (we are getting 148 pages after all and hardcover) that it took them longer to prep and print than normal. 
This is my first time publishing a book and it's a much more lengthy process than I anticipated. In my head I'd have these out by February or March... not April! The prep work has been incredibly stressful and I'm still working out so many kinks, but I appreciate all of your support and patience. I'll be MUCH better prepared for volume 2 and know what to expect during this process. It doesn't help that I have a fully booked schedule and I visit comic cons on a regular basis to promote and sell my work.

campaign.story:
New MexiCon is the only indie tabletop roleplaying game convention in New Mexico. We strive to offer a wide variety of games in a friendly and welcoming environment. Join us in 2019 for our best convention yet!
A weekend of gaming in Albuquerque: April 5th - 7th, 2019. 
Join us for all FIVE sessions of gaming!  
The genesis of New MexiCon came from late night talks at Origins 2014. A few New Mexicans mentioned putting on a con and several voices called out variations of “I’d go to that!” Less than five months later New MexiCon was born. We were thirty people playing small-press indie games in a dark room. Now, five years later, we have continued iterating on a unique con experience.
What makes us unique? Read on to find out!
Why are we putting on an indie tabletop roleplaying game con? We want people playing roleplaying games - new games, different games, more games! Providing a welcoming space where this can happen is our goal for New MexiCon. We want to expand gaming circles, foster local and regional rpg communities, and bring people together to play games and share ideas! 
The traditional model for tabletop roleplaying game conventions has been a large room with lots of tables. This works well for some games but sometimes the nuances of a scene can get lost in a big room with background noise. This is why we have structured New MexiCon to have each game run in its own private room. We want you to have an environment for your game that will be as distraction-free as possible.  
Mustering is a fun way to pitch your game or find a game to play on the fly! To kick things off, all people running games will pitch their game to the con. Next, players choose the games they want to be in. A symbol on your badge will help determine priority and resolve ties. The result? We get a large number of people playing really awesome games!
If you want to sign up to run a game or play a game before the convention, we have you covered! After the close of the Kickstarter, there will be a selection of games available for pre-registration online for backers only! More information will follow in Backer Updates.
As much as we like to game we also want to make sure folks have time to eat! Community is important to us, and what better way to get to know someone than to share a meal. This is why we schedule a lunch and dinner break so everyone has time to grab some noms, socialize with their fellow attendees, and still make the next gaming slot.
Mustering at New MexiCon encourages people to bring a wide variety of tabletop roleplaying games. Our convention is shaped by what games people are excited to run! There's only one thing better than playing and running games that you love - finding new games to love! At New MexiCon we encourage people to gravitate not only to those things that you know and love but to try new things as well. Just to give you an idea of the scope of games pitched, here are some of the games people brought to New MexiCon 2018:
Blades in the Dark, Pasión de las Pasiones, Lady Blackbird, Dialect, Lamentations of the Flame Princess, Swords Without Master, Cartel, Inspectres, Velvet Glove, Sagas of the Icelanders, Bluebeard’s Bride, Tales from the Loop, Burning Wheel, Primetime Adventures, Golden Sky Stories, Monsterhearts, Annalise, Epyllion, Mouse Guard, Masks, The Sprawl, Slayer Cake, Blue Rose and so much more!
Every pledge helps us bring you the best convention possible. Every guest helps us brings new and interesting characters to the table. And every game master helps us tell the moving and adventurous stories of our dreams. We love our spotlight GMs and want to give everyone a chance to play with these masters of the craft. So, when you buy a badge you will get a chance at a seat in a spotlight game! Or you can back at THE WHOLE ENCHILADA level to get a guaranteed spot in a GM spotlight game.
With an increase in hotel costs and growing numbers of attendees, we're looking to raise $1,500. We need your help to bring together this weekend of great gaming and awesome people against the beautiful southwestern backdrop of the Land of Enchantment.
Backing this Kickstarter will allow us to: 
Provide private gaming rooms 
Stock our Lobo Room with snacks and water 
Have an on-site printer 
Put on a post-con BBQ 
Spotlight talented GMs 
Every little bit helps, so please spread the word and bring your friends out to New MexiCon 2019!  
This year we are returning to the site of New MexiCon 2018, the MCM Elegante, under a new name: the Ramada Hotel Midtown! Here are some awesome features of this venue: 
 On-site bar - Great for hanging out with people after games. Chat and have a drink! 
 Free airport shuttle - Up to 5 miles around the hotel and airport pickup/dropoff. 
 Breakfast - Free breakfast available for hotel guests. $5.95 for everyone else! 
 Security - Gated parking with security 24 hours a day.  
 Swimming pool - Take a break from games and go for a swim! 
 Convention suite/break room - Hang out, talk games, and relax in the Lobo Room. 
 Private rooms for gaming - Beds will be removed, making room for tables and chairs
 Event oriented staff - Friendly hotel staff is accustomed to hosting events of all sizes.
We have a number of GMs here at New MexiCon whose mastery we want to celebrate. We will single out these GMs to run a GM Spotlight game for select guests! Each badge purchase will grant the attendee a chance at seat at the table!
SPOTLIGHT GM: Justin Suzuki
Justin Suzuki is a human being who loves to game. He was first introduced to RPGs over 30 years ago. Since then he has gone on to turn his love of gaming into hosting such gaming podcasts as RolePlayDNA and Smiling Jack's Bar and Grill. He also helped found Gamers Giving, a 501c3 charity based out of Colorado that raises money through gaming. Justin also helped by working on the Reality Blurs game tremulus.  
SPOTLIGHT GAME:  Voodoo Tilt (The Zombies of Rock) 
 Voodoo Tilt was one of the greatest hair bands of their time, but now a days they play smaller clubs and venues. On this day they are playing an island concert and even the dead are ready to rock! Play this FATE game as a member of the band or one of the roadies who are along for the ride. Bring your best roleplaying skills and get ready to live out all your hairband fantasies!    
SPOTLIGHT GM: Alexsondra "Faye" Oas-Thorn
Alex is a wound care specialist nurse with gaming dreams of grandeur. She is often found enthusiastically inspiring non-gamers to come and try something new. Experienced in LARP, first timers, SCA, End of Days and indie table tops of all kinds. Having dipped her toes into many games she has also tried table top war games, board game from BGG and netrunner LCG. Often found a little bit of everywhere, Alex is ready for adventures and snacks any time
SPOTLIGHT GAME: Ten Candles ( When the lights go out)  
"Ten Candles” is described as a "tragic horror" game rather than survival horror for one main reason: in Ten Candles there are no survivors. In the final scene of the game, when only one candle remains, all of the characters will die. In this, Ten Candles is not a game about "winning" or beating the monsters. Instead, it is a game about what happens in the dark, and about those who try to survive within it. It is a game about being pushed to the brink of madness and despair, searching for hope in a hopeless world, and trying to do something meaningful with your final few hours left".  
SPOTLIGHT GM: Yoshi Creelman
Yoshi Creelman is a member of the Gauntlet gaming community. You may have heard his voice on the occasional podcast, in particular the Mercy Falls Monsterhearts AP or the recent Big Bad Con roundup. His latest effort has been Gauntlet Games Now, an on demand gaming event for the online community. You can catch him playing or running the latest indie story game, most of the time with the hair up... but occasionally his fabulous hair will be down! 
SPOTLIGHT GAME: Good Society
Good Society is a game of regency romance and drama. There will be dances and manors, sly glances and whispered rumors, smooches and social backstabbing. All the characters will be entangled in a web of desires and obligations, rife for both disaster and celebration. Which will it be? Come play to find out!

We’ve got some awesome stretch goals lined up. Help us unlock cool new things to add to New Mexicon 2019!
$2,000 - Snack Time! - UNLOCKED
First up, at $2,000 we will provide snacks for the convention. The Lobo Lounge will be stocked with  chips and salsa and bottled water to keep every attendee refreshed and ready for action! 
$3,000 - GM Spotlight Strikes Back! - UNLOCKED
Next up, at $3,000 we will bring in another Spotlight GM Game! We have a number of GMs here at New MexiCon whose mastery we want to celebrate. We will single out these GMs to run a GM Spotlight game for select guests. Each pledge of $60+ will give you a chance at a seat at the table! 
$3,500 - Super Turbo Megagame! - UNLOCKED
Megagames have been popular at conventions across the country but, to our knowledge, there has never been a megagame in New Mexico. At this level we will be able to change that, offering a large scale game experience incorporating elements of RPGs, LARPs, and wargames. Spread the word and help us unlock this historic goal!
$4,500 - Snack Attack! - UNLOCKED
An edible upgrade! Upon unlocking this stretch goal we will stock the Lobo Lounge with a wider variety of enticing refreshments. Soda, candy, fruit, and the like will be available to you during the convention.
$5,500 - Return of the GM Spotlight! - UNLOCKED
Next up, at $5,500 we will bring in a third Spotlight GM Game! We have a number of GMs here at New MexiCon whose mastery we want to celebrate. We will single another one of these GMs to run a GM Spotlight game for select guests. Each pledge of $60+ will enter you in a raffle to win a seat at the table! 
$6,500 - Sandia Peak Game Mastery Awards! - UNLOCKED
Game Master, Master of Ceremonies, Dungeon Master, Storyteller, or Facilitator. Whatever you call them, it’s the people at the head of the table who bring us together time and time again. It’s their hard work and enthusiasm that perpetuates the hobby and continues to nurture our love of tabletop RPGs. And because of that, we think it is important to publicly recognize the exceptional GMs among us and thank them.
The Sandia Peak GM Awards give players the opportunity to nominate their favorite GMs in one of three categories:
 System Mastery: This GM facilitated the rules of their game with exceptional grace and skill.
 Hospitality: This GM crafted an extraordinarily fun and engaging atmosphere at their table.
 Creativity: This GM conveyed a clear and unique vision of the game to their players.
At the finale of our convention, three GMs will emerge victorious as Sandia Peak GMs! Winners are given prizes and showered with thanks and praise.
Jason Slanga, winner of the inaugural Sandia Peak GM Award for System Mastery had this to say about the Awards: "I had played in a game at every session Friday and Saturday, and on Sunday I decided to run Lady Blackbird. I had never run a game at a convention before, and didn't know what to expect. My players were amazing
$7,500 - SIX SESSIONS FOR OUR SIXTH YEAR! - UNLOCKED
At $7,500, we'll be able to make this the BIGGEST New MexiCon yet by adding an extra game session on Friday afternoon! Pack EVEN MORE gaming into your weekend with one more chance to play new games, meet new people, and create new memories!

New MexiCon is possible through the generous financial support of the following fine businesses:
Full Metal RPG is a podcast and publisher of RPG zines operating in Tempe, Arizona. #BornToKill 
Magpie Games is an Albuquerque-based publisher of indie RPGs, including award winning games like Bluebeard's Bride and Urban Shadows.
 Ziapelta Games is the Albuquerque-based publisher of the Golden Geek nominated Wrath of the Autarch, a kingdom-building RPG inspired by FATE that defies easy classification.
Third Eye Games is Eloy Lasanta's RPG publishing company with games such as Part-Time Gods, AMP: Year One, and the award winning 2nd edition of Ninja Crusade.
If you are business owner and would like to become a convention sponsor, get in touch so we can share information about our sponsorship packages. 
Matt Bohnhoff is the Convention Chair for New MexiCon. Matt publishes his own silly games through Wasteland of Enchantment and organizes games for teenagers at local libraries. He believes in the power of games as tools of expression, bonding, and education. 
Mark Diaz Truman is an independent game developer, co-owner of Magpie Games, and the New MexiCon Treasurer. Mark has authored/co-authored three indie RPGs—The Play’s the Thing, Our Last Best Hope, and the ENnie award-winning Urban Shadows—and is currently at work on his fourth game, Cartel. Mark is passionate about creating an inclusive and diverse gaming community and is thrilled to support New MexiCon’s sixth year! 
Justin Rogers, or "J.Ro", is a Program Co-Director for New MexiCon, and has done some writing, editing, and music composition for various indie RPG projects. He enjoys unreleased Apocalypse World hacks and "indie hipster barely-a-game" games, but has recently become super excited about Pathfinder.
Nick Hopkins is a Program Co-Director for New MexiCon. He had a very long stretch away from gaming but jumped back in with both feet in 2012. He manages the Albuquerque Area Meetup site helping people to find games with other people and runs a game for teens at the local library every other Saturday.
Ivan Begley joined the Program team this year. He discovered indie games far to late in his gaming career and, with New MexiCon, is doing everything he can to play as many different games as possible.
Geoff McCool is on the Program team for New MexiCon.  He has absolutely no gaming cred other than he has been gaming since 1980 (Moldvay), play-tested super popular games such as The Sprawl and Wrath of the Autarch, listened to the whole Narrative Control podcast series, and has actually met some published game designers (you know who you are!). 
Jason Slanga is a 2018 Sandia Peak Game Mastery Award recipient. He is a fluent speaker of Latin, and co-host of a Latin-language podcast, and is currently designing a short form, one-shot game for play in Latin. Jason is the New MexiCon Community Co-Coordinator. 
Graham Gentz mentors at "Working Classroom," a theater and arts nonprofit focusing on the education of youth from historically ignored communities and is the Community Co-Coordinator for New MexiCon. Graham took place in the 2018 200 Word RPG Challenge with “Youre Not A Nice Person Will You Die That Way.” He is currently working on “Secret Journey Monsters,” a narrative-focused TTRPG about children and creatures that replaces the slavery and dogfighting of its cultural influences with a Miyazaki-style sense of wonder.
Marissa Kelly is works with the Community Coordination team for New MexiCon. She is co-owner of Magpie Games and senior art director for John Wick Presents. In addition to her creative work, she spends her summers as a research assistant for both archaeological and paleontological sites.
Katherine Fackrell is the Community Co-Coordinator and Website Manager for New MexiCon. She is the proud recipient of the first New MexiCon IndieSomnia Award for playing too many games instead of sleeping, and is definitely not a vampire..
Sean Friend is a Marketing Coordinator for a local law firm, Slingshot Law and has joined New MexiCon’s Front of House team.  This is his first time being able to join the New MexiCon team as a volunteer rather than a participant.  He has created his own Board Games, Dastardly Deeds and Mystic Pizza, under his company Bananatee Games.  He has a passion for great storytelling, design, artwork, and gaming.  He is looking forward to this new and exciting experience at the next New MexiCon!
